loans.name: Zohirjon

texts.en:
F. Zohirjon is 30 years old and lives with his wife and 4 children. He has been a farmer for 10 years, since the time of his marriage. This work enables him to support his family and it is for this reason that he works so hard and with such determination.

Zohirjon enjoys planting tomato and onion on his land and he likes harvesting even more because this is when he can see and appreciate the high quality of his products. In general, the production of tomato and onion in his area is good and there is great demand for them. The most difficult part of the business is planting season, especially with the cost of fertilizers that are necessary for good yield. This is Zohirjon’s first loan through IMON International. He plans to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his crop.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура - пожилая женщина 1944 года рождения. Вдова и имеет 8-х детей. Манзура живет с двумя младшими сыновьями. Манзура откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, сын Манзуры продает их на скотном рынке. Манзура кредитуется в нашей организации 2 года. Она успешно закончила 4 предыдущих займов, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Манзура планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Манзура очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Manzura is an older woman, who was born in 1944. She is a widow with eight children, and lives with her two youngest sons. Manzura raises cattle at home, and when the cattle are ready, her son sells them at the livestock market. Manzura has been a loan customer at MicroInvest for two years, has successfully repaid four previous loans, and now would like another loan. She is planning to increase the size of her herd and thus increase her family's profits. Manzura is pleased with the terms of MicroInvest's loan program, and happy that there are such organizations supporting the public.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Mouy's Group

texts.en:
Mouy M., 33, has been chosen by the other members to be the leader of this group loan. She was married for years, but divorced her husband and has no children. She now lives alone and has a job as a grocery seller, selling her items to the neighbors who live near her house in the village. She is taking  out a loan to buy a quantity of grocery items in order to better meet her customer’s requirements.

There are four other borrowers who have joined this loan:

Paoch N. will use the loan to buy more nets and traps for fishing.

Muoy S. sells fish in the market and will use the loan to buy fresh fish to sell.

Chhay R. catches fish and is seeking a loan to purchase fishing equipment.

Reun S. will be using the loan to buy additional tools to make fishing easier.

loans.use: To buy a quantity of grocery items

loans.name: Promise Mbabazi Beatrice Group

texts.en: M. Beatrice is using this loan to purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, biscuits, sweets, millet flour, etc. in bulk. She is a married lady, age 30, blessed with four children going to school and looking after one dependent. She has been operating her retail business for over one year. She is an encouraging business lady whose future plan is to open up a hotel business as well.

loans.use: To purchase retail items such as sugar, salt, biscuits, sweets, millet flour, etc.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine Y. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 18 years old, married, and has an infant child. Catherine owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month. In June 2009, Catherine joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make food products for sale. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary sells sarongs and microwave ovens in her shop. She has been in business for the past 4 years. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Mary is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs, bags and microwave ovens to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and bags to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 66 years old. She has been farming rice for seven years. She used a loan from well-off people in her village to start her rice farm. Although the local loan had a high monthly interest rate, Erlinda had no choice but to take it, despite the risk, because she needed her own business to meet the needs of her two children, especially their education. 
Erlinda's husband is a farmer, so it was not a problem to find someone to look after and work in the rice field. 

When Erlinda joined Ahon Sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), she was able to get a low-interest loan for her business that was easy to pay, because the mode of payment depends on her ability to pay. She then stopped borrowing from usurious money lenders in her village. Since then, the woman's business started to earn larger profits. With her business profits, she has been able to expand her business and send her two children to college (one has already graduated), and she has started another business raising livestock in her back yard.

Erlinda is still an active member of ASHI and has maintained her good track record of repayment and attendance at weekly center meetings. She wants to borrow a larger amount to expand and improve her business. She wants her rice production business to become stable and profitable so she can help needy people and relatives in her village.

loans.use: To finance her rice farm

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua F. is married and has two children. She has completed junior high school. Ekua sells fish. She goes to the cold store and buys frozen fish which she fries for sale at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi. She has been doing this since 2004. Her husband is a farmer. Ekua uses her profits to help pay for school fees and utility bills.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase more frozen fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save money towards the building of a new house.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen fish to fry and sell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher N. is a 25-year-old father of two children, an 8-year-old and a 7-month-old. He is married to Priscilla Wambui. 

Christopher has been a motorbike taxi driver for five years. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. This is Christopher’s first loan from KADET. He has never before borrowed from any microfinance institution. Christopher will use this loan to service his motorbike.

In the future, he hopes to own a chain of taxi vehicles.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Servicing his motorbike

loans.name: Faith's Group

texts.en:
N. Faith is 56 years old. She is a determined and hardworking lady with a crafts and catering business that she has operated in Butebe for four years. She makes African crafts and arts and her major challenge is that the crafts materials are expensive, hence limiting her profit to 90,000/= a week.

Faith has a dream of expanding her business to start exporting her crafts as well as building rental accommodation for increased income. She needs a loan to help expand her business since the profits made from it help to pay school fees for her five children as well as enabling her to take care of other orphans.

loans.use: To buy materials for making more crafts

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita C. is from the village of NHA Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 53 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Nenita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income is from selling vitamins such as vitamin C tablets in the local community. Nenita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month.

In 2009, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nenita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Nenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her enterprise. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine M., age 35, is married and has 5 children between the ages of 3 to 13 years. She also cares for another dependent. Clementine has been selling soft drinks and milk since 2005. She employs 2 people in her business. She is a proven and hardworking entrepreneur who works from 8 AM to 10 PM every day.

Clementine is now requesting her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. She wants to buy a refrigerator, so she can sell cold drinks. This will allow her to expand her business and increase her sales significantly. She also hopes to attract many new customers. If her plan is successful, with the profits from her loan, Clementine will continue to pay school fees for her children and build a secure future for her young family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Zakaria Kingori

texts.en:
Zakaria, 25 years old and married with one son, has a shop in Kiringu Kikuyu where he sells mobile phone accessories. In the business for about two years, he earns a profit of approximately 40000 kenyan shillings a month.

Zakaria has never borrowed from any other MFI and was introduced to KADET by a friend. He wants to use the loan to buy more stocks of mobile phone accessories in order to meet the demand of his clients. He hopes to open another outlet in town that will be fully stocked with more than a million kenyan shillings worth of merchandise. He also wants to import accessories and become a wholesaler one day.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To add more stocks of mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer emprendedora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 37 años, ella se dedica a la venda de productos de belleza por catálogo y paralelamente brinda servicio de alquiler de motocar.

Rosa tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales uno es mayor de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es mecánico de maquinaria pesada. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Juntas hasta el final” desde hace cinco años.
El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que lo utilizó para comprar productos de belleza y venderlos a sus conocidos. 
En la actualidad Rosa necesita un crédito de 3000 soles que será utilizado para comprar un motocar de segundo uso. 
La meta de Rosa es comprar un motocar nuevo para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very enterprising and persevering woman. She lives in the Pucallpa region of Ucayali, and is 37 years old. She dedicates herself to selling beauty products from catalog and, concurrently, she provides a car rental service. Rosa has four children, of whom one is now grown. She counts on the support of her husband, who is a heavy machinery mechanic. She has been part of the “Together Until the End” cooperative bank for five years. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she used to buy beauty products to sell to her acquaintances. Currently, Rosa needs a loan of 3,000 soles to buy a used motocar. Rosa’s goal is to use the new motocar to improve her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a second used motocar.

loans.name: Lucila Sotera

texts.es:
La Sra. Lucila, tiene 52 años D. edad y vive en la casa D. su suegra, no tiene hijos; su actividad principal es la venta D. condimentos, el mismo que lo trae del desaguadero y lo venD. en la ciudad D. La Paz, su segunda actividad es la venta D. rellenos D. papa, postre y arroz en la plaza D. Los Heroes ubicado en la San Francisco todos los dias por las mañanas.

El Crédito solicitado es para utilizarlo como fondo en garantia en el Snack que piensa abrir, pues tiene que pagar el equivalente D. tres meses D. alquiler.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucila is 52 years old and lives in her mother-in-law’s home. She has no children. Her main activity is the selling of sauces and seasonings. She brings them from the city of Desaguadero and sells them in La Paz. Every morning she also sells stuffed potatoes, desserts and rice in the Los Heroes plaza found in the San Francisco. The loan she is soliciting is to be used as a guarantee fund for the snack store she is hoping to open. She has to pay the equivalent of three months of rent.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: guarantee fund for a store

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Ms. Juliana P. is 48 years old, single and operates a sari-sari (or variety) store in Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Mis. Occ. For the last five years, she has operated her shop even in hard times, and has consistently earned enough money to help support other family members, such as her parents and siblings and their respective families. 

She joined PAGLAUM MPC this year because she was interested in the products and services we offer and aware of an award our organization won in 2006. She has applied for her first loan, for PHP 7,000, to expand her store. She will also use the income made possible by this loan to meet her daily needs, pay bills and set money aside for the future. She is committed to see her business continue to grow and develop.

loans.use: to expand a sari-sari (or variety) store

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. V., 48, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Alexis D. V., a construction worker, and they are blessed with three children. Merlinda makes sure to help her husband earn an income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling assorted cosmetics and clothes for four years.

Merlinda has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow four times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to buy more products for her direct selling business, which lets her earn a profit of PHP 4,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying assorted cosmetic products and brand name clothes.

She dreams that her business will grow so that she can have enough resources for her children’s education. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy assorted cosmetic products and brand name clothes

loans.name: Justino Alonso

texts.es: Justino Alonso tiene 40 años, este hombre es una persona muy dedicada la venta de mercadería en general, no es el único trabajo que posee ya que además el labora en un lugar como mesero en el restaurante Tip- Top, el se levanta muy tempranos los días de semana para ofrecer su materia prima que es tan importante para ofrecer a ciertos clientes que obtiene. El necesita este capital de trabajo para la compra de sandalias, zapatillas, zapatos deportivos, vestidos, shorts, camisetas, ropa interior, pantalones y perfumes. El desea proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y no tiene todas las condiciones necesarias.
texts.en:
Justino Alonso is 40 years old. He is very dedicated to selling general merchandise. This is not the only work he has. He also works as a waiter in the Tip-Top restaurant. He gets up early during the week to offer his raw material, which is so important to sell to certain of his customers. He needs this working capital to buy sandals, shoes, tennis shoes, dresses, shorts, t-shirts, underwear, pants and perfume. He wants to make improvements on his home, and he does not have all of the necessary conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Afi

texts.en: Afi P. is 40 years old. She is married to a chief construction worker and has three children. Mrs. P. roams the city of Lomé selling colorful fabrics for dressmaking. She began this business in 2005 and is now asking for her second loan from WAGES. She will use this loan to resupply her stock of fabrics. By ensuring that her stock is plentiful, she will be able to keep up with the high demand for this popular item.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to sell

loans.name: Isaac Alexandre

texts.pt:
Isac Alexandre M. nasceu na vila de Namaacha na Fronteira da Suazilândia, vive maritalmente é pai de 2 filhos a primeira de 9 e o segundo de 4 anos. A mas velha esta no ensino primario e o novo no centro infantil. Para além dos filhos rsponsabiliza se pela sua mãe e sobrinho que vive  com ele em sua casa e não consegue poupar nenhum valor por mês pois encontra se a construir e não conta com ajuda da sua esposa que é desempregada.


Isac faz o Ensino Básico e não consegue ingrenar no Ensino Superior devido a falta de condições, ano seguinte candidata se a formação de professores e durante 2 anos consegue concluir e é afecto em Boane. Por ser longe de casa e da  familia. ele pede uma transferência para a Vila de Namaacha onde se encontra ate então dando aulas de educação fisica no periodo da manhã e de matemática no periodo da tarde auferindo mensalmente 5.560.00mt. Seis meses depois recebe um valor acomulado(salário após 6 meses de trabalho de graça) no valor de 35.000.00mt e da inicio da  própria obra que por motivos da subida de preços do material ele não consegue concluir o reboco e minimas partes da sua varranda. Primeiramante  aproxima se a hluvuku solicitando um empréstimo no valor 12.000.00mt para compra de alguns bens(fogao a gaz e um jogo de sofas,) e pagou cem nenhum problema.


Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Isac na Hluvuku e primriro com kiva. o primeiro de 12.000.00mt foi usado para comprar bens, o segundo de 6.000.00mt foi usado para comprar material de construção e este terceiro de 15.000.00mt serão também usados para o reboco e conclusão da varranda que por motivos climaticos é obrigado a ter que permanecer dentro de casa. Esta confiante que vai pagar antes do tempo previsto e pedir um novo  emprestimo para sua formação estudantil.
texts.en:
Isaac Alexandre M. was born in the town of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland. He is married and is the father of two children, a 9-year-old daughter and a 4-year-old son. The daughter is in elementary school, and the son is in preschool. Aside from the children, he is responsible for his mother and a nephew who live with him, and he does not manage to save anything because he is still building his house and cannot count on help from his wife, who is unemployed. Isaac completed school but did not attend college for financial reasons. After a year he got into teaching school, which he completed in two years and was employed in Boane. Because he was far from home and his family, he asked for a transfer to the town of Namaacha where he now teaches physical education in the mornings and math in the afternoons, earning 5,560 meticais per month. Six months after the transfer his salary of 35,000 meticais was paid retroactively, and he began building his own house. Because the price of materials rose, he could not finish the plastering and some parts of his veranda. He first approached Hluvuku asking for a loan of 12,000 meticais to buy a gas oven and a set of sofas, and he paid it off with no problems. This is Isaac's third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 12,000 meticais was used to buy the oven and sofas. The second loan, for 6,000 meticais, was used to buy construction material, and this third loan of 15,000 meticais will be used for plastering and for finishing the veranda which he must have because of the climate. He is confident that he will pay the loan off ahead of schedule and ask for a new loan to pay for further education.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly N., 41, earns $2 per day as a porter. Her husband, Mr. Chou Hor, is also working as a fish porter with her in the same location, where the fish are sold in bulk. They have seven children, two of whom are now married while the remaining five are single. One of their daughters is on the massage staff of a club. 

Ly N. has been building a new house for a long time, but the construction is never completed due to the need for more materials. Because Ly N. lacks money, she is looking for a loan in order to finish building a new house.

loans.use: To finish building a new house

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
Sorie K. is a trader who sells sticks and firewood (used for cooking). He own a boat which he used to purchase the wood and sticks from an island. Sorie is married with children, two of whom are in school while the youngest is just a baby.

He has 10 dependents who reside with and they usually help him in the business. He has been in this business for over 10 years.

He was a client under the solidarity group structure with good repayment history. He is therefore seeking for a loan which he will use to buy more sticks. He hopes to use proceeds from the business to build a house and cater to his children and dependents.

loans.use: To buy firewood and sticks

loans.name: Wroto For Business Group

texts.en:
Martha T. is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Wroto For Business. She is 48 years old and is a widow with six children who range from 12 to 30 years old. Martha could not continue her own education through high school due to family problems.

For fifteen years Martha has been selling provisions at the Airfield Wroto Town community in Sinkor, Monrovia, Liberia. She started her business with 4,000 Liberian dollars as working capital but now has about 30,000 Liberian dollars. She sells in an open area during the dry season in order to keep customers returning.

Martha’s goal and dream is to improve her business and build houses. She plan to use her 16,250 Liberia dollar portion of this 68,500 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase some charcoal and more provisions to improve her business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Martha is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase some charcoal and more provisions for her store

loans.name: Madres Unidas Del 7 De Octubre Group

texts.es:
“Madres Unidas del 7 de Octubre”, es una alcancía comunal que se encuentra ubicada en la 6ta zona de 7 de octubre, distrito de Ate, departamento de Lima,  conformado por 7 socios quienes se dedican a labores de servicio, comercio y producción minorista, es un grupo recién constituido por EDAPROSPO – prosperidad.
Carlos Alberto tiene 39 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, asume actualmente el cargo de presidente.
Desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta de periódicos y desde hace 2 años a la venta de cosméticos, se inicio en la venta de periódicos como ayudante y por las necesidades que había en su hogar, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha logrado mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de mantención el estudio de sus hijos. El gran sueño de Carlos es mejorar su vivienda y ampliar su negocio. El reciente préstamo será destinado para comprar mercadería. Nuestros socios agradecen la oportunidad que le han dado, e iniciativa para su constitución como Alcancía Comunal y prometen no defraudarlos y cumplir con sus respectivos pagos.
texts.en:
“Madres Unidas del 7 de Octubre” is a community bank located in the 6th zone of October 7th area, in the district of Ate, Lima department. The bank consists of seven members who work in services, business, and retail. They recently started working with Kiva partner, EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD. 39-year old Carlos Alberto is married and has two children. He is the current president of the group. For five years he has been selling newspapers, and also cosmetics for two years now. He started out as an assistant selling items to earn money for daily necessities. Through hard work he managed to improve his family’s standard of living. His income is sufficient to support his family and send his children to school. Carlos’s great dream is to improve his house and expand his business. The recent loan will be used to buy stock. Our members are grateful for this opportunity and for the initiative of the community bank. They promise not to disappoint and to make their respective repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.fr: Jeanne D'Arc N. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 04 enfants. Elle est membre fondateur du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULA et en est l'une des assistantes au comité de gestion. Elle a comme activité principale la vente sur table de produits divers, tel des denrées alimentaire et des légumes. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer son niveau désapprovisionnement dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfices afin de pouvoir faire face aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir aux siens.
texts.en:
Jeanne D'Arc N. is a 53-year old woman. She is divorced and lives with her four children. She is a member of the “Banc Villageois” Sinthiang Houla and is one of the assistants to the managing committee. Her main activity is the street sale of various products such as foodstuff and vegetables. With her new loan she will strengthen her level of supplies in order to make more profit. Her goal is to meet her family’s needs and her own.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her commercial activity.

loans.name: Katojo Development Association, Rukungiri Group

texts.en:
Hardworking K. Joram, aged 42, is the married father of seven children. He went into a carpentry business venture close to twenty-four years ago, having got this idea from his close friend.

Having a strategically located business in Buyanja, Kihihi town, in western Uganda, Joram gets many customers, earning him 400,000 Ugandan shillings monthly.

With this loan, Joram is looking forward to making purchases and restocking his business with more materials like timber and nails and also doing more advertising to increase the number of his customers. This will definitely give his enterprise a new push and also help him improve on his sales. Thus, he will also be able to take good care of his family requirements as his goal is to have his children educated to higher levels.

Joram also makes side profits from a small commercial farming business which was originally his main source of income before he ventured into carpentry.

loans.use: To purchase more  timber, nails, etc., and also to pay for radio adverts for his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buying pigs, milk, sausages, drinks, sugar, coffee, water, fruit, and flavorings

loans.name: Loida Del Socorro

texts.es: Loida del Socorro J. P. es una señora trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora que se dedica al comercio de ropa como camisas, camisetas, blusas, jeans, pantalones etc. Los cuales distribuye de manera ambulante por las calles de Managua.
texts.en:
Loida del Socorro J. P. is a hard working, dedicated, and enterprising woman. She sells clothing, such as shirts, t-shirts, blouses, jeans, pants, etc. She distributes these through the streets of Managua on foot.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan Z. is from the village of San Jose, Gingoog City. She is 30 years old and is married with two school-aged children.

Joan owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing and shoe products from a direct selling company in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Joan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: San Jose, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mrs. Vasna Maen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people make up this village bank loA. and they live in Kampong village in the Takeo province. Mrs. Vasna M., born in 1970, is the village bank president who was selected by the other members. They will use their portions of the loA. in various ways to support their families. 

Mrs. Vasna M. and her husband, Mr. Sokoeun Kong, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support their family; moreover, she is a Khmer cake seller in the local village while her husband is a barber. Through those activities, they are trying to work a lot but they cA. earn very little money to support their family. 

So to improve this condition, Mrs. Vasna M. is seeking a loA. to buy two piglets for breeding to start a new business. With the rest of the loA., she will purchase fertilizer. She is a mother of five children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while two others are studying in school and the youngest one is 6 years old.

loans.use: To buy two piglets for breeding

loans.name: Som-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Som-ol C. (in the photo) is a weaver and her husband, Mr. Chheng Pong, is a farmer. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for over 30 years and have four children:  three sons and one daughter. Som-ol and her husband are old, but they are still strong enough to work. 

Som-ol has asked for a Kiva loan two times already. She is now applying for her third loan of $450 to help her husband purchase fertilizers, fuel oil and seeds for farming.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, fuel oil and seeds for farming

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen meat, fish, pig tails, etc.

loans.name: Math

texts.en: Selling clothes is the main part of 30-year-old Math S.’s daily routine. She is a single woman who lives with her relatives in Phnom Penh City. She sells clothing for both men and women from her store in the local market. Math S. runs her business very well and her customers recognize the good service she provides. To sustain her business and expand in the future, Math S. would like a $800 loan to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila tiene 52 años, es separada  vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a criar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, en donde su hija es su principal apoyo, ya que la ayuda con la alimentación de éstos animales. Por otro lado, uno de la fuente de ingresos que también tiene es el alquiler de habitaciones, puesto que su casa tiene disponible espacios para arrendar. De esta manera es como se gana la vida, por un lado vende animales cada semana de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes, y por otro el alquiler de habitaciones. Ahora se intensifica en la siembra de alfalfa ya que es el alimento fundamental de los cuyes, para que pueda ofrecerlos a un buen precio. Por lo pronto espera ampliar su granja para que aumentar la producción de animales que tiene. Es su crédito número 14 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero. Asimismo le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Por tal agradece a todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la infraestructura de su granja, así como también desea comprar semillas para la siembra de más alfalfa.
texts.en:
Domitila is 52 years old, is separated and lives with her 3 children in their own home. For 30 years she has been raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  Her daughter supports her in feeding the animals.  Besides the animals, another source of income comes from renting rooms in her house.  Domitila feels that this is how she's making a living:  first she sells animals each week depending on her customers' needs and she rents rooms that are available.  Now she is focusing on planting alfalfa because it is the staple food of guinea pigs so that she can offer them at a good price.  And, she hopes that soon she can expand her farm, so that she can sell more animals.  

This is Domitila's 14th loan and is very happy to know she can have the financial support.  She also likes being part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and very supportive. For this, she gives thanks to all those who will be managing the loan request - it will be very useful in advancing her business.  This loan will be invested in the purchase of building materials to improve the infrastructure of her farm, and also to buy seeds for planting more alfalfa.

loans.use: Comprar materiales para ampliar su granja y semillas de alfalfa. (to purchase materials to expand her farm and alfalfa seeds)

loans.name: Santana

texts.es:
Doña Santana, reside en el Departamento de Usulután, tiene 41 años de edad, es comerciante de frutas, ella vive en compañía de sus hijos y es madre soltera.
Ella tiene su propio local donde vende las frutas desde hace 10 años, es una persona con experiencia en el comercio y sus hijos le ayudan a atender el negocio, actualmente ella quiere invertir en el negocio y comprar fruta de temporada pero no tiene las facilidades económicas para realizarlo es por tal razón que solicita un  préstamo y que este le dé la oportunidad de crecer con su negocio y dar una mejor atención a los clientes ofreciéndoles un amplio número y clases de frutas para todos los gustos.
Su objetivo es tener un negocio amplio y ofrecer a los clientes variedad de frutas para retenerlos y contar con su preferencia y de esta manera le estará dando mayor estabilidad a su actividad y a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Santana resides in the Department of Usulután. She is 41 years old and works as a fruit vendor. Santana is a single mother and lives with her children.

She has managed her own fruit stand for the past ten years. Santana is experienced in this line of work and her children help with managing the business. She currently wants to invest in her business by purchasing seasonal fruit, but she does not have the financial resources to make this happen. For this reason, she is requesting a loan that will give her the opportunity to grow her business and provide better service to her customers. She will be able to offer them a greater number of fruits to cater to all tastes.

Her goal is to have a larger business and offer her customers a variety of fruits so that she can retain them and hold on to their business. This will provide more stability for her business and her family.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal fruit

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Doña Ramona  tiene 47 años de edad  está casada hace 18 años, tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edad.  
         La señora Ramona  hace más de 20 años que se dedica a   tejer frazadas y manteles artesanales, ella misma se encarga de venderlos ya que  la mayoría de sus hijos viven por la capital,  viaja una vez al mes y le resulta muy rentable su producto.
         Gracias  a su trabajo y esfuerzo pudo brindarles a sus hijos todas las comodidades y a la vez hacerles estudiar. 
         Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos y color para tejer hamacas ya que en ésta temporada lo solicitan mucho sus clientes.
texts.en: Ramona is 47 years old, has been married for 18 years, and has 4 grown children.  For more than 20 years, Ramona has been weaving handmade blankets and tablecloths.  She herself sells them, since most of her children live in the capital.  She travels once a month, and her products are very profitable for her.  Thanks to her work and efforts, she was able to provide her children will all the necessary comforts and an education.  She requests this loan to buy threads and dyes to make hammocks, as they are in great demand by her customers during this season.

loans.use: To purchase colored threads and fabric dyes.

loans.name: Norjmaa

texts.en:
Norjmaa D. is 47 years old and lives with her three children and husband in a Mongolian nomadic dwelling called a ger in the Chigeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband helps her with her business, her oldest son attends university, and her two daughters attend high school. Her husband is also very good at making wooden products, thus adding profits to their family earnings. 

Norjmaa operates a cooking oil trading business.  The oil is made from animal fat. She buys animal fat in large amounts and makes cooking oils in her storehouse next to her home.  She sells them to the sellers in the Huchit Shonhor market, one of the largest market in the city. 

For the future, she hopes to continue the stable operation of her business and to expand. Norjmaa is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of animal fat when the price for such product is cheap.

loans.use: To purchase animal fats in bulk

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos Enrique tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su madre en sector Cruz de la Esperanza, una zona urbano – marginal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, una zona bastante comercial, es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Estudió en la universidad de la zona Agronomía y los conocimientos que adquirió le han servido para conseguir un trabajo de vendedor de insumos químicos para brindar mantenimiento a diversos cultivos. El cuenta con un grupo de clientes que ha podido ganarse con el tiempo y a los cuales visita regularmente ofreciéndoles sus productos que brinda y brindándoles asesoría. Esta actividad le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Su madre esta separada y el trata siempre de apoyarla para sacar adelante a sus hermanos.

Carlos desea realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda, de este modo desea brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Carlos Enrique is 25 years old, single and lives with his mother in the Cruz de la Esperanza sector, an urban area on the outskirts of Chiclayo. Chiclayo is a commercial district and the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Carlos studied Agronomy at university and the knowledge that he gained in that course has helped him to gain employment selling chemical supplies to maintain various crops. Carlos has a group of clients who he visits regularly, providing them with both products and consultancy services. This has helped him to earn a living, cover his personal costs and support his family. As his mother is separated, Carlos has always tried to help her to bring up his siblings.

Carlos would like to make some improvements on his home to afford his family a better quality of life, which is why he is now applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To make improvements on his home

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maria D. Carmen; La socia tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, La socia trabaja  junto a su madre en la librería cristiana, ella elabora también manualmente todo tipo y contrubuyó junto a su madre con sus ahorros para que hicieran posible el sueño de mamá, ella desea el préstamo para junto a su madre invertir en la librería cristiana. La socia solicita le préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de libros y dar últimos acabados a su librería. La socia solicita el préstamo para la adquisición de libros cristianos para implementar su librería.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Maria D. Carmen, 27, is a member of the “PADRE ETERNO” (Eternal Father) communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province.

She is single.  She works alongside her mother in a Christian bookstore.  She also makes all kinds of crafts.  She contributed her savings so that her mother’s dream could become a reality.  She wants the loan to invest it, together with her mother, in the Christian bookstore.  She is asking for the loan to acquire books and to do the final finishing touches to the bookstore.  She is asking for the loan to acquire Christian books to stock her bookstore.

She is happy with the granted loan and commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy Christian books for her bookstore.

loans.name: Masereka

texts.en: Masereka is a twenty five year old married man with two children and owns a house in Kasese Uganda. He has operated a retail shop for two years which he started with a capital of 500,000 shillings and has increased his capital to 1,800,000 shillings. His vision is to expand his business out to Bwera  (at the boarder with congo) and to educating his children. Masereka requests the loan to buy clothes, rice, sugar and flour to resell.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clothes, rice, sugar and flour to resell.

loans.name: Elena Nancy

texts.es: Elena tiene 36 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos de 03,08 y 16 años de edad ella cuenta con una bodega ubicada en su propio domicilio, adicionalmente labora en el fundo Manuelita como obrera de campo,el sueño de Elena es tener un puesto en el Mercado Toledo para poder tener un negocio mas rentable y brindarle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida,el dinero del financiamiento sera destinado para la compra de una refrigeradora.
texts.en: Elena is 36 years old, a single mother, living in her own home with her three children, 3, 8, and 16 years of age.  She has a grocery story located in her home, and she also works in the Manuelita farm as a field hand.  Elena’s dream is to have a stand in the Toledo Market, to have a more profitable business and offer her children a better living.  Money from the loan will be used to buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is a married woman who lives in Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pig fattening business and a fishing business. Her husband Jerry, who is 46 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between 13 and 20 years old. Sandra joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Sandra has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th loan, she is borrowing PHP 22,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future business expansion and her children's education. Sandra is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on http://www.kiva.org

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Riyad

texts.en:
Riyad is a 45-year-old married man, living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and two children. Riyad has worked as a car repairer for 22 years, and he opened his own business in 2002. 

He is a hard worker. He loves his job a lot and seeks to improve it and to be up to date with the new professional tools so that he can do certain new types of maintenance for his current clients and attract new ones. 

Riyad is requesting  a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new professional tools necessary for his business. He hopes to improve his business more and to afford a relaxing vacation with his family.

loans.use: To buy new professional tools for his business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok K., 41, is married and resides with her family in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated city in the country. K. is a cleaner at a private company, earning an income of USD 10 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 65 on food and USD 29 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a sugarcane squeezer to produce sugarcane juice to sell. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a sugarcane squeezer

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en: Thlang S., who is 30 years old, owns a small shop located along the big road where she sells perfume, cooking ingredients, soft drinks, food, candy, and other necessary goods. She typically makes around $2 of profit each day to use for family expenses. She has been married for many years to Men Sorl, who is 31 and a firewood seller. They have three single children who still live with them. Thlang S.’s husband wishes to have more funds to increase his capital for buying additional firewood for resale. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To assist her husband with buying additional firewood for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy DVDs and VCDs for his business

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo es una madre de familia de  dos niños y tiene 41 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo en el caserío (comunidad de pobladores de clase baja)  de SAQA, en el distrito de Zaña  ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo. Esta comunidad es conocida por sus actividades agrícolas y por el buen desarrollo y desempeño de sus s pobladores en éstas.

Consuelo tiene muy buenas referencias personales en su caserío, es conocida por ser una persona amable y atenta con los demás y además por ser una madre cariñosa y dedicada a sus niños. 

Consuelo se dedica al cultivo de fréjol y ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme  Alternativa, para poder invertir en los fertilizantes y maquinarias que le faltan y también para poder saldar las cuentas con los trabajadores que le ayudan a mejorar sus tierras de cultivo.

Consuelo tiene experiencia crediticia con buenas referencias en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Consuelo is the mother of two children.  She’s 41 years old and lives with her husband in the SAQA hamlet (a community of low income residents) in Zaña District located in Chiclayo Province.  This community is known for its farming activities and for the good farming practices of its residents.
Consuelo has very good personal references in her hamlet.  She’s known to be a kind person who looks after others and also for being an affectionate mother who is devoted to her children.

Consuelo farms broad beans and has asked for a 3000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer and some machinery she’s lacking as well as to pay workers that help her improve her farmland.

Consuelo has experience with loans and has good references in Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and harvesting machinery.

loans.name: Charlita

texts.en:
Charlita is from the village of Mitacas, Baliangao Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Charlita is married and has four adult children. Charlita has a business that provides lamination services to her community. Charlita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2800 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Charlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Charlita is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials for lamination. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Charlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC: 

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for lamination

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is a married woman with 4 children. She is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan del sur. She has been growing rice for 8 years. She earns 15,000 PHP per month doing farming.

This loan will be used to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. In the future, she hopes to improve her farm and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 57-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. 

He has 30 years of experience working as a farmer and has been running his own farm since 1990. He cultivates all types of vegetables and he distributes his harvest to specific agricultural markets that he works with. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds in order to increase his business productivity. In the future, he is planning to further expand his business and cultivate exotic fruits.

loans.use: to purchase new farming supplies such as fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina nació en la ciudad de Cusco (Perú) y tiene 42 años de edad. Actualmente, Luz Marina vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Luz Marina  es estilista de profesión y trabaja en el salón de belleza de una amiga. Ya son cuatro años que se dedica a este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales de trabajo como tijeras, champoos, acondicionador, tintes y otras cosas más. La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Chaska Ñawi” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Luz Marina was born in Cusco, Perú and is 42 years old.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born.  Luz Marina works as a stylist and works in her friend's beauty salon.  She has done this work for four years, and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  

Luz Marina is asking for this loan to purchase materials she needs for work such as scissors, shampoo, conditioner, dyes, and other items.  She is a responsible and hard-working person, and thanks to these qualities, her friends invited her to join the Chaska Ñawi community bank with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to purchase scissors, shampoo, conditioner, dyes, and other items.

loans.name: Ainura's Group

texts.en:
Ainura, 36, is the leader of this group. Ainura is a highly experienced cook in one of the small cafes in the  town of Tup. She and her husband have two high school age children who depend on their parents financially. Her husband works as a construction worker in order to attain improvements in the economic state of the family.  Ainura has faced difficulties at her work due to an increasing slump in average income of the town residents. This has lessened the  demand for services including restaurant service. Two years ago a considerable portion of family capital was invested in a new business start up. 7 000 soms were used for the purchase of a young calf for fattening and reselling. A monthly profit of 3 000 soms made it possible for her to make home improvements and construct a shed for livestock. Ainura has applied for a loan from Kiva with the purpose of purchasing three head of livestock for further fattening and reselling. In the future, Ainura hopes to help her children get  college education. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Yah

texts.en: Yah is 31 years old and lives in Paynesville. She is a High School graduate. She is married and her husband buys and sells used laptops and other electrical equipment. They have two children both of whom live at home and attend school. Yah sells palm oil, salt, and other foodstuffs which she delivers to her customers. Her main difficulty is unexpected fluctuations in the level of business. She learn this business from her mother. She is proud to run her own business as it gives her independence. She’s requesting a loan to expand her range of products. In the future, she wants to further her own education.

loans.use: to expand her range of products

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 51 years old, married to Rose, and they have two school-going children. He has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. 

He was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting, and he will also use some part of the cash to pay his casual worker.

In future, he hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer and pay for labour.

loans.name: Nayef

texts.en: Nayef is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents and two siblings. He has eight years of experience working as a plumber. Four years ago, he started to work independently. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools for his business. He is willing to work closely with multiple projects and needs to get ready to be in the requisition of the clients. Nayef hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his business

loans.name: Gloria Aracely

texts.es: Gloria Aracely de 38 años de edad, habita en casa propia con su querida hija Marta de 16 años de edad la cual se encuentra estudiando. Gloria es caracterizada por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora. Su principal inspiración es su hija por la cual hace todo para poder darle lo mejor y lograr mejorar su condición de vida. Gloria se dedica a la costura. Ella diseña bonitas prendas de vestir las cuales vende en las principales colonias de la zona donde ella habita. Gracias a su dedicación y calidad en su trabajo ha logrado establecer mucha clientela y es muy conocida ya que ella siempre diseña los mejores vestidos, faldas, blusas, etc. y además los precios son muy accesibles. Este negocio lo ha tenido por mucho tiempo y es el que le ha permitido sacar adelante por si sola a su hija. Gloria sueña con ampliar su negocio y poder ofrecer sus productos a un mayor número de clientes pero para esto necesita cierta cantidad de dinero con la cual no cuenta. Es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: diferentes telas, hilos, tijeras, etc. todo esto para tener la posibilidad de elaborar mayor número de prendas de vestir y poder  ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de sus productos.  Espera poder tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida a partir de esta decisión.
texts.en:
Gloria Aracely is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her dear daughter, Marta, 16, who is a student. Gloria is characterized as being a responsible, hardworking and, above all, enterprising woman. Her primary inspiration is her daughter for whom she does all she can to give her the best and to improve their standard of living.

Gloria is a seamstress. She designs lovely items to wear which she sells in the major neighborhoods of the area where she lives. Thanks to her dedication and the quality of her work she has succeeded in acquiring many clients and is very well known since she always designs the best dresses, skirts, blouses etc. and also because her prices are very reasonable. She has had this business for a long time and it is what has allowed her and her daughter to get ahead.

Gloria dreams of expanding her business and of being able to offer her products to a greater number of customers, however to do this she needs a certain a certain amount of money which she does not have. It is for this reason that she is requesting this loan from Integral, with the goal of investing it in necessary raw materials such as different fabrics, thread, scissors, etc. all of this to be able to produce a greater number of garments and offer her customers a greater variety of her items. Because of this decision, she hopes to have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials such as different fabrics, thread, scissors, etc.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business. His potential customers are neighbours and passersby. He faces the major challenge of competition in his business. Abdalla dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 loan which he is requesting, he wants to add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To add to his savings and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Las Déboras Group

texts.es:
Doña Karla es la Tesorera de Banco Mujer Las Déboras, con 33 años de edad madre sola, jefa de hogar, vive con sus 4 hijos todos menores de edad, estudiantes de primaria y secundaria.  Se enteró de los servicios de Fundación Mujer por medio de unas encuestas realizadas en la zona de Siquirres, y está es la primera solicitud de crédito de este grupo.  

Ella se dedica a la elaboración pan, empanadas y otros productos de panadería, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar, levadura, queso y más insumos para la elaboración de sus productos. 
Ella empezó a vender pan para obtener ingresos económicos para ella y su familia, y los principales obstáculos que ha tenido que enfrentar es la falta de dinero para comprar materia prima, así como la de un vehículo para transportar sus productos. 
El día de Karla empieza muy temprano para poder hacer todo el pan, entregarlo temprano, y luego se dedica a sus labores domésticas, y cuidar de sus hijas pequeñas. 
El sueño de Karla es tener su propia panadería en el centro de la cuidad donde vive, y no tener que hacerlo en su casa. El crédito va ser de gran ayuda para ella y sus 6 compañeras del grupo que van a invertir en actividades comerciales y de pequeña industria.
texts.en:
Karla is Treasurer of the Las Déboras Women's Bank group. She is 33 years old, the head of her household, and lives with her four children who are in elementary and high school. She signed up with Fundación Mujer [Kiva field partner] through some interviews in the Siquierres area and this is her first loan with this group. 

Karla bakes bread, empanadas, and other baked goods and with this loan she will purchase flour, butter, sugar, yeast, cheese, and other supplies for her baking. She started selling bread to earn some money for herself and her family. Her main obstacles have been the lack of money to buy primary ingredients, as well as the lack of a car to transport her products. Karla's days begin very early so she can bake her bread and distribute it. After that, takes care of household work and cares for her young daughters. 

Karla's dream is to own her own bakery downtown in her city, rather than work out of her house. This loan will be a great help to her and her six fellow group members, who will also invest in retail and small businesses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for baking bread.

loans.name: Tuzamurane Nº2 / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
David fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane no 2 / RSZ. Le nom du groupe signifie «let’s support each other». Il a 42 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 5 à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.

David est cultivateur de riz. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimique. Dans les prochaines années, David voudrait acheter d’autres champs pour la culture de riz. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
David is a member of the Tuzamurane no 2 - Rusizi group. The name of the group means “Let’s support each other”. He is 42 years old married with five children between the ages of 5 and 16 years old. Four of them are in school. He has three years of  secondary education.

David is a rice farmer. This is his second loan from ACB and he is going to use it to buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

He plans to grow his business by using chemical fertilizers. In the next few years, David would like to purchase other fields for rice farming. With the profits he makes he is planning to educate his children.

loans.use: buy chemical fertilizers for his rice farming activity.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras” se formó con L. unión D. varias vecinas D. L. ciudad D. Mariano Roque Alonso. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes. Ellas formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz D. realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
Una D. las integrantes del grupo es L. señora Vicenta, elL. se dedica  a L.  venta D. comidas, trabajo mediante el cual elL. logra mantener a su familia y logra paliar los gastos diarios. ElL. se define como una señora muy creativa y trabajadora. Comenta que sus clientes quedan muy admirados con sus platillos, ya que tiene muy buenas manos para las comidas.
ElL. solicita el préstamo para L. compra D. carne, condimentos, pollos y demás, los cuales son ingredientes esenciales para sus alimentos.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Emprendedoras” was formed when several neighbours from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined forces. All the members of the communal bank have independent businesses. They formed a tightly knit group, capable of undertaking activities together that strengthen their partnership. One of the members of the group is Señora Vicenta. She sells food, work with which she manages to take care of her family and offset the daily expenses. She describes herself as a very creative and hardworking woman. She tells us that her customers are full of praise for her dishes as she has a gift for cooking. 

She is asking for a loan with which to buy meat, seasonings, chickens and other ingredients which are essential for her dishes.

loans.use: to buy meat, seasonings, chickens and more.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be polite, welcoming, and ambitious. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a shopping centre and her primary customers are the local people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of items. Her business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to the university level.

loans.use: To add to her stock of items

loans.name: Lhagvadulam

texts.en:
Lhagvadulam is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. 

Her husband is a healthy strong man who works as a builder. Their two eldest children are school students. 

She operates a clothes trading business. She has been working as a seller in the "Mon mandal" market since 2005. Now that she has 900,000 MNT in current assets,  she is earning a salary. 

She is an unpliant and gentle woman who says, "Even [though] I am satisfied with my work and salary, I need more income, because our family's usage is rising too, as my children grow." 

She needs 1,300,000 MNT loan for buying winter clothes such as boots, coats and scarves, etc.

loans.use: To buy winter clothes such as boots, coats and scarves, etc.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cristy works hard to support her family.
She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Cristy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.
Cristy has sustained her business activities with her four previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment

loans.name: Localidad  Del Carrizo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Localidad del Carrizo  está conformado por nueve integrantes indígenas que hablan el idioma mixteco.
Ellas nos comentan que con el nombre de su grupo se identifican con sus creencias y sus tradiciones  ya que todas las integrantes son de la misma comunidad  y todas son personas indígenas y trabajadoras.
Una de  las integrantes del grupo es la señora  Olivia quien se dedica a la venta de trastes de la marca tupeer ware  ya que se va a pueblos vecinos a ofrecer su mercancía.
Tiene con su negocio aproximadamente  cuatro años , ella nos platica que empezó a vender productos de Arabela pero no le dejaba buenas ganancias ya que en su localidad  las personas casi no se maquillan  y en los pueblos vecinos eran poco lo que vendía  así fue   que decidió vender  trastes por catalogo y darlos en tres pagos semanales.
Doña Olí es así  como la llaman sus compañeras de grupo  está felizmente casada con el señor Alfonso de  treinta y cuatro años de edad , don Poncho le ayuda  a su esposo a  vender ya que los fines de semana van a los pueblos vecinos visitar a sus familiares y llevan su mercancía para  ofrecerlas.
Tienen  tres hijos dos mujeres Michel  de doce años de edad, Miriam de nueve años de edad y un  pequeño niño Alfonso Damián de cinco años de edad.
Doña Olí pidió el préstamo para  la compra de más trastes como son: hoyas, toperes, vasos y sartenes.
Está muy contenta  por la oportunidad que le ha dado fundación para seguir con su negocio y hacerlo más grande y por ayudar a todas sus compañeras para  cumplir sus sueños que es crecer  y ayudar a sus familias.

Las otras personas que integran el grupo son:
Feliciana- se dedica a la venta de  pescado.
Floribertha – se dedica a la venta de  comida.
Patricia Juana- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Emma- se dedica  a la venta de  pollos.
Jerónimo  Rolando- se dedica a la venta de  frutas y legumbres.
Jerónimo  Francisco- se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras.
Reina - se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Reyna  Matilde- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Gracias fundación por ayudar a las personas de pueblos con deseos de superación.
texts.en:
This group is called “Localidad del Carrizo” and consists of nine indigenous individuals who speak the Mixtec language. They say that they chose this name for their group because they identify themselves according to their beliefs and traditions. All of them are from the same community and are hard workers who are of indigenous descent.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Olivia, who sells utensils of the Tupperware brand. She travels to neighboring towns in order to offer her merchandise. Olivia has been in business for approximately four years. She says that she started out selling Arabela products (a line of cosmetics and personal care products), but she was not able to generate good profits because the people in her town rarely use makeup. In addition, she sold very little in the neighboring towns so she decided to sell utensils through catalogs. She accepts payments in three weekly installments.

Doña Olí, as she is called by the other members of her group, has been happily married to Sr. Alfonso (Poncho) for 34 years. Don Poncho helps his wife sell on the weekends when they travel to the neighboring towns. Whenever they visit relatives, they bring merchandise to offer to them. They have three children, two daughters and a son. Michel is 12 years old, Miriam is 9 years old, and little Alfonso Damián is 5 years old. Doña Olí is requesting a loan in order to buy utensils such as wash basins, containers, glasses, and frying pans. She is pleased with the opportunity that Fundación Realidad has given her so that she can continue her business and make it larger. Olivia is also grateful that the organization is assisting all of the members so that they can fulfill their dreams of growing and helping their families.

The other members of the group are as follows: • Feliciana sells fish. • Floribertha sells food. • Patricia Juana sells food. • Emma sells chickens. • Jerónimo Rolando sells fruits and legumes. • Jerónimo Francisco sells fruits and vegetables. • Reina sells cheese. • Reyna Matilde sells food.

They thank Fundación Realidad for helping people from small towns who want to succeed.

loans.use: to purchase household utensils.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 30-year-old, married woman with two children, both of them are in school. Esther has had a business of selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for 3 years. She is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a thirty-nine-year-old hardworking lady with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and build a permanent house. She has been in a retail shop business for the period of three years, and her major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and customers not paying on time. However, she has a vision of moving her business to a more permanent area. The purpose of the loan is to buy eggs and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy eggs and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Chavasinya

texts.en:
Chavasinya, age 40, is a farmer in Kitake. He has five solid years of experience in farming. Maize, vegetables, and beans are his main produce, which he sells at the local market. He also trades in livestock in addition to active farming.

He and his wife have six children, the eldest of whom is 12 years old. The youngest is a nine-month-old baby.

Chavasinya has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo in order to buy poultry birds. This will enable him to venture into poultry farming, which will be a valuable new source of income, particularly since his farming endeavors face the ongoing obstacles of the high costs of inputs and unreliable rains. He hopes his new business will grow and and enable him to embrace modern techniques in poultry farming. He intends in this way to exploit the economies of scale that present the main challenge for most small farmers to do their farming with limited capacity.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds

loans.name: Pascuala Ignacia

texts.es:
Pascuala es una madre de familia de 48 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de dos hijos de los cuales ya solo uno se encuentra estudiando, está familia vive en una comunidad del caserío Chirijcruz.
Pascuala para  obtener sus ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad de vida se dedica a la producción de banano, con esta actividad lleva 20 años, pero para obtener mejores ingresos también se dedica a la producción de café.
Pascuala con el deseo de incrementar su cultivo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo, ya que ella quiere aprovechar la oportunidad que se le está presentando pero no tiene el dinero suficiente por tal razón guarda las esperanzas de conseguir su préstamo.
