Su gran sueño es incrementar su cultivo para mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Mrs. Queen E. is married with 8 children. She has benefited from a LAPO loan since 2000. She is from Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She plans to increase her furniture business if granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy more wood for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph lives in the Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam. He is married with six children. He is the owner of M. shop. He opened this shop five years ago after getting a loan from Akiba Commercial Bank (ACB). Since then his shop has been in good shape and attracts more customers. Recently two shops have been opened adjacent to him that threaten his market share. Joseph wants to maintain his market share by adding some items which his competitors do not have. This could be a competitive advantage to him. He is requesting a loan of USD 750.

loans.use: Increase stock of shop items

loans.name: Têko

texts.fr:
Born in Aklakou in 1968, Mr. F. Teko is married and the father of five children. His wife has a small-business where she sells foodstuffs to local school establishments. This activity means that his wife is not able to help with the housework. A professional driver, Mr. F. takes his passengers from Aklakou, his town, to Lome, the capital city, in his taxi whose motor has fallen into disrepair. Educated all the way to Secondary School, Mr. Teko has 15 years experience in his profession. In order for him to re-launch his business, he needs a good quality car. This is why he is asking for a loan of $1,200.00, to purchase a new motor and to replace certain parts. With these repairs, he and his family can re-find the joy of life and to meet their nutritional, schooling and sanitary needs.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Né à Aklakou en 1968, Monsieur F. Têko est marié et père de cinq enfants. Sa femme est une petite commerçante qui vend des denrées alimentaires dans des établissements scolaires de son milieu. Cette activité ne permet pas à cette dernière d’aider Mr. FOOLY Têko dans les charges du ménage. Chauffeur de profession, il fait aujourd’hui le transport des passagers entre Aklakou son village et Lomé la capitale du pays avec son taxi dont le moteur est totalement usé. Instruit de niveau secondaire, Mr. Têko a une quinzaine d’année d’expérience dans son métier. Aujourd’hui, pour relancer son activité, il lui faut une voiture de bonne qualité. C’est pour cela qu’il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 pour acheter un nouveau moteur et pour changer certaines pièces. Ainsi, lui et sa famille pourront retrouver goût à la vie et faire face aux besoins alimentaires, scolaires et en soins de santé de la famille..

loans.use: To purchase a new motor and to replace some parts.

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en: Zinaida O. operates a small footwear stand in the bazaar of the northeastern Aerbaijani town of Khachmaz. Zaida is married and has raised four children in Khachmaz. Zaida is looking for funding so that she can increase and diversity her inventory for the coming change of the seasons. Zaida has already successfully repaid three prior loans, and has proven herself a worthy customer.

loans.use: To increase and diversify her inventory.

loans.name: Sera

texts.en: Sera is a hard-working woman that tends to her taro plantation every day of the week.  She is able to sell two full sacks of taro at the Fugalei market every Saturday.  She does not mind the half-hour trip from Saanapu into town because she knows there is always a high demand for her products.  Her business earns her a profit of $130 weekly after all expenses, which keeps her family going through hard times.  It also gives her a chance to receive further loans from SPBD, which allows her to keep her business going strong.

loans.use: To expand her plantation by buying supplies and equipment

loans.name: Polonia Dominguez

texts.en:
Polonia is a 34-year-old single mother of four children, three boys and a girl. They all are above the age of fifteen and attend school. Since her separation from her husband, ten years ago, she has supported herself and her offspring by selling women’s used clothing in her community.

She says that this activity has been very profitable and has helped her contribute to the well-being of her family. But every day other needs arise which must be satisfied. She hopes to someday to sell the clothes from her own store and not have to operate business at home or a public place.

With her loan, she will buy clothing in bulk in order to limit number of trips she has to make outside of her community. That way, she will increase her sales volume and improve her profit margin.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk in order to increase sales volume and income.

loans.name: Faalaniga

texts.en: Faalaniga is 58 years of age and a mother of six children. She always supports her husband by working their taro plantation six days a week. She hardly ask her family living overseas for any financial support because she  takes 3-4 bags of taro to the market twice a week and earns more than $300.00-$400.00 WST ($120-160.00 USD) a month. She is applying for another loan from SPBD Program in order to keep taking her children to school and to extend her 4 acre taro plantation.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Maria Ligia

texts.es:
Maria Ligia G. is a mother of three children in scholastic age. She is a hard worker that has dedicated her self to sell clothes for the last 30 years in the city of Leon in the Station market. She started her business with a total of U$ 200, that were her savings through her housewife life, that was her occupation before she started to sale clothes.

In spite of the difficult economic situation that she is going trough because of the very low sales, she does not lose the hope that her business will excel and will generate greater income to maintain her three dear children. Ceprodel has support her and give her loans that have fortified her business and have improved the situation of her house. Her present need is to invest in greater amounts of clothes in order to keep providing for her family.

Maria Ligia G. es madre de tres hijos en edad escolar; es muy esforzada ya que se dedica a la venta de ropa que tiene desde hace 30 años en la ciudad de León específicamente en el mercado la Estación. Inició con un total de U$ 200 (Doscientos dólares) producto de sus ahorros realizados a lo largo de su vida cuando realizaba el trabajo de ama de casa que era su dedicación antes de tener la venta de ropa.

A pesar de la difícil situación económica que atraviesa debido a que las ventas están muy bajas, elle no pierde las esperanzas de que su negocio sobresaldrá y le generará mayores ingresos para mantener a sus tres queridos hijos. Por esta razón Ceprodel le ha brindado mucho apoyo con la entrega de créditos que le han fortalecido su negocio y han mejorado la situación de su vivienda. Su necesidad actual invertir en mayores cantidades de ropa para así satisfacer sus necesidades y las de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy Clothes and resale  them

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru:
Rajabgul S., 42, lives in Fayzabad district. She is a married mother of eight. Rajabgul has a secondary school education and does not work outside the home. However, she has been in business raising cows for sale and for their milk for five years. Rajabgul is applying for a loan to buy a milk cow. She will sell the milk to wholesalers, earning a good profit. This will allow her to make payments on the loan, and the cow will remain hers when all has been repaid. Rajabgul plans to repay her loan within 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer.

Сайфуддинова Раджабгуль проживает в районе Файзабад.Возраст 42 года Замужем имеет 8 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка, но занимается животноводством. Разводит коров на продажу и для продажи молока. Занимается этим бизнесом клиентка уже 5 лет. На планируемый кредит хочет купитьдойную корову которая будет довать молоко.Молоко будет продаваться оптовым покупателям, что будет давать неплохой доход . Это позволит погашать кредит, а корова останется в прибыль хозяевам. Погашать кредит клиентка планирует в течении 15 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria Mercedes S. R. is a member of the Community Bank "Los Eucaliptos" located in the district of Tarapoto in San Martín province in the San Martín region. She works preparing and selling food in a specially adapted area of her home, located in the housing development Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril . She tends daily to her clients, many of whom are students of the national university, which is located very close to her home.

Her experience preparing a wide variety of dishes, her talent for seasoning her tasty dishes and her need to generate her own income in order to ensure her only daughter's education motivated her to launch her own business selling lunchtime meals as a daily menu: 2 courses, a beverage and dessert for a set price.

With the loan of 2000 soles(Peruvian currency), which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of chairs, tables, tablecloths and a variety of cooking utensils. This purchase will allow her to offer more comforts and better service to her clients. She will also buy nonperishable ingredients for the preparation of her dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Mercedes S. R., es socia del Banco Comunal ”Los Eucaliptos” ubicado en el distrito de Tarapoto, provincia de San Martín, departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, en un ambiente acondicionado especialmente en su propia casa, ubicada en el Pueblo Joven 9 de Abril, atendiendo diariamente a alumnos de la Universidad nacional ya que su local se ubica cerca de esta institución educativa. Su experiencia en la preparación de diversos platos de comida, su buena sazón y la necesidad de tener un ingreso propio para asegurar la educación de su única hija la impulsaron a poner su propio negocio de venta de comida diaria tipo menú.

Con el préstamo de S/. 2,000.00,el cual será pagado en 4 meses lo invertirá en la compra de sillas, mesas, manteles y diversos utensilios de cocina para así dar una mejor comodidad y atención a sus comensales. asimismo comprara insumos no perecibles, para la elaboración de los platos de comida.

Maria Mercedes es una mujer muy amorosa y decidida, tiene 36 años y una hija, vive con su actual pareja y sueña con tener un Restaurante.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 42 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 4 to 20 years old. Roda is a clothes seller, and she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 am to 4 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Moe

texts.en: Moe A., 56, is married and has 10 children.  She has four years of experience running a retail shop, and sells her goods to the people of her community at the public market six days per week. Her husband works with her. In the past, she has taken out seven loans from SPBD, and she now expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $500. SPBD loans are Moe’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to improve and repair her house; the balance will go toward restocking her business.

loans.use: To buy new inventory for her shop

loans.name: Odisea

texts.es:
Odisea is a 42 year-old mother of two. Presently she sells food in front of the facilities of an educational center offering a variety of dishes to students and teachers. As a single mother she has been able to improve remarkably her life quality through this activity and today, thanks to the demand of her food she wishes to build a small space where she can receive her customers comfortably. This dream can come true if your significant support reaches her at this moment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Odisea tiene 42 años de edad y es madre de 02 hijos. Actualmente se desempeña frente a las instalaciones de un centro educativo ofertando diversos alimentos para los estudiantes y maestros. Con su actividad, debido a que es madre soltera, ha podido mejorar notablemente su calidad de vida y ahora gracias a la demanda de sus alimentos está deseosa de construir un pequeño espacio para recibirlos con comodidad. Y este sueño podrá hacerse realidad si vuestra importante ayuda llega a ella en estos momentos.

loans.use: Build a secure and comfortable sales space.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M.Rafique and lives in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She is the mother of four sons and three daughters. For the last six years, her husband has made a living running a clothing-making business. Nasreen has successfully repaid one loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan), and is now applying for a new loan so her husband can buy more garments and expand his business.

Nasreen is applying for this loan with six other people. Shahida baji wants a loan for her gold business. Abida baji wants a loan to make additional garments to sell. Haleema baji wants to buy a thread-making machine. Tahira baji wants to buy supplies for her food stall. Umran baji wants to buy cloth to make handkerchiefs. Naseem baji wants to buy a machine to stitch borders on scarves and shirts.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a teenage son. She lives in Melitopol with her family and runs her business selling men’s clothing in the central market. She launched her enterprise 9 years ago. Presently, she already has about $4000 in merchandise. Her turnover capital is about $1800. Her net profit amounts to $800.

Irina has rich experience working in this business. The first time she applied for Nadiya Ukraine financial assistance was 6 years ago. Ever since, her business has expanded, and she gained a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity and great potential. Irina has consistent credit history in Nadiya Ukraine. We believe her positive standing and strong determination to achieve even higher goals will help her succeed and repay her loan on time.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam A. is 31 years old and single. She has been a stationary owner and clothes seller since 2001. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maryam is now seeking a loan to buy more stationary items and clothing inventory in order to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more stationary items  and clothes in order to impove her business.

loans.name: Uch

texts.en: Uch S., 48, is a widow who lives with four of her seven children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has a business selling groceries to the people in the village to earn a living and is able to make US$2.3 a day. She is aided by two of her children who work in construction. Every month she always receives about US$40 from them to help support the family. Uch S. would like to take out a loan of US$300 to add to her grocery's inventory and grow rice.

loans.use: Uch would like to add to her grocery store's inventory and grow rice.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Quế tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị vốn là gia đình thuần nông nên từ khi tham gia Quỹ đến nay các vòng vốn vay chị đều sử dụng để  đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi lợn, vịt gia đình chị còn đào ao thả cá. Thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị đạt khoảng 3.500.000/ tháng, ngoài ra gia đình chị còn có thêm nguồn thu nhập từ công việc buôn bán rau của chị và sự hỗ trợ thêm của người con lớn nên kinh tế ngày càng ổn định hơn
 Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua lợn về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Quế is a TYM fund member since 2002. She and her family are farmers. All the loans received from TYM were used to raise pigs. They also have a pond to farm fishes. Their income is 3.500.000 VND a month. Mrs Quế also sells vegetables to gain more money. Her oldest child is working and contributing to the family`s budget. This time Mrs Quế is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to buy piglets and feed for her animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Ergashali

texts.en:
Ergashali A. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and six children. He is a hard-working person, a fact he demonstrates each and every day as he carries out the arduous tasks of living in the countryside. Ergashali has been a farmer from the start, having inherited his lands – and the occupation – from his parents. With the passing of time, he has also implemented raising livestock into his enterprise. Each day, he takes his cows to graze in the far reaches of his fields.

With these activities, he earns income to support the living expenses of his family. He faces difficult times, however, when livestock prices go down and he is not able to earn enough. Ergashali, however, is learning every day how to run his business for the best end result. The constant motivation for his efforts is his family. He is accustomed to these tasks since he has carried them out as he himself grew up. Ergashali seeks a loan for working capital, specifically so he can buy cattle, especially considering that the prices for them are low now. He feels that this is the only way that will enable him to provide all of his children with a good education. Ergashali deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Pirlicas

texts.en:
Pirlicas I. has a lot of experience in growing vegetables in greenhouses. On a small area of 0.15 hectares he plants tomatoes, potatoes, cucumbers, etc. In early spring he brings his vegetables to the market at the nearby cities of Cantemir or Cahul. With the earned money he supports his family. 

I. now needs a loan for autumn cultivatI. requirements of the land. With a loan of USD$1,150 he will cultivate and will prepare well the soil for spring. In the past, he has had three loans from Microinvest.

loans.use: cultivate soil.

loans.name: Chhim

texts.en:
Chhim S. is 56 years old and lives with her three children, who are employed as garment factory workers

Mrs. Chhim S. has been raising fish in the Kampong Cham province for two years. She has a big pond and makes about US$12.50 each day. She is asking for a loan to breed more fish.

loans.use: To breed more fish.

loans.name: Khis

texts.en: Khis N. is 55 years old and lives with her husband. He is pictured here with a big grinding machine, in Prey Veng province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$ 5 per day. This couple has two children and both of them are employed as police officers. Besides growing and selling rice, this couple also has a grinding service from their home. To make more money, Mrs. Khis would like to use this loan to replace their present machine with a bigger one.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Marco Antonio V. quiere instalar protecciones en su vivienda para tener mas seguridad, la colonia donde viven son de interés social y apenas se esta poblando por lo que el piensa en el bienestar de su familia. El apenas tiene un hijo muy pequeño y aunque lo cuida su esposa, el teme que les vaya pasar algo mientras el trabaja. 
El señor Marco es una persona trabajadora el labora en una maquiladora de la ciudad y su esposa trabaja como empleada domestica.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio V. wants to install security gates around his house to make it safer. The neighborhood where he lives is "de interes social" [government housing, perhaps?] and only recently settled so he's thinking about the well-being of his family. He has a young son and even though his wife takes care of the child, he's afraid that something might happen to them while he's at work. Marco is a hard-working man. He works at a factory in the city and his wife works as a cleaner.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy security gates for house.

loans.name: Villa Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité se siente a gusto trabajando con la Fundación Paraguaya. La mayoria de las mujeres son vecinas del barrio y en muchas ocasiones realizan actividades en conjunto. Las señoras del comité mantienen un estrecho relacionamiento. Las integrantes reciben un promedio de 400.000 mil guaranies, el cual van a invertir para la compra de sus mercaderias para venta e insumos para elaboración de sus productos. 

Las mujeres se muestran agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya que ofrece oportunidades de crecimiento para sus pequeñas actividades, pues asi pueden lograr una mejor calidad de vida. El comité demuestra responabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas como tambien con el ahorro. Las mujeres se comprometen a seguir trabajando con responsabilidad y honestidad, para el logro de sus metas. 

Carmen I. 	Despensa
Graciela B. 	Cria y Venta de pollos
Maria T.	        Venta de verduras
Victoria D.	Kiosko
Margarita C.	Venta de verduras
Lucila G.	        Lavandera
Maria D.	        Comerciante
Luz Maria Irigoirtia	Venta de frutas
Maria Cristina D.	Comerciante
Wilma I.	        Limpiadora
Mariza G.	        Venta de verduras y frutas
Gloria T.	        Venta de Verduras y bijouteri
Claudia P.	        Venta de verduras y comestibles
Juana G.	        Lavandera
Gloria L.	        Venta de comestibles
texts.en:
This group is happy to be working with Fundación Paraguaya. Most of the women are neighbors, and often do activities together. The women in the group maintain a close relationship with one another. The group members are each receiving an average of 400,000 guaraníes (US$78), which they will use to buy more merchandise to sell and ingredients to produce their products. The women are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for offering them the opportunity to expand their small businesses, because this will help them gain a better quality of life. The group has been responsible with their previous payments and savings accounts. The women are committed to continue working with responsibility and honesty, in order to achieve their goals. Carmen I. Grocery store Graciela B. Chicken breeding and sales Maria T. Vegetable sales Victoria D. Kiosk Margarita C. Vegetable sales Lucila G. Laundry Maria D. Merchant Luz Maria Irigoirtia Fruit sales Maria Cristina D. Merchant Wilma I. Cleaning Mariza G. Fruit and vegetable sales Gloria T. Jewelry and vegetable sales Claudia P. Food and vegetable sales Juana G. Laundry Gloria L. Food sales

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients, food and materials for production/sale (fruits, vegetables, jewelry, clothing, lingerie, rice, drinks, sweets, sugar, soap, containers, etc.)

loans.name: Ijeoma

texts.en: Ijeoma C. is 27 years old and single. She sells palm oil. Demand for her palm oil is high and she hopes to meet her customers’ increasing demand. She requests a loan of N 70,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is the 29 year-old mother of two children, although she also had two other children pass away. She is married to a photographer who works in Kisumu. She is asking for 10,000 KSH ($150 US) to purchase more cosmetic supplies as they are popular with her customers. The cosmetics are expensive and she does not have the money to purchase them. She sells her items and lives in Nyamasaria slum in Kisumu.

Evalyne recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illness. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Toshboy

texts.ru: Тошбой - мужчина средних лет 1968 года. Женат и отец 5-х детей. Тошбой занимается купле-продажей скота на скотном рынке. Он закупает скот и продает сразу же, если найдется хороший клиент. Или продает через неделю или две недели. Тошбой закупает скот дешево по 5-10 голов и продает их в розницу подороже. Таким образом Тошбой зарабатывает на жизнь и оборачивает свой капитал. Тошбой содержит всю семью. Ему помогают сыновья. Тошбой кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Он всегда целенаправленно использует свой займ. Тошбой благодарен кредитной организации за финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Toshboy is a middle-aged man who was born in 1968. He is married and the father of five children. Toshboy buys and sells cattle at the cattle market. He purchases cattle, and either sells them immediately if he can find a good buyer, or within a week or two. Toshboy purchases five or ten head cheaply, then resells them at a markup, thus earning a living and turning over his capital. Toshboy supports his family, and his sons help him. He has been a loan customer at MicroInvest for more than two years, and always uses his loans purposefully. Toshboy is grateful to the loan institution for the financial assistance.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle trade

loans.name: Kanyumu A Central Adiochi Christine Group

texts.en:
A. Christine is 28 years old and married with four children. Three of her children attend school, along with one other dependent whom she also takes care of. A. deals in charcoal and has been operating her business for over six years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal to increase capital and improve her stock inventory to meet the orders of her customers. A. is an active and hardworking business lady whose dream is to build a proper house for her family and other dependents.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal to meet her customers' additional orders

loans.name: Funke

texts.en: Funke is 40 years old and she is married with five children. She sells baby things like diapers, cream, clothes, etc. She hopes for a loan of 80,000 nairas to purchase more baby things to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more baby things to sell

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Хуршеда женшина- 31 лет. Замужем имеет 3-х детей,занимается бизнесом более 10лет,имеет собственный магазин в Афганбазаре. Товарооборот у неё большой.Ей помогают в бизнесе брат и мать.она регулярно ездит за товаром  в Китай и следующий займ берёт для расширения товарооборота. Хуршеда всегда целенаправленно использует займ и вовремя погашает без нарушений.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Hursheda is a 31 year old woman. She is married and has three children. She has been in business for more than ten years and has own store on Afganbazar. She has a small inventory. Her mother and brother help her with the business. She regularly travels to China for the merchandise and her next loan she will use for expansion of inventory. Hursheda always uses her loans purposefully and pays them off on time without violations.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blankets

loans.name: María De La Concepción

texts.es:
La señora María de la Concepción Tórrez actualmente ha iniciado la labor de reconstruir su casa de habitación por las razones de que se ha venido dañando a medida que los años han venido transcurriendo. 

Ella reside en el municipio de Somotillo del departamento de Chinandega donde muy sabiamente ha solicitado un crédito para dar lugar a la compra de los materiales de construcción para continuar con la labor en su obra. Ella anhela invertir directamente en su vivienda y así brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de la Concepción Tórrez recently started rebuilding her home, since it had been damaged over the course of time. She lives in the Somotillo municipality in Chinandega Department, and has very wisely requested this loan to purchase construction materials so that she can continue improving her home. She hopes to invest directly in her house, and thus provide her children with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Seur

texts.en:
Mrs. Seur S. is a farmer in Thorm Nei village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice.

Mrs. Seur S. also raises pigs and, since her business of raising pigs is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She would use the rest of loan to buy a cow.

Mrs. Seur S. is a 45-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, another is a vet in the local village and the remaining one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and pig food and to buy a cow

loans.name: Gie Foulacounda Group

texts.fr:
Nous sommes un groupe de jeune femmes qui habitent l'écovillage de Faoune et qui souhaitent faire du  commerce de produits cosmétiques et d'articles de maisons qui intéressent les femmes de notre village.
Nous avons déjà de l'expérience pour gérer un prêt, car nous avons déjà bénéficié d'un crédit alloué par le SEM FUND, que nous avons intégralement rembourser dans les délais requis par les bailleurs. Notre village est situé sur une zone d'accès difficile. Ce qui rend difficile l'accès à certains types de provisions comme les produits cosmétiques, qui sont très prisés par les femmes et aussi des produits de consommations courante.

loans.use: Achat et vente de produits de maison

loans.name: Léontine

texts.fr: D. Léontine est née vers 1958 à Cotonou, Capitale économique du Bénin. Léontine est mariée à LAOUTO Joseph, un cuisinier. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis dix huit ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Léontine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Léontine vend des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique, des tisanes et des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Léontine achète ses produits et elle les vend chez elle à la maison. Léontine a déjà vingt huit d’expérience dans cette activité. Léontine a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Léontine demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat des ustensiles de cuisines en plastique, de divers et des tisanes.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is thirty-two years old. He is married and has one child who is in school. He lives with his wife and daughter in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town.

Evans is a trader. He runs a provision store. He buys his goods from Kumasi and sells in a shop by the roadside. He has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita V. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Anita is married and has  adult-aged children. To make a living, Anita owns & operates a business in the retail sector. Her main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas to local buyers. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Anita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Anita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase supplies for resale. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Anita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase supplies of green bananas for retail sale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 32 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children. Elsa owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale.

In October 2009, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a piglet

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells drinks at the main market in Warri, Delta State, Nigeria. She is 55 years old and married with eight children. Even at her age, she still puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.

She hopes for a loan of 80,000 NGN to purchase more drinks to sell and believes this will expand her business and give her family a better living. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their assistance.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “3 de Mayo II” desde hace 10 años del distrito y provincia de Puno, departamento de Puno; tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y  tiene 5 hijos. Ella estudiò secundaria completa y se dedica a la producción de maná.

Sonia nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital para poder comprar maíz, azúcar, trigo, fideos.

Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar trigo, maíz, fideos, azúcar.

Su sueño para el futuro es hacer su negocio màs grande, poner una tienda y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "3 de Mayo II" community bank for the past 10 years from the district and province of Puno in the town of Puno. She is 40 years old, married and has 5 children. She completed secondary school and is dedicated to the production of maná. Sonia tells us that with her first requested loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos of 300 nuevos soles, she was able to increase her capital to buy corn, sugar and wheat noodles. She is now requesting a loan of 1,200 nuevos soles, with which she can buy wheat, corn, noodles and sugar. Her dream for the future is to make her business larger, to have a shop and that her children are professionals. What she likes most about her community bank is the savings.

Translated from Spanish by Zal Bilimoria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, wheat, sugar and rice

loans.name: Isabel Del Pilar

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, específicamente en el mercado la Estación, la señora Isabel González tiene cinco años de dedicarse a su actividad de venta de frutas y verduras comercializadas por ella misma cada día desde las Seis de la mañana hasta nuestros días. Su negocio se encuentra al aire libre y bajo techo y por la noche es guardado en bodegas esperando el día de trabajo siguiente.

A sus 43 años de edad, ella se dedica a esta actividad porque necesita llevar el sustento a su hogar y así beneficiar a sus hijos dos hijos en edad escolar brindándoles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo.

El crédito lo solicita para la compra de las frutas como lo son las manzanas y las uvas para ofrecerlas en esta temporada y así generar ingresos.
texts.en:
Isabel González has been selling fruit and vegetables for five years in the León department, specifically in the Estación Market. She sells them everyday starting at six in the morning. Her business is in the open air and under a roof. At night it is kept in storerooms waiting for the next work day. At her 43 years of age, she devotes herself to this activity because she needs to support her household. That way she will give her two school aged children the conditions that are necessary for their development. The loan she is requesting is to buy fruit like apples and grapes to sell this season and generate income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruit

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn T. is from the village of Caputol. She is forty-six years old. Merlyn is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Merlyn owns and operates a flower business stall in the retail sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling flowers in the local community. Merlyn is just starting this business.

In 2000, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourteenth loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aoen

texts.en:
Mrs. Aoen U. is 43 years old and she lives in Phnum Lonteah village, Takeo province. She is married with three children, two of whom are students in the local school and the youngest one is 4 years old.

Mrs. Aoen U. and her husband, Mr. Doem Dey, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. This couple tries to work hard but they still make less income than needed to support their family.

In order to increase their income and improve their family’s standard of living, Mrs. Aoen U. decided to ask for a loan to buy two hundred ducks for breeding to produce duck eggs to sell.

With her loans, Mrs. Aoen U.’s standard living is improving and her income is increasing too.

loans.use: To buy 200 ducks for breeding to produce duck eggs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy herbicide

loans.name: Sulochana

texts.en:
Mrs. Sulochana S. is 35 years old and lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati. Sainbu-Bhaishipati is located in the Lalitpur district of Nepal. Most of the people in this area are engaged in agricultural farming. Mrs. S. lives together with her husband and two sons. Her husband, Tika Prasad S., is a broker who sells land. Her sons are in the 5th and 12th grades.

Mrs. S. opened her cosmetics shop five years ago. She wants to add other personal care products to her shop because the demand for these products is constantly increasing. Due to their economic conditions, however, she cannot invest in more capital for her business, so she is asking for her second loan of 20,000 NPR to buy more cosmetics for her shop. Mrs. S. spends her income on providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoem K. is 47 years old and she lives in Ta Ou Khang Tboung village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Soeurn Vann, are farmers who own a 3-hectare (7.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice.

Mrs. Yoem K. is now requesting 2,000,000 Riels from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farm crop.

Mrs. Yoem K. is a mother of three children, two of whom are construction workers, while the other one is a student in the local school. Aside from farming, her husband is village chef from which he receives a small income to support his family living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Many's Group

texts.en:
In this group loan, there are 13 members located in Mitakpheap village in the Kandal province. Mrs. Many C. is 52 years old and a village bank president who has been selected by the entire group. Each member of the group will use the loan to support different purposes. 

Mrs. Many C. is a village chief and can receive a small salary to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sary Keo, is a farming laborer in the local village. Mrs. Many C. decided to ask for a loan to fix up her house. Mrs. Many C. is the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a small position in an organization.

loans.use: To fix up her house

loans.name: Lubowa B Lutaya Safina Group

texts.en: L. Safina is a hardworking businesswoman of forty-two years old, married and blessed with seven children. She is dealing in the poultry business, which she has been running for over eight years. She is using the loan to purchase poultry feeds, drugs for the animals, and chicks, both broilers and layers. She is an encouraging businesswoman whose dream is to work hard for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feeds, drugs for the animals, and chicks, both broilers and layers.

loans.name: La Paz 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Roseline is the coordinator of her group La Paz 1,2 (The Peace), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti). Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, where the economy is based around the sugarcane harvest and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. Roseline makes her home here in a simple structure with her husband and their five children.
Roseline is excited to be taking her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza, and starting to invest in her business selling clothing and shoes. She plans to use this loan to purchase boxers, undershirts and sandals in the main markets in the capital to sell in her community at a profit. She will use the profits to provide her family's basic necessities and to save towards her dream of owning her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To purchase sandals, undershirts and boxers for resale

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Maria Del Carmen P. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual su negocio a mejora mucho. 
Solicita un préstamo poder comprar mas variedad de mercancía ya que sus clientes el están solicitando que venda verduras y quesos. Pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y no quiere descapitalizar el negocio. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Del Carmen P. is grateful for the cooperation in her previous loan which made it possible for her store to improve quite a bit. She is asking for funds to buy a greater variety of goods because her customers are asking her to stock vegetables and cheeses; however, she lacks funds to make this investment and doesn't want to decapitalize her business. She plans to repay the loan with part of the profits she earns from the store since this is her family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La solicitante es viuda, cuenta con casa propia y bienes D. primera necesidad. Vive con 2 D. sus hijos y su yerna con quienes son mayores D. edad y comparten gastos D. la unidad familiar. Tiene buena experiencia crediticia con Mi Banco. Se dedica a la venta D. pisco hace 5 años; compra este producto en la bodega alvarez. El destino del credito es para gastos personales y capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The loan applicant is a widow with her own home and the basic necessities. She lives with two of her children and her daughter in law who are adults and who share the family expenses. She has a good credit history with Mi Banco. She has been selling pisco for five years. She buys this product in the Alvarez warehouse. The loan is for personal expenses and working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses and working capital

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Cerue B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called In God We Trust.  She is 25 years old, single and has four children who range from 5 to 9 years old. Cerue was only able to attend school through 11th grade, due to lack of financial support.  For four years she has sold peanuts in the Pipeline Road community, outside Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more bags of peanuts.  She describes herself as easy going and friendly.  Her goal is to improve her business and transform it into a bakery.

loans.use: Buy more bags of peanuts.

loans.name: Mutua

texts.en: Mutua N. is 45 years old and married with three children.  He does cattle farming together with his wife.  He employs one person who feeds the cattle.  Mutua has been farming for twelve years and has improved his business through Mumbuni Wa Mundu Group under Faulu Kenya.  He previously took out a loan through the group which helped him to increase production.  He is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to buy a water pump, which will solve the challenge of transporting water for a long distance to the farm.  He hopes to educate his children to university level. He plans to explore new methods of farming to increase his production. He dreams of buying an extra piece of land for farming. He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for supplying water to the farm

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more stationery for his store

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme S., 32 years old, is from the town of Gomez San Isidro. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Noeme raises pigs for fattening and sale.

Noeme has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Noeme joined ASKI to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noeme successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI that she used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

Noeme is requesting her third loan, for 9,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business.

About ASKI

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Dorita

texts.en:
Dorita L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 54 years old. Dorita is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Dorita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Dorita also manages a sari-sari store, where a variety of different products is sold. She says the store also helps in their daily needs. She hopes to be able to sustain the store.

Dorita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dorita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Dorita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and additional store inventory. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Dorita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income and save for emergencies. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure and additional store inventory.

loans.name: Felina

texts.en: Felina Q. is from the village of Poblacion III. She is 37 years old and is married with four school-aged children. Felina owns and operates a business manufacturing and selling pots to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty-one years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Felina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Felina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be her 2nd from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Wassimre

texts.fr: leou est une femme très dynamique, l'activité qu'elle exerce est simple, elle achète des tissus et confectionne des habits pour vendre.  cette activité est une réussite pour elle. son souhait est d'agrandir son commerce. elle a une ancienneté de plus de 5 ans dans ce commerce. elle a déjà obtenu du crédit de WAGES qu'elle a bien remboursé. pour réaliser son souhait d'agrandir son activité elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers tissus. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Leou is a very dynamic young woman who buys fabric in order to produce and sell clothes. She has had great success with her business. Her aim is now to grow this 5 year-old business further. She has already received one loan from WAGES which she has successfully repaid. In order to achieve her goal she is seeking another from WAGES so that she may purchase various fabrics. She is married with two children.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase fabric

loans.name: Sarorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarorn V. (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Mr. Sokra In, live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have one son and one daughter. Both of them are attending school.

Sarorn and her husband are silk weavers. In addition, Mr. Sokra In is also a construction worker. Sarorn asked for a Kiva loan through MAXIMA once before. She now is asking for a second loan of 300 USD to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr: alice a appris le métier de la coiffure, elle a fini son apprentissage en 2004, en manque de moyens pour ouvrir son propre atelier elle s'est lancé dans la vente de produits cosmétiques. elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. La fin d'année étant proche, elle voudrait mettre tous les atouts de son côté et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de divers produits cosmétiques pour accroître son stock de marchandises. elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfant, son époux est un topographe.
texts.en:
Alice is a hairdresser. She completed her training in 2004, but lacking the funds to open her own salon, she started selling cosmetics. 

She buys her stocks at the big market of Lomé. With the year coming to an end, she wants to be fully prepared. She is seeking a loan from WAGES to purchase various cosmetic products in order to increase her stocks of merchandise. 

Alice is married with three children. Her husband is a topographer.

loans.use: Buying cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Coralia

texts.es:
DOÑA MARIA CORALIA S. C. 
De 46 años de edad, casada  tiene 3 hijos y es propietaria de una tienda que está ubicada en su casa, tiene ya más de 29 años su tienda, Gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Fape, ella ha podido aumentar la cantidad de productos y poder vender un poco más, ahora que se ha cerca fin de año ella quiere vender otro poco mas en productos de la canasta  basica o sea comestibles y asi satisfacer a su clientela, y así incrementa sus ingresos y obtener más ganancias, ella es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora ha apoyado a su esposo y es satisfactorio para ella ser una fuente de ingresos para su familia, además les ha dado educación a sus hijos y espera que algún día ellos puedan lograr sus sueños, ella es muy buena socia y confía en que Fape le dará esta nueva oportunidad y así poder salir adelante con su familia. Y cumplir sus sueños que es ver a sus hijos graduados y así tengan  un mejor futuro
texts.en: Mrs. Maria Coralia S. C. is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. She owns a store located in her home that has been operating for over 29 years. Thanks to the support from FAPE, she has been able to increase the quantity of products and sales a bit more. Now that the end of the year is near, she wants to sell more staple goods and groceries to satisfy her customers, so she can increase her income and gain more profits. She is an enterprising and hard-working woman; she has helped her husband and it is satisfying for her to be a source of income for her family. Additionally, she has provided an education for her children and hopes that one day they can fulfill their dreams. She is a member in good-standing and trusts that FAPE will give her another opportunity to get ahead with her family and fulfill her dreams of seeing her children graduated so they can have a better future.

loans.use: Groceries and staple goods

loans.name: Meiponyi

texts.en:
Meiponyi K., 27 years old, married and a father of six school-going children, has been a maize farmer in Narok area for the last four years. Maize normally does well in this area due to good climatic conditions, and he hopes that this will be true in the next planting season as well.

Meiponyi learned about KADET from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his second loan which he is planning to use to prepare land for maize planting. He hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming.

Meiponyi's dream is conduct large scale farming and start dairy farming. He is a hard working man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: To prepare land for maize planting.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of children's clothes

loans.name: Wendelyn

texts.en:
Wendelyn C. is from the village of Malinao, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Wendelyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies like ice candy, hot cakes and sweet breads in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Wendelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Wendelyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make the products for sale

loans.name: Yolinda

texts.es: Yolinda, de 18 años, está casada con Javier, de 23 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Mayvet, de un año de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Juan. Hace 2 años se dedica a la agricultura; sus principales sembríos constan de papa y alverja, los cuales abona y cuida con mucha dedicación, ya que quiere darle un buen futuro a su hija. El trabajo arduo que mantuvo durante todo este tiempo, le permitió adquirir su propio terreno agrícola. Ahora después de cada cosecha, ella lleva su producción al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde puede observar la demanda de los productos; por ello hace algún tiempo sembró papa, los que están creciendo sin mayores complicaciones. Como es joven en este negocio, quiere mejorar sus sembríos, y convertirse en una excelente agricultora. Es el primer crédito con MFP, y como socia nueva de su banco comunal, agradece la oportunidad que le ofrecen, comprometiéndose a trabajar con esfuerzo. De obtener el crédito solicitado, lo podrá invertir en la compra de 2 sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Yolinda is 18 years old.  She is married to 23 year-old Javier and they have one child: one year-old Mayvet.  They live together as a family in their own home which is located in the town of San Juan.

Yolinda has been farming for 2 years.  Her main crops are potatoes and peas which she looks after with a lot of commitment since she would like to provide her daughter with a good future.  The hard work that she has done over the years have enabled her to acquire her own plot of farmland.  After each harvest, she takes her produce to the wholesale market in Tarma, where she can observe the demand for products.  As a result, she has been growing potatoes for some time.  They are growing without real problems.  As she is new in this business, Yolinda would like to improve her crops and become an excellent farmer.

This is Yolinda's first loan with MFP and, as a new member of her community bank, she is grateful for the opportunity that they are offering her and pledges to work hard.  She will invest her loan in buying 2 sacks of pea seeds which she will sow on her farmland.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of pea seeds

loans.name: Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Perveen lives in Khanewal, which is a small city located in the Punjab province of Pakistan and is known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Khurram Pura.  She moved here with her family 25 years ago.

She is 44 years old and married with 4 children: three sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works for a government organization while the other sons stay at home and don’t do anything. Her daughter is studying in grade one.

Perveen supports her family financially by doing a job at the school. Her husband's name is B. M. and he also works for a government organization for a monthly wage. After his day job, he operates a fruit-selling business to supplement the income of the family. He sells seasonal fruits by visiting different streets of the city with his four-wheeled cart. He has been operating this business for past 10 years and manages a good clientele base.  

Perveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s fruit-selling business. With the loan, he will purchase fresh seasonal fruits and increase his sales. Perveen is hopeful that an investment will bring more profits for her husband.

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In a previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Perveen.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruits for fruit-selling business

loans.name: Ana Kelly

texts.es:
Ana tiene 31  años de edad, es casada  y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Pasabar la Granja ubicado en el  distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial conocida como la capital del limón; que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Ella se dedica  a la crianza y venta de animales menores como: ovejas y aves de corral, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes cercanos a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona.  Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Con los ingresos que ambos perciben de estas actividades se encargan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Ana desea ampliar su negocio comprando animales y alimento balanceado y de esta manera incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old, married, and she lives together with her husband and children in the community of Pasabar La Granja, located in the district of Olmos. It is an agricultural region which is fairly commercialized and it is known as the lemon capital. It is situated in the province of Lambayeque, more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

She raises and sells small livestock, such as: sheep and poultry. She raises them in corrals near her home. When the livestock have reached a certain level in development she sells them to the general public and to the merchants who visit the region. Her husband is an agriculturist. With both of their incomes from their respective businesses they are able to support their family. 

Ana wishes to expand her business with the purchase of livestock and balanced feed to increase her sales.  She has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 600 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda B. is from the village of Bannagao. She is 59 years old. Melinda is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Melinda owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Melinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Melinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hunan

texts.en: Hunan G. was born in 1975. He lives in Tsav village, in the area of Kapan, with his wife and his newborn son.  Hunan works at Tsav village administration as an accountant and at the same time, he engages in animal breeding and land cultivation. He raises cows, sheep, goats and pigs, and Hunan grows potatoes at his farm as well. Hunan’s wife helps him and so they support their young family’s needs. Hunan is asking for a 600,000 AMD loan to buy potato seedling and fodder for his farm animals. This is Hunan’s fourth loan from Nor Horizon and he has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To buy potato seedlings and fodder for his farm animals

loans.name: Bernarditha

texts.en: Bernarditha is a 47-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store and a food vending business. She lives in Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1990 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000. Bernarditha is borrowing PHP 25,000 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bernarditha aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Gazanfar

texts.ru: Gazanfar A. 40 let. On jenat jenat i uje imeyet 2 detey odin iz kotorix xodit v shkolu. Gazanfar jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so voimi lubimimi detmi i jenoy. Uje 13 let kak Gazanfar zanimayetsya selskim xozaystvom. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Gazanfara , v perviy raz on bral 1200$, i ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za ssudu. On oplachival svoyu ssudu yejemesechno bez opazdaniy. I seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit sajenci i shtili dlya posadki. Posle pervoy ssudu on uvelichil svoi ploshadi dlya posadki.
texts.en: Gazanfar A. is 40 years old.  He is married and has two children, one of whom goes to school.  Gazanfar lives in Baku with his beloved children and wife.  He has been farming for thirteen years.  This is Gazanfar’s second loan.  The first time he borrowed $1200, and he is very thankful to Kiva lenders for this.  He paid off his loan monthly, never late.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy seedlings for planting.  After his first loan, he expanded his plot of land for planting.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 31-year-old married man with five children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda, in a four-roomed semi-permanent house.
Robert wants a loan to buy more soft drinks, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for resale in his retail shop. Having started from growing sugar cane and beans, he dreams of setting up a wholesale shop for himself, building a permanent house for his family, and educating his children.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, salt, sugar and other general merchandise for resale

loans.name: Marta Magdalena

texts.es:
Marta de 40 años, es una mujer trabajadora que empezó hace 4 años a raiz que su hija nació y porque no alcanzaba los ingresos de su esposo que decidió abrir una papelería.

Ella labora de 7H00 am a 9H00pm en su papelería . Ella esta casada tienen dos hijas. Su esposo trabaja de taxista particular. Con la ayuda del préstamo ella quiere comprar una copiadora y mas artículos de papelería. Ella anhela terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa y hacer mas grande el bazar.
texts.en:
Marta, age 40, is a hardworking woman who started her business four years ago when her daughter was born. Her husband's earnings were not enough, and she decided to open a stationary store.

Marta works in her store from 7am to 9pm. She is married and now has two daughters. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Marta will use the loan to purchase a copying machine and more inventory for her stationary store. Her dream is to finish the second floor of her house and to expand her store.

loans.use: to purchase stationary store inventory and a copying machine

loans.name: Gulsara's Group

texts.en:
Gulsara is the leader of this group. She is 42 and married. Her husband went to work in Russia for making money. She takes care of six children: four sons and two daughters. The first son, together with his dad, works in Russia, and the other children study at school. In order to contribute money to the family budget, Gulsara cultivates and sells agricultural products. She started this activity twenty years ago and her monthly profit is approximately $110. 

She hopes to obtain the loan because she needs money to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale. In the future Gulsara wants to provide her children a good education and soon she plans to start house repairs. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Medina

texts.en:
Medina is 38 years old and married. She has two children aged 14 and 10. Both of her children go to school. 

Medina is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She earns about 3,000 PHP per month from farming. Medina wants to improve her earnings and she works hard. She requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She also plans to use part of the loan to pay for the educational expenses of her children. Medina hopes for her business to prosper.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for educational expenses

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is 41 years old and married, with 3 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Janet is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Janet has been raising pigs for 14 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson, de 33 años reside en la cuenca alta de la selva central peruana (comunidad de las Palmas). Ahí formó su familia junto a Gregoria, su esposa desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Yerson y Rosmery, a los que quieren y educan en su casa propia. Como joven emprendedor y muy decidido, comenzó a trabajar en la actividad que le enseñaron sus padres. La agricultura, desde hace 10 años demostró todos sus conocimientos en la siembra de café, piña y cacao. De los cuales ahora dejó de sembrar café. Según mociona antes el kilo de café costaba un promedio de S/. 20 nuevos soles, teniendo una baja de S/. 8 soles. Por ese motivo dejó de dedicarse a la siembra de este producto, por lo que se dedicó la mayor parte de su tiempo en el cultivo de piña en su ½ hectárea de terreno agrícola, teniendo que alquilar más extensión de terreno para producir en mayor cantidad y así obtener buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es comercializar sus productos a la capital del país donde puede comprar varias cosas que no se encuentran en su comunidad. Ahora está pensando juntar dinero suficiente para poder comprar más terrenos agrícolas propios. Él pertenece al banco comunal “La Palmeras” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde está muy contento de saber que tendrá el apoyo financiero, para seguir con su trabajo. Nelson, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 4 sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en su cultivo de piña, que está creciendo sin dificultades.
texts.en:
Nelson, aged 33, lives in the upper basin of the central Peruvian jungle (the las Palmas community).  There he has created his family with Gregoria, his wife of 10 years.  They have 2 sons, Yerson and Rosmery, who are loved and are educated in their own home.  

As an entrepreneurial and very determined young man, he began working in the occupation that his parents taught him: agriculture.  For 10 years, he has demonstrated all his skills in growing coffee, pineapple and cocoa, of which he has now stopped growing coffee.  As a result of fluctuations, a kilo of coffee that previously cost an average of 20 New Soles, is reaching a low at 8 Soles.  For that reason, he no longer engages in growing this product, and so he spends most of his time cultivating pineapple on ½ acre of agricultural land.  He has had to rent more land area to produce a greater quantity and so get good profits. 

What he likes best about his work is taking his products for sale in the capital, where he can buy various things that are not available in his community. Now he is thinking about putting together enough money to buy more of his own farmland.  He belongs to the communal bank "La Palmeras" and this is his first loan through MFP.  He is very glad to know he has the financial support to continue his work.  Nelson, once he has the support, will invest the money requested to buy 4 bags of organic manure to use on his pineapple crop, which is growing smoothly.

loans.use: to buy 4 sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Jean has a retail shop that sells beverages, snacks & canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy snacks & beverages to sell.

Jean is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Jean hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
