Lucas is 33 years old. He is married to Millicent, and they have two school-going children.

For nine years, he has been running a butcher's shop. He is currently applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd to buy more animals for slaughtering purposes. He will use the anticipated profits generated from the loan proceeds to cover his family's daily living expenses. In the near future, he hopes to open other butcher shops in other markets.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 58 years old and lives in Dipolog City. She is married and has seven children. To earn a living, Sarah makes and sells dried fish. She earns about 6,000 PHP each month doing this work. Sarah has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fish and salt for making dried fish. Sarah has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: to purchase fish and salt for making dried fish

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en:
For the last 15 years, Dishon has been selling livestock. He is 53 years old and married to Mwikali. They have eight children.

He was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. He has been loaned KES 30,000. He intends to use the loan amount to buy cows, which he will raise and later sell at a profit.
 
In the future, he aspires for his business to grow and get more income to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca, es viuda y vive con sus hijos de 30, 19 y 20 años de edad, el negocio de doña Francisca comenzó hace 8 años, trabaja de 8:00am a 1:00pm, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta en el mercado municipal, se dedica a vender comida, a través de este negocio ella ha logrado estudiar a sus hijos y darles lo necesario.
Actualmente ella está nuevamente solicitando un préstamo que necesita para comprar productos como carnes, aceite, verduras y condimentos, estos materiales son los que usa a diario para preparar las comidas ya sean secas o sopas. Este préstamo al igual que los anteriores le beneficiara mucho ya que contara con todo lo necesario para  su negocio, además de proveerle ganancias para su hogar.
Quiere ayudar a su familia con sus ingresos, fomentar el trabajo en sus hijos y esperar que estos se puedan superar.
texts.en:
Francisca is a widow and lives with her children, who are 30, 19, and 20 years old. She began her business 8 years ago. She works from 8:00am until 1:00pm. She has a small stand in the municipal market where she sells food. Through this business her children have been able to study and she has been able to provide them with what they need.

She is requesting once again a loan that she needs to buy products such as meats, cooking oil, vegetables, and condiments. These are the ingredients she uses every day to prepare foods and soups. This loan is for the same amount as the previous ones. They will benefit her very much because she will have everything she needs for her business and also provide income for her home.

She wants to help her family with her income, to encourage her children to work, and hopes that they will be successful.

loans.use: to buy meats, cooking oil, vegetables, and condiments

loans.name: Juana Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma nació en el departamento del Cusco al sur del Perú. Actualmente, Vilma tiene 73 años D. edad, ella es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos. Vilma se dedica a la venta D. comida (Desayuno, Almuerzo y Cena). DesD. hace 40 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Vilma requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo bolsas D. arroz, botellas D. aceite y otras cosas más. 

El Banco Comunal “Virgen D. las Nieves” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial y por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y también porque se encuentra una D. las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Vilma was born in Cusco Department in the south of Perú.  At present, Vilma is 73 years old.  She’s a widow and has four children.  Vilma sells food (breakfast, lunch and dinner).  She’s been in this business for the last 40 years and does very well.  On this occasion Vilma needs the loan to buy ingredients like for example bags of rice, bottles of oil and other things.

The “Virgen D. las Nieves” communal bank meets monthly in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for being a very touristy and commercial area as well as for its traditional “Inti Raymi” festival and also because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located here.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bags of rice, bottles of oil and other things.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 43 years old, married and has 4 children. Her eldest daughter has completed her education through the 16th standard and is now a school teacher. Her remaining children are also getting their education. 
Nasreen is a housewife, stays at her home and performs her household duties. She is very active and fulfills her responsibilities very well. 
Her husband operates an optical shop in the market. He sells sunglasses and optical glasses to his customers at reasonable rates. He also gives computerized eye testing services to his customers. His customers trust his services and he makes good profits every month. 
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy glasses of different brands to put to his shop for sale. 
He has been operating his business for past many years and Nasreen is confident that an investment will increase his productivity.

loans.use: To buy glasses for her husband's optical shop business

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old.  He is married and blessed with three children.  He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last seven years.  Joseph's farm is in a productive area which has proven to be good for corn farming.

He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence.  He has been a good client with KADET and this will be his fifth loan with which he is planning to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.  He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming which will increase his corn production.  He would also like to educate his children with the profit.

His hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home.
Joseph is a fastidious man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vilma Jeannette

texts.es: Vilma Jeannette, reside en casa propia en uno de los municipios del gran San Salvador en área urbana, junto a su grupo familiar conformado por tres hijos: Neri, Jefferson, Julio todos se encuentra estudiando en la escuela grados inferiores al bachillerato y su esposo que trabaja como empleado público y con ello tiene a su cargo el sostenimiento del hogar. Vilma desde hace muchos años decidió colaborar económicamente estableciendo en su misma casa una tienda donde vende ropa y zapatos, aprovechando que se considera una mujer con muy buenos gustos para vestir y buena administradora, ya son varios años de dedicarse a este negocio apoyada con financiamientos y gracias a ello su hogar goza de condiciones necesarias para vivir. Vilma es previsora y desea anticiparse a comprar nueva ropa como blusas, faldas, camisas y zapatos de moda para la próxima temporada de diciembre a sabiendas de que sus clientes la empezarán a buscar. Dicha época del año siempre es muy rentable para Vilma y espera poder contar con la ayuda de INTEGRAL para no dejar pasar la oportunidad de hacer buenos negocios
texts.en:
Vilma Jeannette lives in her own house in one of the towns in the greater San Salvador urban area with her family composed of three children: Neri, Jefferson and Julio who are all in school in grades from elementary to high school and her husband who works as a public employee and is in charge of supporting the family.

Many years ago Vilma decided to help economically setting up a clothing and shoe store in her house.  She took advantage of the fact that she considers herself to have very good taste with respect to attire and she’s a good businesswoman.  She’s been in business for many years now with help from loans and thanks to it her home enjoys the conditions necessary to live.  

Vilma is forward thinking so she wants to get ahead of things and buy new clothes like blouses, skirts, shirts and shoes in next season’s styles to be ready for December knowing that her customers will start to look for it.  That time of year is always very profitable for Vilma and she hopes to have support from INTEGRAL so that this opportunity for good business won’t escape her.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 25-year-old married man. He describes himself to be ambitious and patient. He operates a grocery store where he sells kale, onions, tomatoes, cabbages and other green vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years and employs one staff member. His business is located in a busy market and his primary customers are restaurants. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to increase his stock of vegetables. His business goal is to grow it into wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will grow the business and construct a permanent premise where he will be able to run his business smoothly.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Pervelita

texts.en:
Pervelita is a married woman with two children. Pervelita is 31 years old and resides in Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. 

Pervelita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice to earn a living. She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Pervelita has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Pervelita wants to make improvements to her house and to have her children finish school.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Weonia Shg Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Weonia SHG Group in Western Kenya! Peninah is the facilitator of the Weonia SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peninah is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Peninah had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peninah was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peninah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Peninah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Weonia SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kijura in the Luweero region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past three years, Yusuf has been working hard to manage his small shop, which bottles water and other beverages. 

To help expand his business, Yusuf has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy his own water packaging machine and will help Yusuf to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Yusuf hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Yusuf is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yusuf who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy another water packaging machine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy meat, frozen foods and ingredients for her food production business.

Teresita has been in this business for eight years. Teresita earns her income from her sari-sari store.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, frozen foods and ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 33 years old and married to Dorcas. They have two children.

Joseph has been in his business for the last six years and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer and is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000.

He hopes to use the funds to buy more seeds and fertilizers for sale and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for sale.

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en: Moureen is 27 years old and a single mother of four children. She owns a secondhand clothing business which she has been running for 4 years now. She faces the challenge of price fluctuations. Her family goal is to educate her children, and her business dream is to expand to new markets. She intends to use to loan to buy used clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with eight children. Elizabeth is 53 years old and lives in Mauswagon, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Elizabeth owns a general store to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel tiene 45 años de edad y desde hace 20 años se dedica a la comercialización de leche en la vereda sabaneta del municipio de Bello, Colombia. Esta actividad le ha permitido sostener a sus padres con quienes reside. Su mayor sueño es poder tener bastante ganado para incrementar su capacidad de producción y poder satisfacer la demanda de su localidad. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vaca lechera y cuido. Desea mejorar su situación económica para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
Espera que su sueño comience a materializarse con la aprobación de dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Juan Manual is 45 years old and for the past 20 years he has been selling milk on Sabaneta street in the town of Bello, Colombia. This business has enabled him to support his parents, with whom he lives. 

His greatest dream is to earn enough to increase his production capacity so that he is able satisfy local demand. For this reason he is requesting a loan in order to purchase a dairy cow and care for it. He wants to improve his economic situation so he can provide a better quality of life for his family.

He hopes that his dream will begin to materialize with approval of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase and care for a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dangbenou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DANGBENOU est composé de trois  personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pauline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo et a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pauline est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Pauline est mariée à un agent de sécurité du nom de Norbert. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisées et à leur charge. Pauline vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son conjoint. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Pauline vend depuis huit ans des condiments à son domicile. Pauline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pauline, ensemble avec les membres du groupe DANGBENOU, sollicite un cinquième crédits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments.

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Aaron, a 33-year-old farmer from Cheplanget village in the South Rift Valley area of Kenya. 

To provide for his family, Aaron practices dairy farming and sells milk for his income. He enjoys looking after his animals. His major challenge, however, is a lack of capital to expand the business. 

Aaron is seeking a loan of KES 25,000 to buy a cow. A good quality cow goes for more than what Aaron is applying for. Your loan will top up Aaron's personal savings to meet the cost of a good quality cow and its insurance. He acknowledges the importance of insuring an asset such as a dairy cow. 

Aaron's life and that of his family will be elevated as a result of increased income through this loan.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 46 years old and lives in the Kinoru, Nkubu area of Kenya. She has been working all her life because she wants to give to her family a good quality of life. 
For the past five year, Rose has been actively involved in mixed farming. Because she is from rural Kenya, women are left to do the heavy work of farming but this has not been a setback to him because she has been making great profits in farming. Kinoru is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Rose has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy seeds and start horticultural farming. Rose joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro-finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan Rose intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. This loan will improve Rose's living conditions and secure the future of her children.
Rose is working really hard to make her farming sustainable. She expects that through her farming she can make her dreams come true, like building a modern house and paying tuition fees for her children. You can be part of Rose’s story: a loan will make a great difference in her life and keep her big smile.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticultural farming

loans.name: Juan Camilo

texts.en:
Juan is just 22 years old and lives in the municipality of Medellin. He’s a young man who has big dreams and one of them was be independent and create his own business because he has always have an entrepreneur heart. Last year he started a place where he sells food that he himself prepares. 

He started this business to help his family with the bills and because he loves what he does. He expects that his business last for a long time and also wants to offer more food options to diversify what he prepares. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy a roaster and a tent, also buy inputs like meat and bread. 

Juan dreams with buying a house where he can live with all his family, so he can thank them for everything they had done for him. Help this young man with big dreams to start accomplishing all, loan now.

loans.use: buy a roaster and a tent, also buy inputs like meat and bread

loans.name: Tester

texts.en: test

loans.use: test

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is 24 and the mother of two small children. They live in Kabul City. Hameeda took this loan for her husband to buy construction supplies and materials for his shop to increase his business. During the war she faced lots of difficulties when she took over for her husband to help his family financially. Since her husband works outside of the city, she hopes to complete this loan cycle so she can take another loan for her own business.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the female entrepreneur, Hameeda. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the Internet, but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Hameeda would like to buy glass and supplies for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing wood

loans.name: Kodjovi

texts.fr:
Kodjovi G. was born in Atchantidomé on December 31, 1962. Married and the father of two, he has a total of 5 dependents that he supports. With a middle school education, he ceased working very early on, because of an insufficient salary. Well-known for his welcoming and sympathetic personality, he currently manages his little pharmacy, which he hopes to bolster. Given the level of demand from his customer base, which continues to grow, he hopes to weave relationships with laboratories and thus to resupply his shop with medicines. This is why he is requesting a loan of $1200. The income generated from these sales will serve to provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur G. Kodjovi est né à Atchantidomé le 31 Décembre 1962. Marié et père de deux (2) enfants, il a à sa charge un total de cinq (5) personnes qu’il supporte. Instruit de niveau secondaire, il a cessé très tôt son travail pour insuffisance de salaire au profit du commerce. Très reconnu pour son accueil et sa sympathie, Monsieur G. Kodjo gère actuellement sa petite pharmacie qu’il compte renforcer. Vu le niveau des demandes de sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, il espère tisser des relations avec les laboratoires pour des ravitaillements. C’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite ce crédit de $1200 pour acheter les médicaments pour sa petite pharmacie. Le revenu issu de la vente servira à Monsieur G. de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Commerce in medicines

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en: Kamala A. ( her husband is pictured ) is 32 years old.  She and her husband have sold agricultural produce and fruits for 7 years. They have 2 children and live Khachmaz town. They are now requesting a loan of $825 to buy agricultural produce for increasing their income.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Sakhavet

texts.en: Sakhavet M. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in south western Azerbaijan. He is 38 years old and is single. Sakhavet is a taxi driver. He carries passengers to the city center everyday. He borrowed two loans from Nomicro Beylagan Branch and repaid them on time. Now he needs another loan in the amount of $400.

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en: Lusia never stopped herself from looking for a business to support her family. She is fifty four years old and a  married mother of 8 children. Her business is a small shop just in front of her house. She earns $300.00-$400.00 WST ($120-160 USD) a day and that’s where she earned money for her family and her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
Mrs. Daisy M. is from the city of Bluefields. She is 45 years old and married to Mr. Joseph Hebbert, they both have 5 children who attend middle school, she pays for these studies with the income from her coconut bread sales. Mrs. M. has more than 10 years of experience, and her potential clients are the inhabitants from Puerto Maritimo. They prefer her because of the quality of her products. Currently, Mrs. M. needs to purchase 300 kilos of flour which has a value of $96 dollars; 200 kilos of sugar, a value of $54; 24 pounds of shortening a value of $24; 3 pounds of baking powder, a value of $6, 100 coconuts, a value of $30, 10 pounds of fruit, a value of $30 and 10 bags of coal, a value of $60. She requests a loan in order to make these purchases and therefore satisfy the markets demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Escalante, Kiva volunteer

La Sra. Daisy M. es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, tiene 45 años de edad esta casada con el Sr. Joseph Hebberth ambos tienen 5 hijos que cursan estudios secundarios, estos estudios son pagados con el ingreso de la venta de pan de coco. La Sra. M. tiene 10 años de experiencia, sus clientes potenciales son habitantes del Puerto marítimo EL Bluff que la prefieren por la calidad de su producto. En estos momentos la Sra. M. necesita comprar 3 quintales de harina a $32.00 dólares el quintal, 2 quintales de azúcar a $ 27.00 dólares el quintal, 24 libras de manteca a $ 1.00 dólar la libra, 3 libras de levadura a $ 2.00 dólares la libra, 100 unidades de coco a $ 0.30 centavos dólar la unidad, 10 libras de frutas a $ 3.00 dólares la libra y 10 sacos de carbón a $ 6.00 dólares cada saco para poder satisfacer su demanda.

loans.use: Comprar 3 quintales de harina, 2 quintales de azúcar, 24 libras de manteca, 10 sacos de carbón, 3 libras de levadura, 100 unidades de coco, 10 libras de fruta.

loans.name: Ubaydullo

texts.ru:
Ubaydullo Turdialievich H. lives in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 23 and married with two children. Ubaydullo has a secondary school education and works as a mechanic. He owns a car wash in his city and has been in business for three years. This business helps support his family as well as providing local residents with access to car wash services. Ubaydullo is applying for a loan in order to get new car wash equipment in order to improve the services he offers. This will help him attract more customers and earn more money. He plans to repay the loan within five months.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Хакимов Убайдулло Турдиалиевич житель города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 23 года, женат имеет 2 детей. Образование среднее ,работает автослесарем .Имеет автомойку в городе Курган-тюбе.. Данным видом деятельности клиент занимается уже 3 года.Его бизнес помогает обеспечивать свою семью, а также помогает населению получить доступ к данным услугам. Планирует получить кредит для приобретения оборудования, для мойки . чтобы улучшить сервис обслуживания. Это поможет увеличить количество клиентов , что даст возможность увеличить заработок..Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 5 месяцев.

loans.use: Buying car wash equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NEEDED FOR A SUCCESSFUL HARVEST, AS WELL AS STOCK FOR HIS SMALL GENERAL STORE.

loans.name: Catherine's Ashok D Group

texts.en:
Catherine Ngingo, age 52, is a divorcee with two children, ages 27 and 25. She has a shop that she began 11 years ago. She works from 8am to 6pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $833.

Catherine hopes for a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to improve her shop. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have shops, and sell soft drinks and beer.

In the picture, Catherine is the first person on the right.

loans.use: To improve her shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food and to improve her business conditions.

loans.name: Grisella

texts.es:
Grissella is 34-years-old and the mother of 4 children who are students and are the biggest inspiration for her progress. She sells food and has entered this business to help support her family, and her beloved husband, Jesus Augustus, who supports her in all of her decisions and certainly agrees that she belong to a community bank. Grissella wants to expand her business to provide better service to her customers and is seeking a loan to reach this goal. With your help, the objective of this working mother is possible.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Grissella 34 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, es madre de 04 hijos que están estudiando y desde luego son su mayor inspiración de progreso. Ella se encaminó en este negocio para ayudar con el sustento de su familia, su amado esposo, Jesús Augusto, la apoya en todas sus decisiones y desde luego está de acuerdo que pertenezca a un banco comunal. Grissella quiere mandar a ampliar su negocio para brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, para ello estima de un préstamo para llegar a cumplir su meta. Con tu ayuda has posible el objetivo de esta madre trabajadora.

loans.use: To expand her space to provide better service to her customers.

loans.name: Koffi Mawuli

texts.fr:
Koffi Mawuli A. was born on August 3, 1955 in Notsè, in Halo Prefecture, in Togo. He is married and the father of six children, the care of whom falls upon his shoulders. He opened a sales center for school supplies in the Agoè district. The objective for which he created this center is to be near the people in his district, because there is no bookstore in the area. During this time of vacations, the price of school supplies has diminished a little, and he wishes to take advantage of this chance to stock up on books and notebooks before school starts. To do so, he is requesting this loan to buy 5 boxes of notebooks and 80 books for primary school. He will thus be able to earn a good income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Monsieur A. Koffi Mawuli est né le 03 août 1955 à Notsè dans la préfecture de Haho au Togo. Il est marié et père de six enfants dont la charge lui incombe. Il a ouvert un centre de vente des fournitures scolaires dans le quartier d’Agoè. L’objectif pour lequel il a crée ce centre est d’être plus proche de la population de son quartier car il n’ y a de librairie dans la localité. Pendant ces vacances, le prix des fournitures a un peu diminué et il désire profiter de cette occasion pour faire un stock de cahiers et de livres avant l’approche des rentrées scolaires. A cet effet, il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 5 cartons de cahiers et 80 unités de livres des cours primaires. Ainsi il pourra gagner un bon revenu.

loans.use: To buy school supplies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia is a member of the communal bank “Urpicha”, which means “little bird” in Quechua.

Felicia is married, 35 years old, and has three children. Felicia lives in a rented house located on a busy street. Felicia has a store in her house where, along with her husband’s help, she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit, meats, ice creams, drinks and office supplies from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. every day.

Felicia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of rice and sugar.

Felicia dreams of running a well-stocked mini-mart, of owning her own home with all the necessary amenities, and of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Felicia es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha que significa pajarito en quechua.

Felicia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Felicia vive en una casa alquilado ubicada en una avenida concurrida, Felicia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, carnes, helados, bebidas, útiles de escritorio, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.

Felicia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.

Felicia sueña con tener un minimarket surtido, casa propia con todas las comodidades y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Felicia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, to be invested into the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Encontramos a Antonio en su vivienda elaborando muy contento sus deliciosos quesos; durante muchos años atrás este laborioso padre estaba dedicado al comercio de ganado, pero desdichadamente no le fue muy  bien; al ver que su esposa enfermó y sus hijos deseaban seguir estudios superiores, se vio en la necesidad de buscar y generar sus propios ingresos  económicos. Antonio inició vendiendo quesos que adquiría en su pueblo,  Cupi, pero su inquietud e iniciativa le llevaron a elaborar sus propios  productos, ahora este ejemplar padre y esposo recopila diariamente alrededor de 200 litros de leche de sus vecinos ganaderos, con esta cantidad  de leche realiza  alrededor de 30 quesos,  que luego  de cada fin de semana lo  vende al por mayor  en las ciudades de Puno, Cuzco y Arequipa.Este oficio le permite cubrir con los gastos de salud de su esposa Narcisa y los gastos de sus 3 hijos que se encuentran estudiando en la ciudad de Arequipa.El deseo que tiene Antonio es comprar una prensadora para quesos, esta herramienta le permitirá agilizar su trabajo, por lo que solicita este préstamo.
texts.en:
We meet Antonio in his home, happily preparing his delicious cheeses; for many years this diligent father made his living in livestock. Unfortunately things did not go well for him--his wife became ill and his children wanted to pursue upper-level studies, so it became necessary for him to find and generate his own income. Antonio started selling cheeses that he bought in his town of Cupi, but his worry and initiative drove him to produce his own products. Now this exemplary father and husband daily collects about 200 liters of milk from his stockbreeding neighbors, from which he makes about 30 cheeses. Then every weekend he sells them wholesale in the cities of Puno, Cuzco and Arequipa. This trade allows him to take care of the health expenses of his wife Narcisa and the expenses of his 3 children who are studying in the city of Arequipa. Antonio's wish is to buy a cheese press, which would allow him to speed up his work--this is why he is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cheese press to speed up his work.

loans.name: Belles-Dames Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre (4) femmes du groupe Belles-dames (toutes mariées) ont une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 2 enfants vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Unies par des liens de voisinage, professionnel et de parenté, elles font majoritairement le commerce de bois de chauffe, de savons, de tissus et d’huile alimentaire.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin sans cesse croissant de sa clientèle, ce groupe décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son 6ème prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe). Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, les membres du groupe comptent acheter, 8 chargements  de charettes en bois de chauffe, 10 cartons de savons, 45 mètres de tissus et 5 bidons d’huile alimentaire. Elles s’approvisionnent exclusivement sur place à Sikasso auprès des grossistes de grand marché (pour les tissus, les huiles alimentaires et le savon). Quant au bois de chauffe, c’est auprès des paysans (ayant un permis de coupe) ravitaillant la ville. Elles mènent généralement leurs activités à domicile et de façon ambulante et vend à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes. .         
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt, un bénéfice moyen de 20.000 FCFA par mois qui sera utiliser pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir aux besoins de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Belles-Dames group (all married) have an average age of 35 and two children, and live in traditional large, extended families in the Hamdallaye district of Sikasso (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Brought together through neighborhood, professional and family connections, they sell mainly firewood, soap, cloth and vegetable oil. In order to meet the continually growing demand of their customers, the group decided to join the Soro Yriwaso microfinance institution, with whom they are now on their 6th solidarity (group) loan. All previous loans were repaid successfully. The members of the group plan to use this loan to purchase 8 loads of firewood, 10 boxes of soap, 45 meters of cloth and 5 drums of vegetable oil. They buy their supplies of cloth, vegetable oil and soap only in Sikasso, from local wholesalers at the main market. With respect to firewood, they buy this from the peasants (holding a cutting permit) who supply the town. Typically they run their business from home or by walking around, and sell mainly to women. They each hope to make from this loan an average profit of CFA 20,000 per month, which will be used to pay the loan interest and provide for their families’ needs. The remainder will be invested in the business.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, soap, cloth and vegetable oil

loans.name: Sokpum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokpum U., 25, and her husband, Mr. Hun Sum, 28, live in a small village near the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2002 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Sokpum's father also lives with them.

Sokpum has been selling fruit for three years. She buys the fruit from a Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. Her husband has been a fisherman since 2002. He fishes in the lake near the village.

Sokpum is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fruit for resale.

loans.use: To purchase fruit for resale

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus N. is an ex-soldier from the national army. After retirement, he decided to buy taxi car to provide transport service and he is now three years in the business. He derives income from the business for survival. His plan is to own minibuses from which he can derive enough income.

Titus needs a loan of TZS 600,000 (US$500) to expand the business and for spare parts.

loans.use: To buy some spare parts

loans.name: Marythza Rebeca

texts.es:
Marythza se dedica a la compra y venta de perfumes, trabaja con catálogos a pedido
Es soltera y también estudia, tiene 27 años y es la única que genera ingresos para sus gastos ya que es independiente. 
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería ( perfumes y cosméticos.
Vive en la zona Santa rosa de la ciudad de El Alto del departamento de La Paz. 
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Marythza buys and sells perfumes and works with orders from catalogues. She is single and a student. She is 27 years old and since she is independent, is the only one that generates income to cover her expenses. The loan will be used for the purchase of merchandise ( perfumes and cosmetics). She lives in the Santa Rosa zone of the city of El Alto of the department of La Paz. This is the second time that she request a loan from Impro. Her credit history classifies her as a #1 customer due to her good repayment history.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for the business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.fr:
Madame Hawa Dembélé est âgée de 51 ans, mariée elle vit avec son mari et ses 7 enfants  dans une famille nucléaire dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Comme beaucoup de femmes au Mali, elle n’as pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et était obligée d’embrancher une activité génératrice de revenus dès son jeune age. Après beaucoup d’échecs, elle décida de fabriquer et de vendre des boissons locales non alcoolisées depuis trois ans. Elle  jouit d’une grande  clientèle et  notoriété. 
En relation  avec le programme il y’ trois ans, elle  bénéficia de trois prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) et d’un prêt individuel avec Soro Yiriwaso tous remboursés correctement. Elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel et compte l’utiliser pour acheter, 3 sacs de sucres, 1 moteur de réfrigérateur et 2 cartons de poudre de jus. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place à Ségou. Madame Hawa Dembélé vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000FCFA. qui servira à  payer intérêts du prêt et les frais scolaires des enfants. Son ambition est de diversifier son activité en embrassant la vente de calebasses.
texts.en:
Hawa Dembélé is 51 years old, married and lives with her husband and seven children in a nuclear family in the neighbourhood of Darsalam in Ségou, Mali. Like many women in Mali, she never had the opportunity to attend school and was made to earn money from a young age. After a number of failures, she decided to prepare and sell local non-alcoholic drinks three years ago. She has many customers and is well known. She joined the program three years ago and has received three group loans and one individual loan from Soro Yiriwaso. She has fully repaid all previous loans. This is her second individual loan and she will use it to buy three bags of sugar, a motor for her refrigerator and two cartons of powdered juice. She buys her ingredients locally in Ségou. Hawa Dembélé sells both for cash and on credit to her customers, men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 45,000 FCFA which she will use to pay the interest on the loan and her children's tuition. Her goal is to diversify her business by selling calabashes.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make non-alcoholic drinks.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy B., 53, and his wife, Mrs. Phalla Sok, 54, who live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory worker; two children are in school and another one is a chef.

Vuthy has been a truck driver since 1993. He can earn about US$ 120 for each journey. His wife stays at home to take care of their children. He is requesting a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for his children to ride to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie G., 50, is married, and still has a capacity to manage a variety store in her community. She started her small business with a small stock, then she joined HSPFI and received an initial loan of PHP 5000.

She never stops thinking about how to improve and sustain her business in the long run. She supports her two grandchildren and sends them to school, because they were left by their parents when they were very young. She applied for PHP 18000 for her seventh loan. With this loan, she will purchase additional stock for her variety store.  She can now by groceries in bulk to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Mama

texts.en: Mama A. sells various provisions in Cape Coast. She is married with 2 children and has received no formal education. Her husband is employed as a trader. Mama has been selling various provisions since 1999, and is responsible for paying for the utilities and food. Her loan will be used to purchase more goods in order to fill the store, which will increase capital. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to purchase land.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to fill the store, which will increase capital.

loans.name: Bosede

texts.en: Bosede is 47 years old and married with 4 children. She sells cooked foods and drinks. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 42-year-old woman who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon with her husband and their three children. Fatmeh has been working as a seamstress for 15 years. She requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua, Kiva's partner, in order to purchase thread and new tools for her sewing machine. This is the first time that Fatmeh has requested a loan.

Fatmeh is speciA. in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her family members and friends. When she first started, she had financiA. issues. Fatmeh decided on doing her business because of her experience. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: Fatmeh will use the loan to purchase thread and new tools for her sewing machine

loans.name: Ulfatoy

texts.ru: Улфатой - молодая женщина 1983 года рождения. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Улфатой занимается переработкой козьей шерсти и производства шерстяной нити. Она этим занимается вместе со своей свекровью. Они домохозяйки, нигде не работают и дома занимается этой деятельностью. Их мужья занимаются скотоводством. Они перепродают скот, откармливают крупно-рогатый скот.  Улфатой и её свекровь помогают мужчинам в увеличении их семейного бюджета. Улфатой кредитуется в нашей организации более 2-х лет. Она успешно закончила свой предыдущий займ и хочет взять новый.
texts.en:
Ulfatoy is a young woman, who was born in 1983. She is married and the mother of three children. Together with her mother-in-law, Ulfatoy processes goat's wool and spins wool yarn. They are housewives without jobs outside the home, and run their business out of the house. Their husbands raise livestock, fattening large-horned cattle. Ulfatoy and her mother-in-law help the men to increase the family's income. Ulfatoy has been a loan customer of MicroInvest for more than two years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and would like to take out a new one.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Processing of goat's wool and spinning wool yarn

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 50 years old and is the widow of Elpidio T.. She has eight children: five were able to finish the secondary level of education; her sixth child, Jaypee, is 15 years old and has stopped attending high school because of financial difficulties; while Corazon, 11 years old, and Michelle, 8 years old are both studying in the primary level. 

Corazon is a vendor of native cakes which she sells in the public market of their town of Naguillan, Isabela. She cooks and sells her native cakes and is doing her best to develop the business to be able to generate a higher income for the education of her two younger children. She is hoping that somehow, through her business, she can increase her standard of living.

Corazon is requesting a loan of PHP 6,000 as additional working capital in the production of her native snacks. She further said that “in every sacrifice, there is a prize.” She is hoping that her prize will be enough to support her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Agnes Tawiah

texts.en:
Agnes Tawiah Q. is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school.

Agnes Tawiah sells watches, plates and jewelry at Mankesim near Cape Coast, which she has done since 1987. She uses her income for housekeeping. She will use the loan to purchase more plates and trinkets to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to expand her business and also to save towards building a house.

loans.use: To purchase more plates and trinkets to sell

loans.name: Lưu's Group

texts.en:
T. Lưu Thị is a 45-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. is the group leader of a nine-member group through SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đồng Thôn 01.


T. is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, T. owns and operates a business venture selling agricultural equipment.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling plant seedlings and young crops to local farmers.  T. has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 3,500,000 VND a month from these activities.


T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. is requesting a loan from SEDA for the first time.    She is requesting a loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Trương Thị Nụ is a 59-year-old female who is requesting a 4,256,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị  is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


3.  Lê Thị T. is a 46-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


4.  Trương Thị V. is a 40-year-old female who is requesting a 2,016,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop.


5.  Cao Thị Y. is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


6.  Nguyễn Thị T. is a 29-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business running a bakery.


7.  Nguyễn Thị D.  is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


8.  Truơng Thị H. is a 52-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Lưu Thị  là 45 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các giống cây trồng & cây con cho người nông dân địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.500.000 VND.  T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ SEDA.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Trương Thị Nụ là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.256.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Nghị  là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Lê Thị T.  là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Trương Thị V.  là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.016.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng T.t.


5.  Cao Thị Y. là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


6.  Nguyễn Thị T. là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh lò bánh mì.


7.  Nguyễn Thị D. là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


8.  Truơng Thị H.  là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional agricultural equipment to sell

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es: Elaboración de masitas, tortas, empanadas y rollitos es el negocio de la mayoría de las integrantes de la Asociación Comunal “El Sol”, también otras se dedican a vender ropa de hombre, mujer y niño. Todas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de insumos como la harina, levadura, leche, mantequilla y compra de mercadería. Están juntas hace 3 años aproximadamente y los créditos que obtuvieron siempre lo han invertido en el negocio, además a todas les gusta capacitarse y hacerse controles en el consultorio de Salud.
texts.en:
The majority of the members of the El Sol cooperative make pastries, meat pies, and small rolls. Other members sell clothing for men, women, and children. They all need the loan to purchase supplies such as flour, yeast, milk and butter, or to buy merchandise.

They have been together for approximately three years. All of their previous loans have been invested in the business. In addition, they would all like to improve their competence and get medical check ups at the health clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Oeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Oeth C. is a villager in Poun Village in Takeo province. She is a basket maker. Her husband, Mr. Saesh Net, is shown in the photo with her. The couple has four children, two of whom are attending the local school while the others are too young to work or study. 

Mrs. Oeth C.’s husband is farmer who owns a plot of land on which he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he needs some money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer to support the crop. Thus, Mrs. Oeth C. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Freddy Daniel

texts.es: Freddy Daniel A. es un joven emprendedor de 23 años de edad, con un hijo que es la persona más importante de su existencia. él y su esposa han podido auto mantenerse con muchos esfuerzos pues él estuvo trabajando como albañil el cual es un trabajo muy pesado, pero con mucho entusiasmo decidió guardar dinero en cada pago que recibía y empezó a comprar cerdos para engorde el cual ha sido un negocio rentable. pues sus ingresos han sido más altos, sin embargo el está necesitando un financiamiento para ampliar  él lugarcito donde tiene a los cerdos y empezar a comprar más cerdos .el sueño más anhelado es tener una vida cómoda y dándole a su familia la manutención que se merecen y vivir junto a ellos sin preocupaciones económicas.
texts.en:
Freddy Daniel A. is a young, 23-year-old entrepreneur who has a child who is the most important person in his life. He and his wife have been able to support themselves through a lot of hard work. Freddy worked in the construction industry, which was a very hard job, but eagerly decided to save a little money from each wage that he received and began to buy pigs to raise, a venture that has proved profitable. Although he is earning more money now, Freddy needs this loan to extend the area where he keeps the pigs and to purchase more to raise. His greatest wishes are to have a comfortable life, provide his family with the support they deserve, and live together with them without economic concerns.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Laulensia

texts.en:
Laulensia is a member of the Tanganyika borrower group in Kinayanambo, Iringa. She is married and a mother of 4 children. her children are 18, 16, 10, 5 years old. She also cares for other 1 dependent.

Laulensia has owned a business selling local beer for 10 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly  profits approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Laulensia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more maize for local beer.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Laulensia hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy maize for local beer

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil is a married man with one child. He's 34 years old. He has been engraving since 1993 and he supports his family with this business. Khalil is applying for a loan of $800 to buy a car to be able to travek and satisfy the demands of his clients more quickly.

loans.use: To buy a car for his business

loans.name: Oun

texts.en: Mrs. Oun S. lives in the village of Sophy in Takeo province. She makes wine with rice to sell and also breeds pigs to earn income. Since her pig breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing five more piglets and pig food. She also would use the rest of the requested loan to buy a cow for breeding. Her husband, Mr. Sok Phorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivate rices. Aside from this plantation, he is a motorbike taxi driver. Mrs. Oun S. is 34 years old and the mother of three children: two of whom are attending the local school, while the youngest is too young to work or study. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig food and a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang D. is 30 years old and a married man. Hang D. was married years ago and has no child yet. He is currently a recycling seller - he buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods he deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires and plastic. Additionally, his wife stays at home to braid rattan furniture for sale.

Hang D. is looking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle in order to make his family transportation easier. Hang D. was not available at that day, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle in order to make family transportation easier

loans.name: Abdramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdramane  Traoré  est âgé de 34 ans marié et père de quatre enfants. Il est domicilié  avec sa femme et ses enfants dans la quartier Banconi–Koulikoro, région de Sikasso.
Abdramane après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à l’ activité d'achat- stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) il y a maintenant sept  ans. Il dispose d’un magasin à Kaboïla I en face de la clinique médicale Guinso. Il est très sollicité.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il compte acheter, 23 sacs de maïs et 23 sacs de mil en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ces marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’êtres revendues en gros à une clientèle composée des détaillants et des chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdramane Traoré, 34, is married and the father of 4 children. He lives with his wife and his children in the Banconi–Koulikoro district, Sikasso region. Abdramane, after having tried out a number of businesses with no success, began buying, warehousing, and selling cereals (maize, millet, and sorghum) seven years ago. He has a store in Kaboïla I, opposite the Guinso medical clinic. He is a very popular merchant.

Wishing to better serve his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan.

He expects to buy 23 sacks of maize and 23 sacks of millet from the areas surrounding Sikasso. He warehouses the merchandise so that he can then sell it wholesale to a clientele composed of retailers and heads of households.

He expects to use this loan to make a monthly profit of 100,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow his working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing the rest back into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Geyssel Carolina

texts.es: Geyssel Carolina tiene la edad de 22 años, ella tiene 1 hijo y actualmente estudia pues esta a su cargo. La ubicación del negocio de es el mercado. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que tiene de poseer este negocio, ya que surgió porque le gusta trabajar fuertemente y es así como decide vender estos productos. Los propósitos de ella son de invertir en suficientes productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para aplicarlo al capital de trabajo y así efectuar la compra de golosinas, pan, gaseosa y jugos. Sus sueños son de establecer una pulpería en su vivienda ya que la posee actualmente es en el mercado central.
texts.en:
Geyssel Carolina is 22-years-old and has one dependent child who is currently going to school. She works at a small grocery store which is located in a market. She has had this business for more than three years and she started it because she likes to work hard and so she decided to sell these products. Her goals are to invest in enough products to satisfy her customers' demand. The loan she has requested will be used for working capital and to allow her to purchase candy, bread, soft drinks, and juices. She dreams of starting a small grocery store in her home since her current one is owned by the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy candy, bread, soft drinks, and juices

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
La señorita Karen es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 6 meses atrás, del distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella estudió superior completa, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Karen nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más productos.

Ella solicitará un crédito de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar bayeta y lana.

Su sueño para el futuro es viajar al extranjero con sus productos y ejercer su profesión. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Miss Karen has been a partner of “La Juleñita” community bank for the past six months. The bank is in the disrict of Juli, provence of Chucuito in the neighborhood of Puno. She is 20 years old, single and does not have children. She has her high school studies completed and works selling handcrafts. Karen tells us of her first loan requested with the Manuela Ramos Movement that was for S/500 Peruvian nuevos soles. This loan helped her to increase her working capital and to buy more products. She is requesting a loan of S/400 nuevos soles with which she will buy wool and embroidery materials. Her dreams for the future are to travel abroad with her products and practice her profession. What she likes most about her community bank are the savings and their punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy buy wool and embroidery material

loans.name: Paulo

texts.en:
Paulo K. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Paulo is single. To make a living, Paulo owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport to passengers in the local community. Paulo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Paulo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Paulo is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Paulo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sikirath

texts.fr: T. Sikirath est née le 16 Mars 1972 à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji au Bénin. Sikirath s’est installée, il y a près de 8 ans, à Tchonvi Ayimlonfidé dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Mariée à OUSMAN un soudeur, Sikirath est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et venir en aide à son mari, Sikirath vend divers produits de beauté de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Sikirath s’approvisionne. Sikirath mène cette activité il y a environs cinq ans. C’est la première fois que Sikirath sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra d’agrandir son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients.
texts.en:
T. Sikirath was born on March 16, 1972 in Ekpè, in the community of Sèmè-Podji, in Benin. She got situated nearly eight years ago in Tchonvi Ayimlonfidé, in Sèmè-Podji. Married to OUSMAN, welder, she is the mother of two children, who are both in school. The family lives together in this district. The couple jointly ensures that house expenses are covered. To meet her needs and to help out her husband, Sikirath sells a variety of beauty products door-to-door. Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she stocks up. She has been in this business for about five years. This is the first time she has requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow her to expand her business and to cope better with the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beauty products

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Sebastiana Rojas quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.

La sra. Francisca C. posee una despensa, invirtió el dinero en la compra de mercaderías en general ( panificados, lácteos, bebidas.

La sra. Carmen R. I. se dedica a la venta de Lencería, invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas intimas, logrando obtener mayor variedad de prendas que ofrecer a su clientela.

La sra. Limpia N. se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, invirtió el dinero en la compra de insumo para la elaboración de los productos de limpieza, obteniendo así mayor variedad de productos de limpieza que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Nilda C. se dedica a la venta de CD, invirtió el dinero en la compra de esa mercadería, logrando ofrecer mayor  variedad de esa mercadería a sus clientes.

La sra. Nadia Gómez se dedica a la venta de prendas intimas, invirtió el dinero en la compra de prendas intimas en general, logrando ofrecer variedad y calidad de lencería a sus clientes.

La sra. Maria G. posee un copetín, invirtió el dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de los comestible, logrando de ese modo ofrecer buena variedad de minutas a sus clientes.

La sra. Antonia V. posee una ferretería,  invirtió el dinero en la compra de  mercaderias en general y en materiales para su trabajo  ofrciendo asi un buen servicio y buenos precios a sus clientes.

La sra. Ruth N. se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, invirtió el dinero en la compra de productos en general, logrando ofrecer calidad y variedad de cosméticos a su clientela.

La sra. Sonia P. es peluquera , invirtió el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo, logrando ofrecer un buen servicio para sus clientes.

La sra. Bernarda Aguera se dedica la venta de  prendas de vestir invirtió el dinero en la compra de Prendas de vestir  en general, logrando asi  ofrecer buena variedad de prendas  de vestir a sus clientes.

La sra. Norma R. M.  es manicurista, invirtio el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo, logrando de eso modo ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.

La sra. Lucia R. se dedica a la venta de helados, invirtio el dinero en la compra de helados al por mayor, logrando ofreciendo  calidad y variedad de helados a su clientela.

La sra. Nancy Servin se dedica a la venta de lenceria, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esa prendas en general,logrando ofrecer una  buena variedad de prendas intimas a sus clientes.

La sra. Zunilda P. se dedica a la venta de Comestible , invirtio el  dinero en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboracion de los comestibles, logrando de ese modo buena variedad de minutas que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La sra. Claudia P. posee una despensa, invirtio el dinero en la compra de esas mercaderias en general ( bebidas, lacteos, panificados, etc.), logrando asi ofrecer una buena variedad de mercederias a sus clientes. 

La sra. Ana C. es costurera, invirtio el dinero en la compra de materiales para su trabajo ( tela, hilo, goma) logrando ofrecer una buena variedad de prendas a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The point person for starting this committee was señora Sebastiana Rojas, who invited and organized her friends to start Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras (Committee of Enterprising Women). Sra. Francisca C. owns a grocery. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise (baked goods, dairy products and beverages). Sra. Carmen R. I. makes her living selling lingerie. She invested the money in the purchase of undergarments, allowing her a greater variety of undergarments to offer to her customers. Sra. Limpia N. makes her living selling cleaning products. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make the cleaning products, thus obtaining a greater variety of cleaning products to offer to her customers. Sra. Nilda C. makes her living selling CDs. She invested the money in the purchase of more merchandise, allowing her to offer a greater variety of that merchandise to her customers. Sra. Nadia Gómez makes her living selling undergarments. She invested to money in the purchase of general undergarments, allowing her to offer a greater variety and quality of lingerie to her customers. Sra. Maria G. owns a snack bar. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make the dishes, thus being able to to offer a considerable variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Antonia V. owns a hardware store. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise and materials for her work, thus being able to offer quality service and good prices to her customers. Sra. Ruth N. makes her living selling cosmetics. She invested the money in the purchase of general products, allowing her to offer a variety of quality cosmetics to her customers. Sra. Sonia P. is a hairdresser. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her job, allowing her to offer better service to her clients. Sra. Bernarda Aguera makes her living selling clothing. She invested the money in the purchase of general garments, allowing her to offer a considerable variety of garments to her customers. Sra. Norma R. M. is a manicurist. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her work, thus being able to offer quality service to her customers. Sra. Lucia R. makes her living selling ice cream. She invested the money in the purchase of wholesale ice cream, allowing her to offer a variety of quality ice cream to her customers. Sra. Nancy Servin makes her living selling lingerie. She invested the money in the purchase of this type of garment, allowing her to offer a considerable variety of undergarments to her customers. Sra. Zunilda P. makes her living selling snacks. She invested the money in the purchase of ingredients to make her snacks, thus being able to offer a greater variety of snacks to her customers. Sra. Claudia P. owns a grocery. She invested the money in the purchase of general merchandise (beverages, dairy products, bakery products etc.), thus offering a considerable variety of merchandise to her clients. Sra. Ana C. is a seamstress. She invested the money in the purchase of materials for her work (fabric, thread, elastics) allowing her to offer a considerable variety of garments to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise such as noodles, sugar, bakery products, dairy products, oil and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for her business

loans.name: Amaka

texts.en: Amaka is 50 years old and married with nine children. Her children and her husband, who she supports with profits from her business, reside in Lagos, Nigeria. She sells bags and has been in the business for 10 years. She is requesting NGN 100,000 to purchase more bags to sell and increase her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their huge support.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell.

loans.name: Adiatou

texts.fr: Née en 1984, A. Adiatou est mariée à IBRAHIM Abdoulaye, un soudeur, et est mère de deux enfants. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge.  Parmi les enfants, certains sont scolarisés. Il y a près de huit ans que la famille s’est installée à Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple se partage ensemble les différentes charges familiales.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Adiatou exerce comme activité la vente de divers produits (savons, piles, sucre, lait, conserves de tomate et de sardine, pâtes alimentaires, etc.) à son domicile. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin que Adiatou achète ses produits. Adiatou a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Adiatou souhaite renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, Adiatou sollicite un deuxième prêt de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1984, Ms. A. Adiatouis is married to Mr. IBRAHIM Abdoulaye, a welder, and is the mother of two children.  The couple have another children in their care.  Of these children, some are in school.  The family settled in Djeffa, in the town of Sèmè-Podji, nearly eight years ago. Together, the couple are sharing the various family expenses.  To meet her needs, Adiatou has a business selling a variety of goods (soaps, batteries, sugar, milk, canned tomatoes and sardines, pasta, etc.) out of her home.  She purchases her supplies in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She once obtained a loan from ALIDé.  She wishes to bolster her business and to respond better to the demands of her customers.  To do so, Adiatou is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a variety of goods (soap, milk, sugar, canned tomatoes and sardines, etc.)

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es:
La Sra. Amelia  tiene 60 años, es separada hace 5 años, tiene un comedor frente a una Fabrica donde les da de desayunar, almorzar y de cenar en alguno casos a los chóferes de camiones de cargas y sus ayudantes que vienen a retirar los productos, ella  tiene varios hijos pero ya todos están  casados y  tienen su familia.
La Sra. Amelia  actualmente esta  alquilando el local donde vive y tiene su comedor pero su idea mas adelante es comprar esa casa ya que le resulta el negocio por la ubicación.
 El proyecto de este crédito es la compra, Utensilios  y Equipos para la mejor atención y sus clientes ,como mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
Sra. Amelia, 60, has been separated for 5 years. She has a restaurant across from a factory where she serves breakfast, lunch and dinner to the drivers of trucks and their helpers who deliver products there. She has several children but they're all grown and have their own families. Sra. Amelia is now renting the space where she both lives and operates her restaurant, but she would like to buy it eventually. The purpose of this loan is to buy utensils and other supplies, such as tables and chairs, for the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La señora Maria es cliente nueva quien se dedica a la confeccion y comercializacion D. prendas D. vestir especificamente chamaras D. tela kaki y piel D. durazno, tambien confecciona sacos D. tela polar y deportivos D. distinto material estos ultimos solo los elabora a pedido.  ella vive en casa propia la que se encuentra ubicada en la zona la Portada, la cliente vive con su hijo el cual le ayuda en los diseños D. bordados que llevan sus prendas D. vestir.  La comercializacion la realiza D. forma ambulante por la calle MancoKapac y en la feria 16 D. julio lugares conocidos donD. se asientan varios vendedores ambulantes que no tienen puesto fijo D. venta, venD. los dias jueves y viernes, el destino D. la inversion es la D. comprar telas Piel D. Durazno y Kaki para la confeccion D. chamarras. La sra.
