Maria es muy trabajadora siempre innovando en la confeccion D.  productos D. vestir, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Maria is a new Emprender customer who makes and sells items of clothing, specifically khaki jackets and smooth-skin jackets; she also makes custom thermal sports jackets from various materials. She lives in her own home located in the La Portada zone. She lives with her son who helps her with the designs and finishings of the articles of clothing. She sells her goods on foot on MancoKapac street in the July 16th market, places with many merchants who do not have a fixed storefront. She sells on Thursdays and Fridays. The loan will be used to buy more cloth to make her jackets. Maria is very hardworking and is always innovating with new products; she is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing their confidence in her by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (cloth)

loans.name: Tananko Ole

texts.en:
Tananko Ole B. is 35 years old. He is married to Nation Ene B. and is the father of three school-aged children. Tananko has been farming on his own piece of land for the last four years.

Tananko learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his first loan. He is planning to use it on his twenty acres of wheat, which is doing very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to lease more land for farming to increase his wheat production.

His future dreams are to be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes and to build a residential house for renting. Tananko is a hard working man and determined to reach his set goals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma Y. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Barangay Polo, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental with her husband and their 20-year-old child who is still currently going to school. Wilma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000. Wilma is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can continue her general store and pig-fattening businesses. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Wilma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Uamsho Group

texts.fr:
la cliente,  W. est  entrepreneur, productrice de boisson locale communément appelé  « Rutuku » , elle lève courageusement sa main  sur la photo,  excellente cliente de banque communautaire « Uamsho »,  âgée de 44 ans, veuve, mère de 3 enfants(2 garçons et une fille).Le  fils ainé  étudie en 2e graduat (bac), le second avait refusé les études et le cadet fait la 3e primaire.  La veuve  Manda W. réside dans le quartier  périphérique de majengo, bidon ville de la ville de Goma 
Son mari fut victime et décédé dans la guerre de 1996 dit de « libération » de l’AFDL (Alliance de Force Démocratique pour la Libération du Congo), mouvement politico militaire dirigé par le défunt président Laurent Désiré Kabila, qui a renversé le pouvoir dictatorial du défunt président Mobutu Seseseko. 
 De façon sommaire, « Rutuku » est une boisson  alcoolisée d’environ 47% produite en base de solution ou mélange des fermentations  et moisissures des Farine de manioc, maïs, sorgho, etc. chauffée au feu à plus de 180o C , à travers une vase connectée à un cheminé d’évacuation de technologie locale. Les goutes raffinées d’évaporation issue de ce cheminé sont accueillies dans une cuvette et  refroidies pour donner un gout d’une liqueur whisky fort apprécié par les consommateurs (soulards). 
 La veuve  Manda W. a commencé son petit commerce  avec  son fonds propre d’une valeur de 30$ par la fabrication  et vente de beignets (Ndazi). Malheureusement  les recettes de vente de beignets étaient insuffisantes pour couvrir toutes les charges familiales, ainsi elle a préféré diversifier les activités  et commencer à ventre la boisson locale. En plus de cette activité. La veuve  Manda W. vend aussi la bière Primus, Fanta, pour accroitre ses revenus.
Avec  le crédit  de  l’IMF Hekima, la veuve  Manda W. souhaite augmenter son chiffre d’affaire en achetant  2 sacs de sucres, 15 paquets de levure (pour la fabrication des beignets), 1 sac de des Maïs, 2 sacs de farines maniocs, 4 tas de bois de chauffage (pour production boisson), etc. 
La veuve  Manda W., explique le défi majeur de son activité de production de boissons locales Rutuku est lié aux ventes au crédit. En plus parfois lorsque le mélange des intrants n’a pas bien être solutionné, on produit une boisson non appréciée par les consommateurs, et les clients se réservent de l’acheter.
La  veuve Manda W. a déjà acheté sa propre parcelle pour son fils, elle compte y construire une maison. En outre elle  souhaite marier  pour son fils qui avait  engrossé une fille, aujourd’hui, ils ont déjà 2 enfants ensembles sans pour autant verser la dot auprès de sa famille. 
Le groupe Uamsho est composé de 13 femmes. La veuve  Manda W. remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  les crédits  qu’elle reçoit sans aucune garantie matérielle car grâce à ces crédits, elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants orphelins.
texts.en:
W., the client, is an entrepreneur and produces a local drink called 'Rutuku'. In the photo she is bravely raising her arm. She is an excellent customer of the Uamsho credit association, and is a 44 year old widowed mother of three (two boys and a girl). Her elder son is studying in his second year (bac exam year), the second pulled out of his studies, and the youngest is in the third year of primary school. Manda W. lives in the outer quarter of Majengo, a shanty town in Goma. Her husband was a victim of the 1996 war and so-called 'liberation' of the AFDL (Alliance of Democratic Force for the Liberation of the Congo), a military-political movement led by the former president Laurent Désiré Kabila who overturned the dictatorial power of president Mobutu Seseseko, 'Rutuku' is an alcoholic beverage made from a mixture of fermentations and manioc flour, corn, sorghum etc that are heated to over 180 degrees C, then passed through a flask connected to a chimney outlet made locally. The refined drops are then collected in a flask and cooled in order to create a strong whiskey-like taste that is appreciated greatly by her customers. Manda W. began her business activity with $30 of her own money, which went towards the production and sale of doughnuts (Ndazi). Unfortunately the sales of doughnuts were not enough to pay all her family's costs, and so she diversified her business and started to sell the local drink. In addition to this, she sells Primus beer and Fanta to boost her revenue. She would use a loan to purchase 2 bags of sugar, 15 packs of yeast (for the production of doughnuts), one bag of corn, two bags of manioc flour, 4 heaps of firewood (for the production of the drink), etc. She has explained that the major challenge in producing the drink is to do with credit sales. But also, sometimes if the ingredients have not been well mixed, her customers do not like the drink that is produced and refrain from buying it. She has already bought a plot of land for her son and aims to build a house on it. She would also like her son to marry the woman with whom he has two children, in order for her dowry to be split among the family. The Uamsho group is made up of 13 women. Manda W. is grateful to Hekima IMF for the loans that she will receive, as with these loans she will be able to see to her fatherless children's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: two bags of sugar, 15 packs of yeast (for doughnuts), one bag of corn, two bags of manioc flour , four heaps of firewood (for production of the drink) etc

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El szeñor Francisco M. M., tiene la edad de 52 años, es casado y su esposa le apoya en los gastos del hogar laborando como comerciante de ropa y calzado, ellos se dedican desde hace 10 años a esta actividad y a sido su fuente de ingresos y el sustento diario de su familia.

Actualmente habitan en humilde hogar, y con el esfuerzo de su pareja y él, han construido su nuevo hogar y en este mes realizaron las levatamiento de paredes y solicitan un prestamo terminar este proceso y avanzazr en gran medida las remodelaciones, esta inversion le permitira ofrecerle a su familia una vivienda mas optima y digna para su mejor desarrollo socio economico.
texts.en:
Francisco M. M., 52, is married. His wife contributes to household expenses working as a clothing and shoe merchant. They have been in this line of work for 10 years and it’s been the source of income and support for the family. They currently live in a humble abode. With help from his wife they have built a new home and this month they raised the walls. They are requesting a loan to finish this project and to move forward with the home improvements. This investment will provide the family with a much more appropriate and proper home for their socio-economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For home improvements.

loans.name: Freddie

texts.en: Freddie C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. He is 40 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Manaoag. Freddie has been in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Freddie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. This will be his eighth loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise

loans.name: Nyambirizi Bahingi Barungi, Bushenyi Group

texts.en: In village called Nyambirizi, Bushenyi, there is a determined lady K. Joselyne, aged 35 years. She is a go-getter businesswoman who has been dealing in general merchandise, owning a retail shop. This stickler of hard work is also a widowed mother of 5. She has basked in the career graces of her business for the last 4 years. With this experience behind her, she has managed to subdue most of the uncertain adversities that have threatened to play havoc with her business. Each month her business generates a profit of 20,000 Ugandan shillings. This, to all intents and purposes, is a low figure. What has played into her hands, as she operates her business, has been her exceptional skill in customer relations. As it is now, she is taking a long view with an aim of maximizing her small profits. She figures this loan will come in significantly handy in helping her buy more inventory as currently she sells small household items.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for business for resale.

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Winner B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called In God we Trust. Winner is 38 years old, single, and has two children who range from 9 to 16 years old. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to poverty. 

For more than 2 years, she has been selling red oil in Redlight Market, Paynesville, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 7,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 35,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more gallons of red oil. She describes herself as a kind woman.

Her goal is to grow her business, and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more gallons of red oil.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka is a 29-year-old outgoing woman. She is a single mother of one. She runs a salon and a mobile money transfer business. For additional income, she rents out houses. Milka formerly ran a grocery store. She has been running her businesses for three years and hopes to open several beauty shops in the future so as to improve her standard of living. She also dreams of adding rental houses in five years. She is thankful to Faulu Kenya because she bought a container which people use as small kiosk and rented it out in three months. With the Mwangaza group in Faulu Kenya, she has been able to service three loans. She is requesting another loan of 80,000 KES to buy hair chemicals, hair braids and a float for her mobile money transfer business.

loans.use: To to buy hair chemicals, hair braids and a float for her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro es soltero  tiene 42 años sin hijos, el señor cuenta con su concubina que le ayuda en el trabajo.
El señor fue joyero durante muchos años, actualmente se dedica a la recarga de oxigeno y venta de joyas en forma ambulante, cuenta con una clientela formada de varios años.
Le gustaría mas adelante abrir para su propia joyería ya que tiene experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con varios clientes.
Solicita el préstamo para abastece su disponibilidad de oxigeno y también para la compra de joyas de plata como cadenas, aros, medallas y otros.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is 42, single, and he has no children. His girlfriend helps him with his work. Pedro was a jeweler for many years, but currently he works refilling oxygen tanks and selling jewelry as a street merchant. He has customers that he has developed over the years. He would like to open his own jewelry store in the future now that he has experience in this business and has some customers. He is requesting a loan to fill his oxygen supply, and also to buy silver jewelry such as chains, earrings, medals, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refill oxygen and to buy silver jewelry such as chains, pins, and medals.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel M. D. C. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, en donD. vive junto a su esposo, el cual trabajo como comerciante D. productos varios. Reina posee un molino el cual alquila para que las personas muelan la comida, así mismo comercializa leña, maíz, especias y otros productos más, todo esto con el fin D. poder ganarse la vida D. una forma digna. Reina desea mucho poder brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a  su esposo quien le ayuda a atender el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo a través del cual  pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. maíz, leña, y especias, los cuales son los productos que más venD., así mismo poder darle el mantenimiento necesario para el molino para ofrecer un servicio optimo y D. esta manera contar con más clientes.
texts.en: Reina Isabel M. D. C. is 41 years old and lives in the department of Usulután with her husband who works selling varied products.  Reina owns a mill that she rents so that people grind food and she also sells firewood, corn, spices, and other items, all with the goal of being able to earn a living in a decent way.  Reina wants very much to be able to proviD. all of the necessary help to her husband, who helps her tend to the business.  This is why she is requesting a loan so that she can buy larger quantities of corn, firewood, and spices (the products that she sells most), as well as service the mill so that she can proviD. the best service and have more customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her mill and to buy spices to sell

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es: Damaris del Socorro G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora la cual se dedica al comercio de bolsos de manera ambulante, es decir que comercializa de casa en casa. Esta actividad la empezó hace seis años y su meta es tener una tienda con las instalaciones adecuadas para su negocio.
texts.en: Damaris del Socorro G. is a hardworking, strong, and industrious woman. She dedicates herself to selling handbags house to house. She started selling this way 6 years ago and her goal is to have a store with adequate installations for her business.

loans.use: Handbags

loans.name: Lucia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Lucia es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene un trabajo fijo en zona franca y venta de ropa para lograr ayudarse económicamente y lograr un equilibrio en sus gastos.
Su anhelo es la terminación de su casa que ha venido construyendo junto con su esposo que se esfuerzan por tener un techo mejor donde vivir.
Ha venido logrando la terminación con financiamiento que Afodenic está dando para avanzar en la mejor brevedad.
Lo que hará con este nuevo préstamo es seguir levantando paredes de concreto y poner techo. Lo que está contenta porque cada vez se ha posible su sueño. Lo que comprara: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, zinc, cuartones entre otros y seguir la obra.
texts.en:
Lucia is a very hard-working young woman.  She has a regular job in a free-trade zone and sells clothes to help herself financially and to achieve balance in her expenses.

Her dream is to finish her house which she has been building together with her husband.  They are working hard to have a better place to live.

She has been finishing her house with loans which Afodenic have been providing so that she can advance as quickly as possible.

She will use this new loan to continue putting up concrete walls and put a roof on her house.  She is happy to be fulfilling her dream.  She will buy blocks, sand, cement, iron, corrugated metal roofing, joists, etc. and continue her work.

loans.use: To buy blocks, sand, cement, iron, corrugated metal roofing and joists to continue building walls and succeed in finishing her house

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan K., aged 40 years, is a business lady in Kasarani who runs a hardware shop. She is married to Solomon K. and together they have a daughter aged 18 years and in high school. Susan has been running this business for a period of one year and her monthly income is Kshs 50,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by the credit officer in charge of Thika Road office, and she has applied for a loan of Kshs 30000 loan, which she will add to her income and buy more floor and wall tiles, toilet seats and covers. She is hopeful that the investment will bring in more profits, which she will use to increase her stock to grow her business further.

Susan dreams of becoming a distributor in building materials and eventually start importing hardware materials. This will help her educate her daughter to the university level and empower her to be self-reliant.

loans.use: To increase her stock of floor and wall tiles, sinks, and toilet seats.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is a 36-year-old married lady.  She is blessed with five children. To raise her family, she operates a cafeteria. She has been running the business for three years. She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business.  She has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy furniture, soda and cakes.

loans.use: To buy furniture, cakes and soda

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is from the village of Magsaysay, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 60 years old. Josefina is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Josefina owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Josefina has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Josefina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josefina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Josefina is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Josefina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa F. is a married woman who lives in Yulo street, Brgy. 8, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pig fattening business.

Her husband Hermilo, who is 36 years-old, works as a vendor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have three children who are between 6 to 16 years old. 

Elsa joined Kiva partner NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elsa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.

Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 12,000, lifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 28,000, which she intends to use to buy piglets, chickens and a goat to raise so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business and education of her children.

Elsa F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the poverty alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org in order to join our team.

loans.use: To fund the operation of her pig and livestock business.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim, the wife of H. N., resides in a city called Khanewal in Pakistan. Khanewal is famous for its agriculture industry. She owns a two-room house there where she has been living with her family for the past 20 years. Shamim has given birth to four children: three boys and one girl. All of her children are enrolled in school and are getting their education. 
 
Shamim is a 42-year-old housewife who prefers to stay at home to manage the household responsibilities. Her husband is involved in an animal sales business. He buys animals from the animal market at cheap rates. He raises them and then sells them to clients. He has been in this business for five years.
 
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and raise them to sell at a good profit.
  
Shamim is hopeful that through this investment her husband’s business will become improved and he will be able to serve many more clients as a result. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called the Asasah Passbook) is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy goats for animal sales business

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mr. Mey S. lines in Kansaom Ak village in Takeo province. He was born in 1975. He and his wife, Mrs. Et Loeung, are farmers who own a 2-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is also a bread seller and a laborer. In the dry season, he has some problems when it is time to grow rice. So, to improve production, Mr. Mey S. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire farm laborers. 

He is the father of two children, one of whom is enrolled in the local public school while the other is too small to work or study. His wife is in the photo with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and to hire farm laborers to grow rice

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma comes from Faisalabad which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is known for its textile industry. She has lived there in the area of Barkatpura with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 20 years. She is married to I. who is 54 years old and doesn’t have a job. 

Najma is a talented lady who operates a boutique business at her home. She is expert in preparing plain and also embroidered dresses. She displays her work at her boutique and also supplies clothes to different clothing shops in the market.  She is the mother of three sons. Her eldest son works in a factory, and other two are drivers and provide transport services. 

Najma has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy clothes and embroidery materials like beads, colored thread, etc to make larger quantity of clothes. She will also hire a worker who will assist her in completing her work. She is hopeful that her 5 years of business experience will help her in expanding her business on larger scale after the loan investment and her family will be able to have a better standard of life as a result. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with her hand raised is Najma.

loans.use: To buy clothes and embroidery material for boutique business

loans.name: Musyoki

texts.en:
Musyoki M., aged 38, runs a quarry business in Lukenya. He is married to Penninah Musyoki, aged 32, who is a businesswoman, and together they have three children who are Mutheu 18 years old, Monica 16 years old, and Mwalimu 14 years old. Musyoki was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing customer.

Musyoki’s business is located in Lukenya and it has been in operation for the last eight years. The business earns him a monthly profit of Kshs 12,500. He intends to purchase another plot of quarry land with the loan of Kshs 30,000.

If the loan boosts his business, he will buy a plot of land and build commercial houses. He hopes to have a big quarry land and purchase a lorry to be delivering materials to customers. He describes himself as hard-working and focused.

loans.use: Purchase another quarry land

loans.name: Boren

texts.en:
Boren S. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. 

S. raises and sells rice, earning an income of US $2.5 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of US $3.5 per day. Each month, the family has to spend US $43 on food and US $40 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase cattle to help plow the rice field. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy cattle to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Paulina; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con los negocios de compra y venta de ganado y también tiene una tienda de abarrotes que trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia trabaja juntamente con su hijo, la socia quiere mejorar sus negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ganados y comprar productos como arroz, azúcar y fideos para la tienda de abarrotes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SANTA ROSITA DE AYLLUPAMPA" communal bank which is located in the district and province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Mrs. Paulina is 62 years old, single and has a son.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of buying and selling livestock.  She also has a grocery store that she runs from 6:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m.  She works with her son and wants to improve her business.

Her loan request is to buy livestock and products such as rice, sugar and pasta for her grocery store.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy livestock and products such as rice, sugar, and pasta for her grocery store

loans.name: Casimiro Nhamuge

texts.pt:
Casimiro Nhamazane S. nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique solteiro. Fez somente 2ª classe nao continuou porque os pais nao dispunham de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 4 sobrinhos que vivem com ele.

Saiu de Gaza para Maputo devido a guerra e veio com a sua familia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade que desenvolve ha mais de 20 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de cerca de  4.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversa com amigos que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (arroz, sabao, feijao, amendoim e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de  9.000.00mt ambos e para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para construir um estabelecimento comercial de raiz como forma de melhorar o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Casimiro Nhamazane S. was born in Chibuto District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique, and he is single. He only finished second grade and did not continue with school because his parents could not afford it. He lives in his own house with his family and supports four relatives (nephews and/or nieces) who live with him.

He left Gaza to move to Maputo because of the war, and he came here with his family. For more than 20 years he has had his own business selling staple goods. Casimiro has no employees and has a monthly income of about 4,000 meticais, which he uses for household expenses. He is also able to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

Casimiro has never had loans from other banks, and he learned about Hluvuku by talking with friends who are customers of this institution. This is his third Hluvuku loan, and he is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy products (rice, soap, beans, peanuts and other items) to increase his inventory. The previous loans were both for 9,000 meticais and were for the business.

He promises to make his payments on time so he can take out more loans in the future. He intends to ask for more loans to build a brand-new store as a way of improving his business.

loans.use: to buy products (rice, soap, beans, peanuts, etc.)

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 67 años, es una mujer inspiradora en su trabajado que inicio su actividad hace varios años en la venta de jugos naturales y tostada en su carreta fuera de su domicilio.

Ella labora todos los día en su careta de jugos para venderles a su clientela. Con la ayuda del prestamos quiere mejorar su negocio en la compra de una nueva carreta y tostadora para incrementar sus ganancia. Ella anhela tener mas salud para seguir en su negocio.
texts.en:
María is 67 years old and an inspiring, hard working woman who began her business selling natural juices and tostadas in front or her house a few years ago.

She sells to her customers with her juice cart daily.  She wants to improve her business and wants to buy a new toaster with the help of these loans, in hopes of increasing her income.  Her desire is to be healthier so that she can continue her business.

loans.use: to buy a new toaster

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem is very supportive by nature and always ready to help her family in the time of need.  She operates a grocery store. She utilizes her guest room for her grocery store where she sells daily use items like sugar, rice, spices and cooking oils etc to her community clients. 

Her husband is a vegetable vendor by profession. He also has a horse. He gets up early in the morning, goes to the vegetable market on his horse cart, buys vegetables from the vegetable market and then sells them in his shop. 

Naseem has given birth to three sons. All of them are unable to get an education because Nasreen and her husband are unable to afford their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her grocery store business. Using the loan she will buy more groceries for her store to improve it.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Mrs. Elena is 32 years of age, married, and a resident of Silangit, Tangub City.
With this condition, they had financial hardships in meeting their daily basic needs. She decided to engage in snack vending and she has now been in this business for 3 years. She earns an average net income of P3,500.00 a month which greatly benefits the family. 

Mrs. Elena joined PAGLAUM MPC 3 years ago because she was interested in the organization's products and services.  PAGLAUM has been recognized as one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao and was named the Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines at the  COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006. 

This is Mrs. Elena's sixth loan.  She has been given a loan amount of P14,900.00 to purchased raw ingredients for her snack vending. The future income from this business will be used for daily basic needs and savings and loan repayments. She is hoping that this business will become more successful and more progressive.

loans.use: to purchased raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina, age 38, has owned and operated a retail store in her village for almost four years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP in order to purchase additional commodities to sell. Her net income is 25,000 PHP a month. 

She is grateful for the continued assistance offered to her by Kiva lenders and intends to further improve her business. She will use the increased profits from her business to adequately support her family.

Regina and her husband, who operates a tricycle transportation business, have four children.

loans.use: to purchase additional commodities to offer for sale in her shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Tahuaco” ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, provincia Yunguyo y departamento D. Puno, tiene 44 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 06 hijos (2 independientes), estudió educación secundaria incompleta.
Junto a su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta D. ganados como ovinos y vacunos, trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace catorce años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, comprará dos vacas, dice que las compra en las ferias D. Yunguyo, Zepita, y las engorda por 2-3 meses, para luego venderlas.  También nos cuenta que su esposo trabaja como chofer y realiza servicio D. transporte en su auto.
Su sueño es mejorar el negocio y así mejorar también sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones con las socias. 

En la foto se muestra junto al auto D. su esposo.
texts.en:
Juana is a partner of the "San Juan D. Tahuaco" Community Bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, in the Yunguyo province and department of Puno.  She is 44 years old, and is married with 6 children (2 of whom are independent).  She studied up to an incomplete secondary education level.

Together with her husband, she works buying and selling livestock like sheep and cattle.  She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for fourteen years; her first loan was 300 New Soles, money which she invested in her business.

With this new loan of 3000 Soles, she will buy two cows.  She says that she will buy them at the markets in Yunguyo and Zepita, and fatten them for 2-3 months, then sell them later.  She also tells us that her husband works as a driver, providing a transportation service with his car.

Her dream is to improve the business and thus improve their income.  What she likes about the Community Bank are the meetings with the members.

In the photo she is shown next to her husband's car.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is 59 years old and married with five children. For five years Brigida has had a shop where she sells snacks, canned goods and noodles.

Brigida is a new member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Brigida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Ethleem

texts.en: Ethleem is 48 years old and married with two children, aged 12 and 23. She runs a stationery store in Aberdeen — a neighborhood in Freetown. She is the bread winner in her family, and also takes care of two relatives and their families. Ethleem has owned this business for 12 years and sells books, pens, paper, photocopying and scanning at her place of business. She also earns income from renting a house to tenants. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of sufficient capital to expand. She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more text books, desk top computers, and stationery. Ethleem says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her business and standard of living. In the future, she hopes to open an Internet cafe and extend her business.

loans.use: To purchase more text books, desk top computers,and A4 paper

loans.name: Floice

texts.en:
Floice is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings she is requesting, she wants to start a boutique business and purchase bales of clothes to sell on a retail basis to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future. Floice decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes.

loans.name: Blanca Ines

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 23 años es soltera y vive con sus padres y un hijo que tiene 1 año; recide en Cotacachi a 15 minutos de Otavalo. Blanca se describe como una perosna trabajadora, muy exigente le gusta que las cosas le salgan bien.

Trabaja sola en la crianza de animales (pollos,cerdos) para su venta.Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos lo cual le ayudará a incrementar sus ingresos mejorando su calidad de vida junto con su hijo y sus padres.

Su sueño es incrementar su negocio para poder dar trabajo a las personas que necesitan.
texts.en:
Blanca is 23, single and lives with her parents and a son, who is 1 year old. She lives in Cotacachi, 15 minutes from Otavalo. Blanca is described as a hardworking  and very demanding person who likes things to go well.

She works alone raising animals (chickens, cows) for sale. This is the first loan she has requested from FODEMI. She will use it to buy pigs, which will help her to increase her income thereby improving her quality of life along with that of her son and parents.

Her dream is to expand her business so that she will be able to give work to those who need it.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia nació en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia del Cusco (Perú) y tiene 58 años de edad, ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos, ella vive en la ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y alfalfa, ella lleva sus productos los días sábados a vender a la ciudad de Quillabamba. Ya son 8 años que se dedica  al negocio y le va muy bien  gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. 

Florencia requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras, para refaccionar su casa y para pagar los estudio de su hijo que esta estudiando la carrera técnica de topografía.    

 El Banco Comunal “Nueva Visión de Urubamba” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad de Urubamba (Cusco,  Perú). Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Florencia was born in the city of Urubamba in Cusco province (Peru). She is 58, a widow, and has 5 children. She lives in the city where she was born, and where she carries on her business. 

She sells vegetables and alfalfa.  On Saturdays, she takes her products to sell in the city of Quillabamba.  She has worked in her business for 8 years now, and it's going very well.  Florencia needs the loan to buy vegetables, to repair her house, and to pay for her son's education. He is studying for a technical career in surveying.  

The members of the "Nueva Vision Urubamba" communal bank meet every thirty days in the city of Urubamba (Cusco province, Peru). Cusco is known as a tourist and commercial area. It is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, "Machu Piccchu" is located there.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, to repair her house, and to pay for her son's education.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El señor Edgar, tiene un gimnasio y también es profesor en una escuela de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para  comprar tres bicicletas estáticas para gimnasio, equipo multifuncional para gimnasio y un equipo de sonido para aerobics; de esta manera ofrecerá mejores servicios en el gimnasio de su propiedad. Edgar vive en casa de un familiar  la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Bajo San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz; es divorciado y   tiene cuatro  hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un credito esperando crecer como microempresario y mejorar sus ingresos para ayudar a la educación y bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Edgar has a gym and he’s also a teacher at a school in La Paz.  He needs the loan to buy three stationary bicycles for the gym, multifunctional equipment for the gym and a sound system for aerobics.  This will help him provide better service at the gym he owns.

Edgar lives in a family member’s house located in the city of La Paz’s Bajo San Antonio zone.  He’s divorced and has four children.  This is the first time the client has obtained a loan and he hopes to grow as a micro businessman and to improve his income to help with his children’s education and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy cycling and other equipment for his gym.

loans.name: Upesi Jiko Group

texts.en:
Joan is the facilitator of the Upesi Jiko group. Joan and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Joan takes care of 18 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund because of their prices and to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had a very good maize yield harvesting 13 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on 1 acres of land.

With income from maize sales, Joan will educate her children, build a house and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Upesi Jiko group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Picture
In the photograph above, Joan is pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nigdalia Irela

texts.es: Nigdalia Irela tiene 47 años, su actividad es un quiosco que tiene más de 3 años en este negocio, está ubicado en un centro de salud en donde es muy frecuentado por trabajadores de este lugar. Aprendió este negocio por cuenta propia y con el apoyo de sus hermanos que le ayudaron a tener este medio de vida. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de pan, galletas, refrescos, golosinas, repostería y jugos. Sueña con seguirle ayudando a sus hijos para que sean personas de bien y además puedan obtener estudios.
texts.en: Nigdalia Irela is 47 years old. She has a kiosk and has been in the business for more than three years. Her kiosk is located in a health center and is frequented by many who work there. She learned this business on her own and with the support of her brothers who helped her to have this way of making a living. The purpose of the loan is to buy bread, cookies, soft drinks, candy, pastries, and juice. She dreams of continuing to help her children so that they'll be upstanding people and also so they can get an education.

loans.use: to buy bread, cookies, soft drinks, candy, pastries, and juice.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 52 years old and married.

Shirley works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from electronic re-loading and farming rice. 

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Shirley has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan.

Shirley aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 42 year old man. He has three children between the ages of 12 and 18 years old. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a butcher shop, a business that he has been involved in for four years. His business is located in a shopping centre. He describes his biggest business challenges to be inflation and insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to purchase goats and sheep which will be slaughtered for meat. His business goal is to grow into a wholesale operation within five years. In the future, he hopes to become a supplier of meat to various institutions.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. 

Wilfreda has a shop, from which she sells canned goods, snacks, breads & beverages. She has had this business for 25 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Wilfreda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future,Wilfreda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various fruits such as: avocadoes, bananas, lemons, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Thelma Rebeca

texts.es:
La señora Thelma tiene 33 años y vive en la aldea Pasas Verdes en el municipio de Macuelizo. Ella es casada desde hace 13 años y su esposo Olvin es un comerciante. Tienen dos hijas de 4 y 6 años de edad. 

Thelma inició su negocio de sastrería hace 13 años. Ella especializa en la confección y reparación de pantalones, faldas, blusas y vestidos. Empezó el negocio para generar buenos ingresos y tener un negocio rentable. Aprendió el oficio de su esposo quien le enseñó a confeccionar diferentes estilos de ropa. Hoy en día ella trabaja 8 horas diarias confeccionando ropa y maneja varios clientes. 

Solicitó este crédito de L6000 para comprar tela para la fabricación de pantalones y vestidos. Su meta es crecer su microempresa para obtener una mejor vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Thelma, 33, lives in the village of Pasas Verdes in the municipality of Macuelizo.  She’s been married for 13 years to her husband, Olvin, who is a merchant.  They have two daughters who are 4 and 6 years old.

Thelma started her tailoring business 13 years ago.  She specializes in making and repairing pants, skirts, blouses and dresses.  She started the business in order to have good income and a profitable business.  She learned the occupation from her husband who taught her how to make various styles of clothing.  Today, she works 8-hour days making clothes and she has many customers.

She requested this L6000 loan to buy fabric to make pants and dresses.  Her goal is to grow her micro business to obtain a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make pants and dresses.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Tuamke Ndembo Group

texts.en:
Kevin is a 38-year-old married man with 7 children. Three of his children attend secondary education. He has been growing coffee, maize, and beans for over 12 years. He is facing farming problems, such as a lack of fertilizers and crop diseases. 

Kevin is asking for financial support to help him to buy fertilizers and insecticides. He has hopes of increasing his farming scale from 5 to 13 acres in the next 5 years. He would also like to own a good house and be capable of paying school fees for his children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Gbehigbenan 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBEHIGBENAN 4 est composé de seize personnes qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Alice est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Alice est âgée de 53 ans et est mariée à un certain Nicolas. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et un reste à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Alice mène comme activité depuis dix ans la vente de maïs et de l’huile végétale de façon ambulante dans un marché du Bénin. Alice s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Alice sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement GBEHIGBENAN 4, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: GBEHIGBENAN 4 is a group composed of 16 people who all live in the same neighborhood. This is the first time that this group requests a loan from ALIDÉ, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Alice, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Alice is 53 and is married to a man named Nicolas. They have five children, some of whom go to school. One of them is still their dependent. Together they share the various family-related expenses. To do that, Alice has been selling corn and vegetal oil in a market in Benin. She buys those items in a region of Benin. In order to meet the needs of her customers as well as to increase her sales and her income, Alice along with the other members of the GBEHIGBENAN 4 group, is applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ.

loans.use: to buy drums of vegetable oil and bags of corn

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, a hardworking married man with three children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda, is a farmer who also operates a motorcycle for a living. Joseph's family goal is the education of his children, and his business goal is the cultivation of his banana plantation so that he becomes a model farmer. He faces the challenges limited labor force to cultivate his banana plantation. Joseph needs the loan to pay workers who are cultivating his banana plantation.

loans.use: to pay workers who are cultivating his banana plantation

loans.name: Casty

texts.en: Casty is 34-years-old; she is married and sells used clothes and shoes to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years, and has employed one person. She earns extra income from her farming activities. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Pedro Eduardo

texts.es:
Pedro tiene  42   años de edad, su estado civil es unión libre, tiene tres  hijos vive con su esposa e hijos en el Cantón Urdaneta  Provincia de Los Ríos.

La descripción de la ventanilla es VRC Palmasola, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Palmasola, pertenece  a la parroquia Ricaurte, Cantón Urdaneta, se dedican a labores agrícolas y pecuarias.

Guevara se dedica a la  agricultura, siembra de maíz y arroz. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar fertilizantes, insumos, abonos. 

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá  comprar los fertilizantes a menor precio por ser el pago al contado.  

Las  compras lo realizan  en Ricaute cada semana.   

Su sueño es comprar un terreno. 

Su desafío son los cambios climáticos.  

En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Pedro is 42 years old, lives with his common-law wife and three children in Urdaneta Canton, Los Rios Province. He is a member of the Palmasola communal bank which is located in the Recinto Palmasola, part of Ricaurte Parish, Urdaneta Canton. The members are farmers or raise livestock. 

Pedro is a farmer who plants corn and rice. He needs this loan to buy fertilizer, manure and supplies. With the help of this loan he can pay cash and get a low purchase price. He buys his supplies in Ricaute weekly.  His dream is to buy some land. His challenge is the changes in climate. In his spare time he likes to play arena football (soccer).

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure and supplies.

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es:
Cristina siempre ha velado por el bien de los animales, pues todo el tiempo han sido su pasión. Por más de cinco años, ella ha llevado la batuta de establecer una Veterinaria en su pueblo, donde se convirtió en la primera y única, por lo que sus vecinos se lo agradecen. A sus 53 años ella siempre ha trabajado fuerte para salir adelante con sus dos hijos, a quienes ahora mira orgullosamente como grandes profesionales. 
Durante este tiempo, Cristina se ha convertido en una de las personas más reconocida en su vecindario, por la excelente labor como veterinaria empírica. Ahora ella siente que es momento de invertir en su calidad de vida, razón por la cual solicita un préstamo para construir un nuevo sumidero y comprar un inodoro, de manera que ir al baño ya no será más un riesgo para su salud debido a que las bacterias y animales que son atraídos por el actual baño. En un futuro desea seguir invirtiendo en su calidad de vida, por lo que planea mejorar su hogar y terminar su carrera como veterinaria.

loans.use: Comprar un inodoro.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Salaton would like to add stock to her bead work business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa sells fragrances and cosmetics out of catalogs. She has little working capital and hopes to raise more to be able to sell on credit. She lives in the neighborhood of Callapa, in La Paz. She doesn't have a stand, but hawks her goods at markets in La Paz. This is the first loan she has requested. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics and perfume. She has sufficient cash flow to cover the loan and good experience.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Rosa vende perfumes y cosméticos mediante revista; ella no cuenta con mucho capital y su objetivo es tener más capital para que pueda ofrecer sus productos a crédito. Vive en Callapa, en al ciudad de La Paz y no cuenta con un puesto fijo ya que ofrece sus productos ambulando por los mercados. Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de mercadería (perfumes y cosméticos, etc.) Sus ingresos actuales le permiten acceder a este crédito, pues Rosa tiene experiencia en su negocio. El flujo de caja realizado en el análisis del crédito muestra una rentabilidad suficiente para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and fragrances for resale.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Born in 1973 in the village of Tannou, Mr. Kokou S. is an honest farmer. Married and father of five (5) children, he produces corn and manioc on his land. The corn is sold while the manioc is transformed into gari and tapioca before being sold. This business has helped him to provide for the needs of his family. However, the lands now need to be refertilized. Mr. S. therefore requests a credit of $1200 in order to buy fertilizer for his land in order to increase its yield and production capacity.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1973 dans le village de Tannou, Monsieur S. Kokou est un brave agriculteur. Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, il fait la production du maïs et du manioc. Le premier est vendu tandis que le second est transformé en gari et tapioca avant d’être commercialisé. C’est une activité qui lui permet grâce aux revenus tirés de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Mais les terres ont besoins d’être redynamisées. Ainsi, Monsieur S. sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter du fertilisant pour ses terres afin d’accroître leur capacité de production.KO

loans.use: Buying fertilizer

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en: Gulnara, 49 is  a widow with six children. She lives in Khachmaz town. She purchases cooking utensils ( pans, frying-pans and etc.) and sells them to shops. She has been doing this for three years. She now needs a loan of $725 to buy more goods for resale.

loans.use: To  buy untensils for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
ESTHER L. is a 46 year old widow with 5 children who are all in school. She takes care of her elderly mother, to educate her children and also provide for their basic needs, Esther sells dry maize to individuals and institutions in Kericho.she has been in this business for the last 10 years and has acquired business management training from ebony foundation.she wants to expand her business and also sell to other retailers in the area, to succeed in this noble idea she is requesting for a loan of US$ 1200 which she intends to use as follows;US$ 800 to purchase extra stock and US$ 400 to expand her store.
Esther is determined and she is of good character hence the ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: to increase her current stock

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a 27-year-old married woman who is trying to support her family. She recently joined SPBD’s loan program to recieve financial assistance for her family’s banana plantation. She plans to buy supplies to improve her business, and make it sustainable.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Teodosia's Group

texts.en:
Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica have been part the community bank “Señor de Luren” for between one and three years. In their bank they have learned valuable business skills such saving and responsibility. In addition, they have learned skills such as nutrition, how to educate their children, and how to have a positive relationship with their husbands.

Teodosia is 51 years old. She is a widow and has seven children. Teodosia travels to different markets selling fruit. In the market she buys grains, potatoes, cheese, and other products, which she re-sells in Ayacucho. Teodosia also makes and sells “moliente”, which is a traditional beverage made from local herbs and served warm.

Sabina is 41, she is separated from her husband and has six children. She sells live chickens and fruit in various markets around Ayacucho. There she buys potatoes, and other grains, which she sells in the city. She also sells shish kabob from a cart in the market.

Angelica is 30 years old. She is married and has four children. Angelica makes typical breads such as “chapla”, a type of bread similar to pita. She makes her bread in a rented oven. Angelica also travels to Lima where she sells purses in the Miraflores market.

Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, chickens, barley, quinoa, sugar, and flour. The community bank emphasizes the importance of savings and each associate has an interest earning savings account. Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica plan to use their savings to buy a piece of land, and to pay for medical treatment. Their dreams are to own land, that their children will be professional, and that they will have good health.

loans.use: Teodosia, Sabina, and Angelica need loans of 600, 600, and 400 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying cheese, chickens, barley, quinoa, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Yimi

texts.en:
Yimi M. Riveros is a father of two children. His business is preparing sausages. He works with all different types of meats and specializes in putting the casing on the sausages. Yimi also has two motorcycles and car that he uses to deliver his products. For three years he has run his business with his father and brother. Yimi is also a part-time student and attends night school twice a week.

Yimi will use his loan to invest in a truck to transport his merchandise, thereby expanding his business and income.

loans.use: To invest in a truck

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina M. S., a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” comunal bank, lives in Juanjui district, Mariscal Cáceres province, San Martín department. She sells coconut water from coconuts that are produced in the region. She locates her sales cart on one of the main streets in front of the city plaza.

It was 17 years ago that, through her own initiative and with the help of her husband, she decided to start this business and use it to help her children get ahead and become professionals.

With the loan of S/. 1500.00, which she will pay back in 6 payments, she will buy coconuts everyday by the hundreds, and ice, so that she can sell cold coconut water and thereby quench the thirst of the clients during the hot weather in this jungle part of the country. She also plans to repair the shade cover on her cart.

She is 43 years old and lives with her 2 minor children and her husband. She is a responsible person and it was her desire to help her children get ahead in life that motivated her to become a small business owner. She considers herself a fighter and perseverant. She feels that she is a good example to her children because of her dedication to her business and her unconditional support for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Martina M. S., socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” vive en la Región San Martín y Provincia de Mariscal Cáceres y distrito de Juanjui se dedica a la venta de cocos frescos (agua de coco) producidos en la región, ubicando su carretilla de ventas en una de las calles principales frente a la plaza de armas de la ciudad Fue hace 17 años y por iniciativa propia y con la ayuda de su esposo que decidió dedicarse a este negocio y así sacar adelante a sus hijos y convertirlos en profesionales. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00 para pagar en 6 cuotas, comprará cocos diariamente por cientos. y hielo en barras, para vender los cocos helados y saciar la sed de sus clientes, ante el sofocante calor de esta parte de la selva del país, también piensa renovar la carpa de su carretilla. Ella tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a sus 2 hijos menores y su esposo, es una mujer muy responsable, sus deseos de sacar adelante a sus hijos le impulsó a desarrollarse como pequeña empresaria. Se considera luchadora, perseverante y siente que es un gran ejemplo para sus hijos por su dedicación a su negocio y apoyo incondicional a su familia.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and ice

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is 24 years old and is a single woman with 1 child, age 4 years old. Pendo is clothes seller; she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoang Thi D., 33 years old, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2003. Even though she already had 1 hectare of field, she wanted to buy more land for sedge cultivation. She decided to borrow 375 USD to buy land to plant sedge. She calculated, after harvest, her average profit from the sedge is 120 USD. The profit is high, and she also has good material for weaving sedge mats. Currently, the main activity for Mrs. D. and her husband is to weave sedge mats. Their average income is 150 USD/month. Besides being able to send the children to schools, she was able to buy a new TV and a closet last year.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Diện, 33 tuổi, là thành viên tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Tuy đã có trên 1 mẫu cói, nhưng chị Diện vẫn muốn có thêm đất để canh tác. Nếu mua cói khô thì đắt hơn từ 2 đến 3 lần so với cói tươi, trong khi đó nhiều gia đình không có đủ nhân công để làm nên muốn bán đất trồng. Sau khi bàn với chồng chị Diện quyết định vay 375USD để mua thêm 3 sào cói. Chị tính khi thu hoạch, trừ chị phí thì bình quân mỗi sào cũng lãi khoảng 120USD. Lợi nhuận mang lại cũng khá cao, lại có nguyên liệu tốt để dệt chiếu. Hiện nay công việc chính của 2 vợ chồng chị Diện là dệt chiếu, thu nhập hàng tháng khoảng 150USD. Ngoài việc cho 3 con ăn học đầy đủ, năm ngoái chị Diện mua thêm được một chiếc tivi và một chiếc tủ mới.

loans.use: Buy land to plant sedge

loans.name: Ni Komang Wasiantini

texts.id:
As a wife of a farmer, Ni Komang Wasiantini is expected to work to supplement her family's income. The seasonal nature her husband's income motivates her more in working her farm, consisting of a small plantation and pig pens. Komang earns decent profit from her pig farm that can be used to supplement her family's income. However, increasing price of feeds makes it difficult for her to breed and farm more pigs. Therefore she decided to apply for a loan from DINARI to purchase feeds and more piglets. With the help of 6 month loan, Komang earned additional $110 profit. After that result, Komang decided to apply for second loan from DINARI. This loan is going to be used to purchase more feeds. Komang expects that this loan would help her just like the first loan. The increased profit from her farm will be used to help her family's finances.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sebagai istri dari suami yang berprofesi sebagai seorang petani sudah seharusnyalah Ni Komang Wasiantini membantu suami dalam menambah jumlah pendapatan keluarga. Penghasilan suami yang tergantung dari musiman membuat ia harus lebih tekun dalam mengelola kebun dan lebih giat dalam beternak babi yang juga digelutinya. Keuntungan dari beternak babi yang diperoleh Komang lumayan untuk menambah pendapatan keluarganya. Tetapi dengan tingginya harga pakan babi membuat Komang kesulitan mngembangkan ternak babinya. Oleh karena itu Komang memutuskan untuk ikut program DINARI dengan meminjam dana yang digunakan untuk membeli bibit dan pakan babi. Dari pinjaman selama 6 bulan tersebut Komang mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 1000.000,-. Melihat hasil itu Komang melanjutkan pinjaman dengan DINARI ke periode kedua. Pinjaman ini akan digunakan untuk membeli bibit lebih banyak disamping juga membeli pakan babi. Komang mengharapkan hasil yang lebih besar akan didapatkannya dari pinjaman periode kedua ini sehingga meningkatkan perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: Purchase Piglets and Feeds

loans.name: Abravi

texts.fr:
Born in 1978, Mrs. Abravi E. is a seller of foodstuffs (rice, beans). Married and the mother of three children, she helps manage the family expenses thanks to the revenues from her sales. She is asking for a loan that will allow her to purchase sacks of rice, beans and other items to prepare in order to enlarge her business, better serve her clients, and ultimately strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Lucia Franzese, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1978, Madame E. Abravi est une revendeuse de denrée alimentaire (riz, haricot). Mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du foyer grâce au revenu de sa vente. En d’agrandir son activité et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui servir de renforcer ses activités en achetant des sacs de riz, de haricot et autres pour sa préparation.

loans.use: Expand business of foodstuffs

loans.name: Norma Y Maria Group

texts.es:
Norma is single, 34 years old and has 1 child. Norma sells food in the settlement of Yanama, she prepares breakfast and dinner. She is planning to open a new business; a grocery store.

On the other hand Maria is married, 47 years old and has 6 children. Every week Maria travels to the “Ayacuchana” jungle where she sells vegetables and buys fruit to be sold at the market in the town of Ayacucho.

Norma and Maria need loans of 1500 and 600 soles respectively to be invested in the purchase of groceries, oranges and pineapples. Their dream is to educate their children as professionals, improve their businesses and build their houses.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Norma es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Norma vende comida en el asentamiento humano de Yanama, prepara desayuno y cena, Norma tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio que es una tienda de abarrotes.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Maria viaja a la selva ayacuchana todas las semanas en donde vende verduras y de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Norma y Maria necesitan prestamos de 1500 soles, 600 soles, respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes, naranja, piña. Los sueños de Norma y Maria son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, construir su casa.

loans.use: Norma and Maria need loans of 1500 and 600 soles respectively to buy groceries, oranges and pineapples in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia siempre demostró tener gran creatividad y habilidad en sus manos, por ello, desde niña soñó ser una gran cosmetóloga y tener un reconocido salón de belleza, hoy sigue mostrando mucha pasión y diligencia por esta actividad, su clientela se siente muy satisfecha y contenta con su trabajo.Ella es natural del pueblito de Ananea, apenas concluyó sus estudios secundarios partió a la ciudad de Juliaca, donde estudió  cosmetología, (nos muestra su certificado en la foto) actualmente va implementando con mucho esfuerzo  su pequeño salón de belleza, ubicado en su pueblo. Su deseo es terminar de implementar su salón, con el  fin de brindar  un mejor servicio a su clientela, es por recurre a este préstamo, con la promesa de ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Eusebia always demonstrated having great creativity and skill with her hands. Ever since she was a girl she dreamed of being a great cosmetologist and have a renown beauty salon. Today she continues demonstrating a lot of passion and diligence for this profession. Her customers feel very satisfied and content with her work. She was born in Ananea, and just after completing high school she left for the city of Juliaca, where she studied cosmetology (she shows us her certification in the photograph). Today with great effort she is sett up her small beauty salon located in her town. Her wish is to finish setting up her salon, with the goal of providing a better service to her customers, so she is asking for this loan with the promise of being punctual with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Continue implementing her beauty salon

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory in bulk.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria M., 32, is married with three children, one aged 11 and twins aged 7, and also cares for her mother.  For the past two years Maria has owned a general store where she sells food items, kangas and vitenge (traditional Swahili fabrics). Working daily from 9 a.m. until 9:30 p.m., she is able to earn a monthly profit of about $204.

This will be Maria’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. The first three, which she used to increase the stock in her shop, have been repaid, and she intends to use this new loan for the same purpose - to increase her stock of vitenge and kangas. Maria is a member of the Kinyerezi loan group, whose members guarantee the repayment of each others' loans.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of kangas and vitenge.

loans.name: Suelem

texts.es: Suelem, de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 2 añitos de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace un año, su esposo, quien es trabajador independiente la apoya mucho en su negocio. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es levantarse muy temprano a preparar todo para luego llevar a vender sus prendas de vestir por los diferentes lugares de su zona, ya que vende de manera ambulante. Le es rentable porque ya cuenta con una clientela selecta y le va muy bien. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y ha sido puntual en sus cuotas anteriores. El dinero solicitado será invertido en la comprar de más ropa, posteriormente poner en su propia casa su tienda, ya que se encuentra en una zona adecuada.
texts.en:
Suelem is 25 years old and lives with her husband and two year old son. She has sold clothes and shoes for a year. Her husband, who is self-employed, supports her in her business. What she likes about her job is getting up very early to prepare everything to sell her articles of clothing in different places in her area as a traveling salesperson. It is profitable for her because she has a select clientele and she is doing very well. This is her second loan with MFP and she has been punctual with her previous payments. The money she is requesting will be invested in buying more clothes and then to put a store in her own house because it is in a good area.

Translated from Spanish by Jeanette Chase, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of clothes that she sells

loans.name: Hery

texts.es:
El señor Hery tiene 28 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, su negocio está ubicado en una zona de mucha concurrencia al costado de la ruta 2 a la altura del Km. 52, comenta que los conocimientos de como manejar una casa de repuestos lo adquirió de su padre y hace más de 6 años su padre le cedió el negocio quedándose como propietario.
Al inicio fue difícil porque los clientes estaban acostumbrados a tratar con su Papá, pero a medida iban conociéndole empezaron a tenerles confianza e inclusive les recomendaban a otros clientes para que compren del negocio.
Su principal logro dice ser el hecho de haber mantenido su clientela y haber dotado de más repuestos y esto facilitó evacuar los pedidos de los clientes  mas exigentes en tiempo y forma.
Con los préstamos que le otorgó La Fundación Paraguaya pudo comprar repuestos como ser ruedas, faros, cables, casco, bujías, filtros, aceites, etc.
texts.en:
Hery is 28 years old. He is married and has 2 children. His business is located at a very highly visited area next to route 2, Km. 52. He learned the business of how to manage a spare parts shop from him father. Six years ago, he father left him the shop being Hery the current owner. It was hard at the begining because customers we used to deal with his father, but after meeting him they began to trust him and even to recommend his business to other customers. Its main achievement has been to have been able to maintain the shop's clientele and to expand the business into more spare part items which enabled him to satisfy all this customers' requests in time and form. With these loan granted by the Fundación Paraguaya he was able to purchase spare parts, such as wheel, headlights, cables, helmets, filters, oil, pistons, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Para la compra de accesorios tales como faros, casco, aceite, caño de escape, ruedas, filtros, etc.

loans.name: Nazirqul

texts.ru: Каршиев Нарзикул проживает в городе Турсун-Заде. Возраст 43 года. Работает главным бухгалтером в городской поликлинике. Женат и имеет шестерых детей. Как и многие жители сельской местности он занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли  который засеивает пшеницей. Поэтому обратился к нам для того, чтобы закупить семена пшеницы , а так же удобрений. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazirqul K. lives in Tursunzade. He is 43 years olf. He is Chief Accountant at the municipal polyclinic. Nazirqul is married and has six children. Like many other rural residents, he is involved in agriculture. Nazirqul has a plot of land where he grows wheat. He is applying for a loan so that he can buy wheat seeds and fetilizers. He would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.
