Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to puchase wheat seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S., 49, is married and lives with four of her children in Prey Veng province. She stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband, pictured here, is a motor-taxi driver and makes US$ 2 in profit a day. Mrs. Keo is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorbike for her husband as the old one is often fixed and uses a lot of gas while operating.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to use for his business

loans.name: Halil

texts.ru: Халил мужчина 58 лет имеет пятерых детей,жена работает в детском саду прачкой.Её заработная плата хватает только на минимум проживания.Сам Халил работает бухгалтером в колхозе им."кушатов".С колхоза Халил оплату получает не в денежном ,а в товарном виде,т.е. получает продукты питания на проживание.Для дополнительного дохода на проживание семьи Халил занимается откормом и продажей скота.У него сейчас три коровы и пять баранов.Для увеличения оборотного капитала животноводства Халил хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Halil is a 58 years old and is married with five children. His wife does laundry in a kindergarten. Her income is only sufficient for a minimum living standard. Halil works as an accountant for a collective farm "Kushatov". From the collective farm Halil receives payment only in the form of food. In order to earn extra cash, he raises and sells cattle. Now he owns three cows and five sheep. In order to increase cash flow, Halil is applying for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming and sales

loans.name: Maria Izabel

texts.en:
For Isabel P., her work of making traditional weavings was a gift from her mother who taught her everything about the craft. She began her business by selling traditional napkins in the market in San Juan Sacatepéquez. Over time the demand from her customers grew larger and she saw the need for more capital in order to buy spools of thread.

Today she not only makes napkins, but also cloths used to carry babies, tablecloths, and scarves. Isabel feels the effects of the economic situation, but is happy that her customers continue to place orders. She says that the cost of thread has risen and that she needs more capital to purchase the necessary materials for her work.

For this reason she is requesting a loan to be able to meet customer demand and to continue making sales and growing her business. Her dream is to have a big store in the market that sells all different types of weavings. She will continue struggling and pushing forward to provide for her family just as she has always done.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Bouch, Kiva Fellow

Para Doña Isabel la elaboración de tejidos a la que se dedica ha sido el regalo de su madre ya que fue ella quien le enseñó este oficio. Inicia con servilletas típicas, vendiendo en el mercado de San Juan Sacatepéquez. Con el tiempo los pedidos fueron creciendo y ve la necesidad de mas capital para la compra de conos de hilos. Elabora hoy en día no solo servilletas, también herrajes, manteles, chalinas, cargadores típicos. La situación económica esta dura pero sus clientes continúan haciendo pedidos. El hilo ha subido ya cada vez es mas el capital que necesita. Por tal motivo solicita su crédito ya que hay demanda de clientes y desea aprovechar y seguir vendiendo y creciendo en su negocio. Su sueño es tener local grande con todo tipo de tejidos en el mercado y seguir luchando por su familia como siempre lo ha hecho.

loans.use: Materials for traditional weavings

loans.name: Regielyn

texts.en:
Regielyn has managed her general store for almost nine years and has been able to earn an average weekly income of PHP 1,500. She has a lot of customers in their village and sometimes she could not meet their needs due to limited resources.

Because of this, she would like to request a loan amount of PHP 5,000 that she can use as additional capital. She will use the loan to purchase different merchandise like soft drinks and biscuits (cookies) that are very much in demand during harvest season. She hopes that her request will be granted so that she can fulfill her dreams not only for her business but also for her family, especially in sending their children to school.

Regielyn is 34 years old and married to Jouly. The couple is blessed with three children: Keith Dimple - 9 years old, now in grade school; Kaye Sarah - 3 years old and the youngest, Kins Leah - 1 year old. She believes that “through hard work and patience every dream will turn to reality as long as she has faith in God”.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Mobateli Plus Group

texts.fr: Kalobwe N. a passé presque toute sa vie dans le commerce. Depuis l’école primaire, secondaire, niveau supérieur jusqu’à présent, il a acquit une expérience solide sur les activités génératrices des revenus.  Le premier commerce de Kalobwe était la vente du pétrole à lampe qu’il avait commencé en 1978 avec un capital initial de $1 quand il était encore en 2e année primaire. De 1978 – 1988, Kalobwe a durement travaillé avec une bonne gestion qui lui a permis d’accumuler des bénéfices qu’il se servi pour diversifier son activité en y ajoutant de la braise et des poissons salés. En 1988, son affaire totalisait un capital de $ 200. Après avoir obtenu le diplôme d’Etat à l’école secondaire en 1988, Kalobwe s’est rendu à Kinshasa pour poursuivre les études supérieures. De 1989  jusqu’à ce jour, il s’est lancé dans un autre type d’affaire, la vente des chenilles qui sont beaucoup achetées à Kinshasa.  Son capital de relance d’affaire en 1989 était de $ 150. Au fil des années et à l’aide des bénéfices accumulés, il est parvenu à associer d’autres produits tels que des arachides et l’eau purifiée. Actuellement, Kalobwe a un capital avoisinant $1000 et son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $300 par mois. En entrant chez Hope en juillet 2008, Kalobwe veut réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une petite usine de fabrication d’eau purifiée. Son affaire se situe dans un quartier au nord ouest de la ville de Kinshasa. Il a 43 ans, marié et père de huit enfants dont leurs âges varient de 1 à 20 ans. Six d’entre eux vont à l’école. Kalobwe ainsi que sa famille aiment leurs activités car elles leur procurent la possibilité financière de résoudre les problèmes de leur ménage.
texts.en:
Kalobwe N. has spent almost his entire life in business. Through primary and secondary school and up through advanced studies to the present, he has acquired a solid experience in earning a living. Kalobwe's first business was selling lamp kerosene, a business he began in 1978 with a starting capital of US$ 1 when he was still in second grade. From 1978 to 1988, Kalobwe worked hard and practiced good management which allowed him to accumulate profit that he used to diversify his business, adding the sale of charcoal and smoked fish.

In 1988 he had a total capital of US$ 200. After having received his official high school diploma in 1988, Kalobwe went to Kinshasa to register for higher studies. From 1989 up to the present, he got into another type of business selling larval caterpillars (as food), which are much in demand in Kinshasa. His beginning capital for the new business in 1989 was US$ 150.

Over the years and using the profit he accumulated, he managed to begin selling other products as well, for example peanuts and purified water. Presently, Kalobwe has a capital of about US$ 1000 and his business is generating a profit of US$ 300 per month.

Working with HOPE since July 2008, Kalobwe wants to make his dream come true: opening a little factory making purified water. His business is situated in the north-west district of the city of Kinshasa. He is 43, married and the father of 8 children from 1 year old to 20 years of age. Six of his children are enrolled in school. Kalobwe and his family love their businesses because they provide them with the financial means to solve household problems.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bags to pack purified water in for sale

loans.name: Ozodoy

texts.en:
H. Ozodoy is 44 years old. She is married with three children. She started her own business three years ago because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough for their family expenses. Ozodoy sells confectionery items like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income generated from her business allows Ozodoy to support her family. She dreams that her children will attain a higher education. Today she requests $2,500 that she will use for the confectionery to enlarge the range of goods she offers. The income she plans to spend for the well-being of her family as well as for educating her children.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing confectionery items for enlarging the range of goods

loans.name: Ravy

texts.en:
Mrs. Ravy P., 30, and her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Keo, 32, were married in 2000 and have no children yet. The family lives on an Island in Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom P., the capital city of Cambodia.
Ravy sells snacks in the local school. Mr. Chanthorn Keo is a security guard who works in Phnom P.. He gets up in the early morning to travel to Phnom P. and comes back home in the evening. 
Ravy wants to start a raising pig business. It would be better for her to earn more income to support her family. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise.

loans.name: Cleshy

texts.en:
Mr. T. Cleshy is a courageous man, 40 years old. He is a married man with three children and expects to provide the best for them.

Mr. T. Cleshy has worked and lived in the area for over ten years. He owns a shop by the name of Twinomusuni, a family shop dealing in the selling of mattresses, pillows, blankets, towels, etc. He is using the loan to invest more in the business by buying mattresses, pillows, blankets, towels, etc. He is very happy and hopes his business will be self-sufficient. He is also a technical institute teacher and, meanwhile, his wife helps him to partly run the business. His future hope is to increase his inventory and create more employment.

loans.use: To invest in his businessby by buying more mattresses, pillows, blankets, towels, etc.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina D. C., age 30, and her husband, Vivencio, are business partners. Gina buys scrap materials from used home appliances (electric fans and washing machines). Vivencio, a trained technician, salvages these appliances, re-assembles them, and sells them back to neighboring barangays (villages). Their house, which is located on the rolling hills of San Vicente, Caloocan City, has been turned into a workshop. They have four children, ages 13, 12, 11 and 7. Only the youngest attends school.

Their business has already provided employment to their relatives. Vivencio trained six relatives to repair and assemble appliances. They now walk the streets from one barangay to another, carrying on their shoulders the reassembled and "ready-to-use" appliances that they are selling.

Gina and Vivencio are now closely monitoring their business cash flow. They are looking forward to purchasing a second-hand motorized tricycle to be used for their deliveries.

loans.use: Additional spare parts, peripherals, and used household appliances

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Huanca
Basilia es casada, tiene 55 años y 6 hijos, Basilia tiene una panadería en su casa en donD. elaboran panes típicos, su horno es artesanal a leña, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias a donD. viaja junto a su esposo, además Basilia tiene una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes.
Basilia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. harina y azúcar.
Los sueños D. Basilia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Basilia belongs to Señor D. Huanca Communal Bank. Basilia is married, 55 years old, and the mother of six. Basilia runs a bakery in her house, where she makes basic breads. She uses a handmaD. wood-fired oven. She sells at the fairs in the area -- she and her husband travel to them together. In addition, Basilia has a small grocery store. Basilia needs a loan of S./1000 to buy flour and sugar. Basilia hopes that her children can complete their studies, and would like to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour and sugar

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita R. is from the village of Palacapao  Quezon Bukidnon. She is 38, married and has 7 school-aged children. Teresita plants & harvests corn for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI, which she used to expand her business. Teresita is requesting a new loan, her 4th from HSPFI, for12000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: le labour et l’achat d’intrants

loans.name: Aurea Alexandre

texts.pt:
Aurea nasceu na província nortenha da Zambezia, na cidade de quelimane, de 29 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de com idades compreendidas entre os seis meses e dez anos. Estudou ate 10 classe tendo parado por motivos de doença respiratória. Vive em casa própria com os filhos e sustenta também a sua mãe que encontra se a viver na província natal da zambezia, enviando lhe dinheiro no final de cada mês.

Não cresceu na companhia dos seus progenitores. Saiu ainda criança para viver na província de inhambane em casa de familiares e mais tarde na cidade de maputo (na casa oferecida). Não vive com o pai dos filhos. Sobrevive de aluguer de um imóvel que fora oferecida por seu avo na cidade de maputo que aluga e rende 12.000,00MT por mês e aplica na construção da casa de alvenaria em fases, assim com pagamento de despesas familiares.

Aprendeu a fazer negócios (venda de produtos diversos) na cidade de maputo, antes de se transferir para Boane onde vive há mais de 10 anos.

Este é o primeiro empréstimo da Aureca na Hluvuku-Adsema no valor de 12.000,00MT para compra de material de construção (cimento, areia e outros) com intuito de finalizar a obra de construção de casa de alvenaria.

Tem como plano futuro, concluir a obra e construir uma mercearia e para tal propõe se a reembolsar o empréstimo sem problema para poder aceder a mais empréstimos.
texts.en:
Aurea was born in the northern province of Zambezia, in the city of Quelimae. She is 29 years old, and a single mother of 2 children aged 6 months and 10. She attended school through the tenth grade but dropped out due to respiratory problems. She lives in her own home with her children. She also supports her mother, who still lives in her native province of Zambezia, by sending money to her at the end of every month. Aurea did not grow up with her parents. When she was still a baby she went to live in the Inhambane province with friends, and later lived in the city of Maputo (in a home left to her). She does not live with the father of her children. She lives off the rent she earns from a building that was left to her by her grandfather in the city of Maputo, which she rents out, earning 12.000,00MT monthly. She is using the money to build a brick home in phases, and to cover family expenses. She learned to run a business (selling a variety of products) in the city of Maputo, before moving to Boane where she has lived for more than 10 years. This is Aurea's first loan with Hluvuku-Adsema, in the amount of 12.000,00MT. It will be used to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, etc.) with the goal of completing construction on her home. Her future plans are to finish her home and build a small store. To do this she plans to repay the loan without any problems so that she can have access to future loans.

Translated from Portuguese by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchae of construction materials (cement, sand, etc.)

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is thirty-five years old. She is married and has two children, both in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Dormaa in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. Dormaa is a commercial and farming town. Martha is a trader. She trades charcoal. She buys bags of charcoal from nearby towns and supplies them to food vendors and retailers in her community. Martha has been in business for four years and requests a loan to buy goods in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Bahram

texts.en:
Bahram is 41 years old and lives in Fuzuli region. He is married and has two children.

Bahram plays clarinet at weddings and has been in this business for five years. Now, he needs a loan of 2,000 AZN to improve his business.

loans.use: To improve his business

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Djiguisseme sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 36 ans et 4 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants, elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le village de Massigui, sous préfecture de MASSIGUI, Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles sont liées par des relations de voisinage et de parentés. Elles font le commerce d’articles  divers et la restauration. 
Elles ont connues l’institution à travers les anciennes clientes de la ville, il y’a environ trois ans, dès lors ces femmes également collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci d’avoir  un appui financier constant pour leurs activités. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt  solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Quant à l’utilisation du nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter des habillements pour hommes et femmes et une grande quantité de céréales et de condiments alimentaires pour la restauration et beaucoup d’autres articles divers. 
Les habillements sont achetés en grande partie à Bamako et à Fana, les céréales, les condiments alimentaires pour la restauration et les autres articles divers sont achetés en détail aux environnants et sont revendus au marché de Massigui à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles estiment réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 45 600FCFA  par mois. Les bénéfices sont partagés entre la nourriture,  la santé et  les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Djiguisseme are married women who are an average of 36 years old, with an average of 4 children each. With their husbands and children, they live in large traditional families and reside in the village of Massigui within the subprefecture of Massigui, in the region of Koulikoro, in the Republic of Mali. They are tied together by family and because they live in the same neighborhood. Their business is selling a diverse selection of products, as well as catering. The new of the microfinance institution (Soro Yiriwaso) through former clients in the city. For about three years, these women have collaborated equally with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for consistent financial support for their businesss. This will be their eighth loan together and all of their previous loans have been fully repaid. With this new loan they intend to purchase clothes for men and women, a large stock of cereals and food products for their restaurand, and a variety of many other items. The clothes will be mostly purchased in Bamako and Fana; the cereals, condiments for the restaurant and various other products will be bought from retailers in the surrounding areas and will be resold in the market of Massigui to a clientele composed of women and men. They estimate that they will each earn a monthly average income of 45,600 FCFA. They will use their earnings to purchase food, health products and for activities.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of items

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 47 years old and has been happily married for 19 years to Francisca Lopez, who is 37. Wilson and Francisca have a daughter who is in the 9th grade.

Wilson now has his own pantry and the business is doing very well. He recently bought a machine for making ice cubes, which has increased his profits as summer nears. He has a lot of customers who value his excellent service and care. Wilson will use this loan to buy a freezer to use in his pantry. His dream is to expand his business and open a food stand.

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La señora Leonor es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuelas de hoy II”, vive en el distrito de Ilave, provincia de El Collao, departamento de Puno. Ella tiene 52 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y no realizò estudios. Se dedica a la compra y venta de cereales.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 1 año atrás, y en su Banco Comunal su primer préstamo fuè de  S/.300.00 nuevos soles el mismo que le sirvió para la compra de cereales.

Ella solicitará un préstamo de S/.2000.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que invertirá en la compra  de cereales de la región: papa, chuño, habas, etc.

Su deseo para el futuro es tener su tienda de cereales.

Lo que màs le gusta de su organización es el ahorro y las reuniones con las socias.
texts.en:
Ms.Leonor is a member of the Communal Bank "Manuelas de hoy II" [Today's Manuelas II]. She lives in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 52 years old, she is married and has three children. She never studied. She buys and sells staple foods.

She has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for the past year. In her Communal Bank, her first loan was S./300.00 which she used to purchase staple foods.

She asks for a loan of S/.2000.00 which she will invest in the purchase of local staple foods: potatoes, freeze-dried potatoes, beans, etc.

Her wish for the future is to have her own staple foods store.

What she likes the most about her organization is the saving process and the meetings with members.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of barley, beans, chuño, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Yader Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Yader Jesús T. Jiménez, tiene la edad de 28 años, Labora como Responsable de Bodega en el Centro de Capacitación CECNA, el tiene dos hijos a su cargo, uno de ellos se encuentran  en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado créditos con  CEPRODEL durante Tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
 
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción. El que utilizara para la remodelación y cambio del techo de la vivienda en la que habita, con el objetivo de darles mayor seguridad y mejores condición de vida a sus hijos y esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. Yader Jesús T. Jiménez is 28 years old. He works as the manager of a warehouse in the CECNA Training Center. He has two children under his charge, one of whom is school age. He is married and has worked loans with CEPRODEL for the past three years. During this time, he has invested three loans to improve his house, which were granted by CEPRODEL. He is an excellent client. The loan requested is to invest in the purchase of construction materials. The materials used are to remodel and re-roof his home. The objective is to give his children and his wife a better and more secure home.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Inosia

texts.en:
Inosia P. is 44 and married with 6 children (ages 15 - 27 years).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Inosia has 5 years of experience in this business.  Inosia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 tala or US $63 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Inosia joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Inosia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Inosia P. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita G., 43, is making sure that her family has adequate provision for their daily needs. Married to Rafael G., a vegetable vendor, she is blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. Both of them have been selling vegetables for five years.

Anita has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends the weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently.

Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, Anita was able to borrow four times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to buy more vegetables from suppliers. Her business lets her earn a profit of PHP 6,000 per month.

Now, with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 10,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business and used to buy assorted vegetables for her vegetable store.

Anita dreams that her business will grow so that they can buy a delivery truck for their produce and prays that God will bless their lives as one family.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy assorted vegetables for her vegetable store

loans.name: Abilio Esteban

texts.es: Abilio tiene 67 años, este gran empresario tiene la actividad económica de venta de tortillas y leña. El tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos trabajan de manera independiente. Su jornada empieza a las 5 de la mañana, porque todos sus vecinos en su comarca lo conocen por la buena calidad de tortillas que ofrece ya que cuando inicio fue hace 20 años, el es un buen administrador pues ha demostrado que con lo poco que obtiene de ganancia lo invierte nuevamente en su actividad y con el paso del tiempo se fue dando cuenta que los financiamientos han sido de gran importancia para sacar adelante su negocio. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. El sueña con algún día mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Albilio is 67-years-old. This businessman sells tortillas and firewood. He has six children, all of whom work independently. His day begins at five in the morning because all his neighbors in his region know him for his high-quality tortillas that he sells because he has been in business for 20 years. He is a good manager and has demonstrated that he can use the little that he earns to invest back into his business. Over time he has realized that financing has been very important to keeping his business going. He is requesting this loan to buy raw materials. He dreams of one day being able to improve the conditions of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raw materials for tortillas and firewood

loans.name: Kebelyn

texts.es:
Kebelyn B. B., tiene la edad de 21 años, es soltera, y no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cerdos para la cría. La idea es darle el adecuado mantenimiento a los cerdos para poder desarrollar animales de mejor calidad, y obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Kebelyn tiene varios años en este negocio de cría de cerdos. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Kebelyn B. B., 21, is single and doesn't have any children; she lives with her parents. She will use the loan to buy pigs to raise. The idea is to give them proper care so that they will develop into good quality animals that will command the best possible sale price when the time to sell them comes. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the loan terms she got. Kabelyn has worked raising pigs for several years. She hopes to provide her family with a better standard of living and greater economic stability in the future as well as to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise.

loans.name: Gerito Ramos

texts.pt:
Gerito Ramos pimpão nasceu no Distrito da Maganja da Costa, Província de Zambézia, centro de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 9, 7 e 3 anos de idade os 2 mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ele.
Saiu de Zambézia para Maputo quando foi incorporado no serviço militar obrigatório aos seus 18 anos de idade. 5 Anos depois foi desmobilizado e preferiu incorporar se no Ministério do Interior como Policia de Protecção permanente desde1993. Não possui nenhum empregado, tem um salário mensal de 4.030.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum de vez enquanto na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimos na cooperativa de crédito TCHUMA e decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku pela simples curiosidade de entender os moldes de empréstimos. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro e outros) para dar continuidade com ampliação da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 10.000.00mt para os dois e ambos para a mesma actividade.
No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais emprestimos para adquirir uma viatura, para ajudar no transporte pessoal.
texts.en:
Gerito Ramos Pimpão was born in Maganja da Costa District in Zambezia, center of Mozambique. He is 41, married and the father of three children ages 9, 7 and 3, the two older ones go to school. He finished 8th grade himself, but had to drop school for financial reasons. He lives in his own house with his family and also supports a nephew that lives with them. Gerito left Zambezia for Maputo when he was drafted into the army at 18. Five years later he left the army and became a policeman, activity he's been performing since 1993. He makes U$145 per month and he's able to support his household and save some in a savings account. This is Gerito's third loan in the amount of $475 which he'll use to buy construction supplies (cement, iron and others) in order to fix his house. His previous loans where for the same purpose. He hopes to pay this back on time and get another loan in the future in order to buy a car.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Dauwe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction Supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of food products

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Freddy es Chofer asalariado de trufi 88 Sindicato Eduardo Abaroa. Esta es su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de su familia: su esposa y sus dos pequeños hijos de 2 años y 8 meses de edad. Vive en alquiler ubicado en la zona cotahuma de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de motor  para el trufi con el que trabaja y que es su herramienta de Trabajo. 
 
Es primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para el préstamo solicitado por Freddy.
texts.en:
Freddy is a salaried "trufi" driver--a trufi is a van or other vehicle that carries passengers along a set route--and a member of the Eduardo Abaroa union. His income supports his family which includes his wife and two young children who are 2 years and 8 months old, respectively. He lives in a rented house in the Cotahuma neighborhood of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy an engine for the trufi, something that Freddy needs to work. This is his first Impro loan. An analysis indicates that he is a good candidate for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy engine for taxi business.

loans.name: El Rosario Group

texts.es:
La Alcancia Comunal EL ROSARIO cursa el ciclo 11 y tienen como objetivo el bienestar familiar, Celinda alquila maquinaria pesada, para trabajos D. campo ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales su dedicación es uno D. ellos ya que padece D. una discapacidad. El crédito lo usara para el mantenimiento D. sus maquinas y así poder alquilar en mejore precio y obtener mayores ganancias.
Maria se dedica al trabajo D. costura en un taller hace 2 años eso le permite pagar los gastos en casa además los fines D. semana ofrece otros productos que le generan ingresos extras.
Luis trabaja D. operario en una carpintería fabricando casas D. madera pero su objetivo es abrir una bodega y restaurant que le permite apoyar a su madre aunque el es soltero y no tiene carga familiar desea estudiar para ayudar a su familia.
El grupo agradece a todas las personas por el crédito.
About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty
texts.en:
The community group "El Rosario" is in its 11th loan cycle and its main goal is the families' welfare. Celinda rents heavy machinery that is used to work the fields. She is married and has four children, one of whom has special needs. She will use her loan for the machines' maintenance so that she can rent them at a higher price and make more profits. María is a seamstress and has had a workshop for the last two years. Her work allows her to maintain her household. On weekends, she sells other products to make extra money. Luis works as a carpenter making wooden houses, but his goal is to open a restaurant and bar; with this business, he will be able to support his mother. Although he is single and does not have a family of his own, he wants to study to help his extended family. The group thanks everyone for the loan. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío Narihualá, del distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura en la Región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos llevó a ella y a su esposo a trabajar en la venta de algarrobina (jalea hecha a base del fruto del algarrobo) y miel de abeja, actualmente ella ofrece este producto en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad de Piura y su esposo la ofrece en la ciudad de Chimbote. La algarrobina es preparada por ellos en sus casas y la miel de abeja la adquieren de los apicultores de la zona. Ambos productos son embotellados para luego ofrecerlos al público.

Eulalia ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, su primer crédito fue para ampliar su negocio con la compra de más miel de abeja para empezar a ofrecerla en otros distritos. Y actualmente se encuentra solicitando un nuevo crédito de 800 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de insumos con los cuales preparará más algarrobina.

Eulalia es una madre que día a día da todo de sí para seguir adelante y progresar junto a su familia. Ella se encuentra agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y nos comenta que gracias a su primer crédito pudo obtener mejores ventas y captar más pedidos de sus productos.
texts.en:
Eulalia, age 42, lives with her husband and their two children in the Narihualá village in the Catacaos district, Piura province, Piura region. It is located 3 hours and 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The desire to get her children ahead drove Eulalia and her husband to work selling “algarrobina” (jelly made from a base of carob fruit) and honey. She currently sells this product at the bus terminals in the city of Piura. Her husband sells it at the city of Chimbote. They make the algarrobina in their house, and they get the honey from beekeepers in the area. Both products are bottled to later be sold to the public. Eulalia has previously worked with a Kiva loan. She used her first loan to expand her business by purchasing more honey in order to start selling it in other districts. She is currently requesting 800 PEN to buy supplies for making more algarrobina. Eulalia is a mother who gives all of herself everyday in order to keep getting ahead and to progress together with her family. She is grateful for the Kiva loans. She tells us that, thanks to her first loan, she was able to have better sales. She was also able to get more orders for her product.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make carob fruit jelly

loans.name: Abdurasul

texts.en:
A. Abdurasul is an ordinary man from the town of Isfara in Tajikistan. He is a very responsible person who since his youth has been running a livestock farm with the goal of supporting his family, that is, his wife and three children. Abdurasul needs to purchase calves and goats to breed and maximize his profits by selling their milk and meat. Once he has these products from his flock, he sells them in his neighborhood and in this manner he is able to support his family. For this reason, Abdurasul is turning to you for the support that will permit him to continue developing his business.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing calves and goats in order to expand the business

loans.name: Lusica

texts.en: Lusica P. is from the village of New Tambo, Katipunan. She is 52 years old. Lusica is single. To make a living, Lusica makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling ice candy in the local community. Lusica has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Lusica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lusica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Lusica is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida R. is from the city of Ambalatungan Santiago. She is 41 years old. Zenaida is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Zenaida owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zenaida has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Zenaida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Zenaida is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Zenaida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: S. is a 28-year-old farmer and mother. She was blessed with two kids who are dependent on her income. S. has another financial earner in her husband who is a skilled producer of handmade wooden beds, from which he earns a living. Recently, S.’s husband received many orders for beds from his customers, but he lacks the supplies to meet his orders. Therefore, S. decided to ask for a Kiva loan for her husband to use to buy raw materials to make additional beds for his customers.

loans.use: To buy raw materials to make additional beds for his customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: expand her acreage and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ulyana

texts.en:
Ulyana is married with a teenage daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Mukachevo where she sells sportswear in one of the local markets called ‘Ilona’. Ulyana has been in the market for 16 years. Currently, she has 45,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her gross income amounts to 30,000 Grivnyas. 

Ulyana is requesting a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to increase seasonal merchandise and her turnover capital as a result. She can be characterized as a balanced and prudent entrepreneur. Ulyana never takes risks in business and prefers to stick to reasonable planning strategy. She is an experienced market vendor with many years of work in this sphere of trade. She is hoping to stay afloat for many more years to come.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Diola

texts.es: Diola, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos. El negocio al que Diola se dedica, es la venta de cubre camas, sabanas, cortinas y artefactos electrodomésticos de casa. Cada vez que sus clientes le soliciten determinados productos, Diola en seguida se va de compras al mercado mayorista de la capital para conseguir el producto en demanda. En ocasiones su esposo la ayuda en las comprar para poder abastecerse de mayor cantidad de productos para que no tenga contrariedades al momento de ofrecer a sus clientes. Se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza, hasta el momento tiene muchos compradores y eso le da mucho gusto por que sabe que así aumentaran sus ganancias. Ahora su mayor anhelo es el de instalar una bodega, por lo que tratará de acondicionar su casa ya que así no podrá descuidarse de sus hijos. Es su dieciochoavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se ha comprometido nuevamente es ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una maquina de coser, para apoyar a su hija que estudia corte y confección.
texts.en: Diola, who is 44 years old, is the very responsible mother of a family. She lives in her own house, along with her husband and 4 children. Her business is the sale of bedspreads, sheets, curtains, and electrical home appliances. Whenever her customers ask her for particular products, Diola goes to the wholesale market in the capital to get the products they requested. Sometimes her husband helps her with the purchases so that they can stock greater quantities of products to avoid disappointments when she offers them to her customers. She feels happy with the work that she carries out. So far she has had many customers, and she likes this very much because she knows that this way her earnings will increase. Now her big dream is to set up a shop, and she will try to prepare her house for this, since this way she will not have to neglect her children. This is her eighteenth loan with MFP, and she has promised again to be responsible in making her payments, since she finds this credit so helpful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is applying for, she will invest in the purchase of a sewing machine to help her daughter who is studying sewing and tailoring.

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine to help her daughter who is studying sewing and tailoring.

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal B. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 47 years old. Rosal is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Rosal owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products from Avon and Natasha. Rosal has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rosal joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosal has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosal is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Rosal from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is a member of the Communal Bank "Santiago The Patron Saint", located in the district Santiago de Pupuja, in the province of Azángaro, and the department of Puno. She is 33 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children. She studied until the second year of her secondary education.

Carmen has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was for the amount of 300 PEN, which she used to increase the capital of her business selling small animals.

She is now asking for a loan of 300 PEN, money that she will use to increase her business selling gelatin snacks, and her business selling small animals. 

Her dream is to have a position in the local market, and to have a house in Juliaca.

Her favorite part about working with the Communal Bank is the meetings, the training, and the workshops.

loans.use: To increase her business selling small animals.

loans.name: Dédé Imelda

texts.fr: dédé est une femme très dynamique, elle est célibataire. pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce des produits cosmétiques. elle a une ancienneté de 7 ans dans ce commerce, sa clientèle est composée en majorité de femmes. voulant mettre les chances de son côté pour accroître son revenu, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour gonfler son stock avec 3 cartons de crème, 2 cartons de mèches, des tissages et divers
texts.en: Dédé is an energetic single woman. To meet her needs, she started selling cosmetic products. She has worked in that business for 7 years and her customers are mostly women. To increase her chances of making more income, she is asking WAGES for a loan to be able to add 3 boxes of cream, 2 boxes of hair extensions, hair weavings and miscellaneous products to her stock.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Nuru-Lumu Group

texts.en:
Charity D. is in her mid-forties and is married with three children (in the picture, Charity can be seen in the back row wearing a yellow scarf). Charity runs both a general store as well as a poultry business in which she raises roosters. She has been in this business for the past six years. Charity's store is open between 12:30 P.M. and 10:00 P.M. and earns her a low monthly profit.

This will be Charity's third loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Charity used her first loan to increase the stock for her store, and she used the second loan to increase her rooster population. Both these loans have now been successfully repaid. With her third loan, Charity aims to buy more rooster chicks to further increase her rooster population to 200.

Charity will share this loan with her loan group Nuru-Lumo, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

loans.use: To buy more rooster chicks

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (two orphans).     Sarah has a takeaway food business.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.   Sarah sells her products from home by means of retail.  

Sarah has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of Irish potatoes, beef, chicken, cooking oil, and onions.  The main business challenges for Sarah include thieves and the rainy season.  Her aspiration for her business is to own a fully stocked hotel.  

Sarah lives in a home that she rents.  She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and rent.

loans.use: To buy potatoes, beef, chicken, cooking oil, and onions

loans.name: Marta Ester

texts.es: Marta Ester A. D. R. D. 62 años D. edad, resiD. en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como jornalero, y así mismo vive junto a dos nietos D. 14 y 6 años D. edad. Marta se dedica a la venta D. ropa para hombres mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa en el mercado D. San Juan Opico, en donD. posee muy buena clientela, por lo que sus ventas son muy estables. Marta solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. ropa, D. manera que pueda tener diferentes tallas, estampados y colores, los cuales le permitan aumentar sus ingresos y D. esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
62 year-old Marta Ester A. D. R. lives in Santa Tecla, in La Libertad department.  She lives together with her husband, who works as a day laborer, and also with two grandchildren aged 14 and 6.

Marta's business is selling men's, women's and children's clothes in San Juan Opico market.  She has a very good customer base which means that her sales are very stable.

Marta is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of clothes so that she can have different sizes, patterns and colors which will allow her to increase her income and thereby enjoy better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy clothes to stock her business

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Marta Raquel

texts.es: Marta Raquel R. D. G. D. 29 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador en donD. vive únicamente junto a su hijo quien se dedica a estudiar, su esposo se encuentra en Los Estados Unidos desD. donD. les envía una pequeña ayuda económica. Marta posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y D. primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica D. surtir su negocio, esto debido a que Marta no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy necesario tanto para ella como para su hijo, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar gran parte D. sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y otros productos más, los cuales son D. primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Marta espera mejorar las ganancias y D. esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
texts.en:
Marta Raquel R. D. G. is 29 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her school-aged son.  Her husband lives in the United States and, from there, sends them a small amount of financial aid. 

Marta owns and operates a store and sells fresh produce and staple goods out of one of the rooms in her home.  She plans to use the loan to buy more products for her business which is the main source of income for her and her son.  She would like to offer products such as detergent, canned goods, bread, sweets, beverages and other basic needs items that customers request.  She hopes to increase earnings and lead a more stable life.

loans.use: To buy fresh produce for retail sales

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian J. is a 21-year-old single woman. She does dairy farming in the Eldoret area and sells milk from the cows to her neighbors and dairy processing plants in her area. She has been in this business for nine years now and gets a monthly income of 22,000 KES.

This will be Lilian's first loan with KADET Ltd., and she plans to buy a dairy cow for milk production. With the income she will get, she plans to buy land for agricultural production so as to maximize profits. 

In the future, she wants to continue with dairy farming and also to diversify to maize farming.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for milk production and sales

loans.name: Mi's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members. It is located in Preaek Hour Lech village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Mi C. is the group leader. She was selected as the group leader by the other members. She is a vegetable seller in the market where she can earn a little income to support her family. With this business, she still earns less income than needed to support the family. So in order to increase her income and improve the family’s living conditions, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to expand her business activities. 
 
Mrs. Mi C. is 41 years old, and she is a widow with four children. Two of them are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a student, while the last one stays at home.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business activities.

loans.name: Marie Fe

texts.en:
24-year-old Marie Fe O. grows rice for a living. She tills her land and makes sure her crops are growing healthy. She hires some friends to help till her farm. Marie Fe desires to help her family financially. That's why she works hard to improve her earnings.

Marie Fe needs seeds and fertilizers. She also needs to pay for the labor of the people who helped work at her farm. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP that she will use for what she needs. This loan will truly help Marie Fe improve her business and earnings.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine L. is from the town of Rizal, Quirino, Isabela. She is 38 years old. Geraldine is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Geraldine owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Geraldine has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Geraldine joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Geraldine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Geraldine is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Geraldine from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Bismar Enrique

texts.es: Bismar Enrique tiene una pulpería. Su negocio consiste en ofrecer productos para el hogar, la mayoría de sus clientes solicitan una gran variedad de productos, por lo que él siempre está al pendiente de lo que ellos le están solicitando. El tomo la iniciativa de invertir en ciertos productos como granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos fue así que empezó y al observar que este medio de vida era rentable decide empezar con su nuevo negocio en su vivienda.   Este crédito es para la compra de ciertos productos que le solicitan como granos básicos, golosinas, enlatados, sopas, pan, galletas y detergentes. Sueña con tener un gran inventario en su negocio.
texts.en:
Bismar Enrique has a small grocery store where he sells household products.  His customers ask him for a wide range of products which means that he is always paying attention to what they are requesting.  Bismar took the initiative of investing in certain products such as basic grains, candy, soft drinks and that is how he started out.  He realized that this way of making a living was profitable and so decided to start his new business in his home.

Bismar will use this loan to buy certain products that his customers are requesting such as basic grains, candy, canned goods, soups, bread, cookies and detergents.  He dreams of his business having a large inventory.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, canned goods, soups, bread, cookies and detergents

loans.name: Monica Fiorella

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente tiene 2 hijos  menores de  8  y 2 años de edad,  vive en casa de su suegra desde hace 8 años, ya que su vivienda aun no esta construida,su cónyuge trabaja como operario en construcción, Monica se dedica a la venta de ropa como recorredora desde hace 2 años ella como toda joven tiene sueños y metas y uno de ellos es poder tener su propio puesto de ropa, Con el dinero surtira  su mercadería por cambio de estación.
texts.en:
26-year old Sra. Mónica has lived with her partner and their two children aged 8 and 2 in her mother-in-law’s house for eight years as her own house is not yet built. Her partner works in construction. 

Mónica has been selling clothing door-to-door for the last two years. Ever since she was a young girl, she has had dreams and goals. One of them is to own a clothing stall. With the loan she plans buy new stock appropriate for the time of year.

loans.use: to buy new stock appropriate for the time of year

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 24 años, vive sola en una casa arrendada.
Hace más de 4 años decidió tener su propia fuente de ingresos, ya que anteriormente había trabajado en una tienda de repuestos para autos, y gracias a la experiencia que ganó en dicho trabajo hoy decidió abrir su propia tienda de repuestos de autos, específicamente embragues.  Desde entonces vente estos repuestos de auto, en un local de ventas ubicado en una zona más comercial, y en ese mismo lugar lo ha convertido en su hogar, de esa manera cuida de estos repuestos. Actualmente le va muy bien en el negocio, además vende artículos para vehículos, de esa manera aumentaron sus ganancias, con ello ha logrado contratar los servicios de un mecánico que le ayuda a colocar los repuestos en los autos de sus clientes, cuando estos los requieren. Su mayor anhelo es tener un taller automotriz bien implementado y una local mucho más amplio porque ha visto que su negocio es rentable y seguirá trabajando para conseguir esa meta. Es su tercer crédito con MFP,  para ella esta solvencia es de mucha ayuda en la mejora de su negocio ya que le llega de manera oportuna por la cual esta muy agradecida y tiene el firme compromiso de responder puntualmente en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo utilizará en la compra de más repuestos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Evelyn is 24 years old and lives alone in a leased house. More than four years ago, she decided to establish her own source of income. She previously worked in a store that sold spare parts for cars, so thanks to the experience she gained there, she decided to open her own spare auto parts store, where she specializes in clutches. Since then, she has been selling spare auto parts from a storefront located in a commercial zone. She has converted part of the space into her home, so she can always take care of her business.

Her business is currently going very well. She also sells accessories for cars, which has increased her earnings. As a result, she has been able to contract the services of a mechanic who helps install the parts in her customers' cars when needed. Evelyn's greatest dream is to have a well-equipped auto workshop and a much larger space, because she has seen that her business is profitable. She will keep working to achieve this goal.

This is her third loan with MFP. She is very grateful for the credit, which arrived at the right time and has been a great help in improving her business. She is firmly committed to making her repayments punctually. She will use the requested loan to buy more spare parts wholesale.

loans.use: to buy spare auto parts

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Mrs. Meas currently lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is a rice farmer who can earn meager income. She uses her own farmland to plant crops following rainy season and dry season. From her farming business, she is able to make an income of approximately $1.50 a day to help support her family. She married but she divorced from her husband a few years ago and at this time, she lives with her three kids. All of them are working in various jobs and they always share some of their gross salary with Mrs. Meas every month. 

Her house is old and the walls are rotten, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to repair it. To deal with this trouble, Mrs. Meas is seeking a Kiva loan to buy planks to rebuild the walls. She plans to use any remainder to purchase piglets for feeding.

loans.use: to buy planks to rebuild walls and purchase piglets to feed.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single mother of one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past 2 years, Asha has operated a Khangas business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other Khangas sellers in the area. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the 15,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of Khangas for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of Khangas for sale

loans.name: Ebenezer Group

texts.en: Linda (in the middle) is 32 years of age and from the city Mutare, the capital of Manicaland province in Zimbabwe. She is single with one child, who attends school.  Linda runs a clothing business selling clothes and shoes as well as some electrical appliances. The business has been in operation for one year. She says overcoming the current slow pace of business is her main challenge. Linda has requested a loan of $400 to buy more clothes and shoes. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to buy a residential stand. In the future, Linda plans to own a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Rosini

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RICHARY ANTEÑA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosini; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de repuestos de tractor, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m y también la socia tiene un negocio de venta de helados, ella reparte a las diferentes tiendas que venden helados, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de helados y comprar repuestos de tractor. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar repuestos e insumos para preparar los helados.
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank “RICHARY ANTEÑA.”  The bank is located in Anta District, which belongs to the province of Anta and Cusco Department.

The member is Sra. Rosini.  She is 40 years old, lives with her partner and has 3 children.  She divides her day between her household duties and her business selling spare tractor parts.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00pm.  Sra. Rosini also has a business selling ice cream.  She distributes her ice cream to various ice cream stores.  She wants to expand her ice cream business and to purchase spare tractor parts.  She is requesting the loan to purchase the spare parts and to buy ice cream making supplies.
                                                      
The member is happy with the loan and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and ice-cream making supplies.

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, single and lives with five family members. Three of the family members work.

Zaman has had a barber shop since 2007. He has more than eight years experience and has a deep understanding of the local consumer. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting an $1,800 loan to renovate the outside of his shop and to buy a generator. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To renovate the outside of his shop and to buy a generator.

loans.name: Margarita Cortona

texts.en: Margarita Cortona is 66 years old and married with four children. One of her children still lives with her while he studies in University and the others live separately. Margarita worked as a docent but currently she is unemployed. She is asking for a loan in order to help pay for her son's University tuition. Her son is 22 years old and attends the National University of San Antonio Abad Cusco. She is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for her children's education

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children. For eight years, she has been operating a retail shop.  She also does farming to earn extra income for her family.  In addition, she owns rental houses. Being a member of Faulu Kenya, she has benefited because she has boosted her business with her previous loans. Florence hopes that one day; she will open a wholesale business.  She has requested 40,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and detergents.

loans.use: To buy sugar, maize flour and detergents

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis was born in the Dominican Republic, but came to the United States for the opportunity to live a better life and build a business. Less than a year ago, he founded an organization that provides non-food products to hospitality businesses, educational institutions and restaurants. Luis is the owner, partner and only employee, and operates business from home. He also works full-time as an IT professional at a shipping management company.

Luis is still in the early stages of forming his business and is now working on advertisements and visits to local hospitality establishments on weekends in order to get the word out about his unique services. He is committed to provide products to the hospitality industry quickly and inexpensively. 

He will use the loan to buy inventory as well as a desktop computer and a laptop to expedite orders. Luis also plans to invest in accounting software in order to manage sales and profits more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy inventory, a desktop computer and laptop to use the field.

loans.name: Manuel Alexis

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su esposa, sus padres y un hermano, en su familia todos trabajan; él es empleado de un banco, su horario es de 8:00am a 7:00pm, él está por segunda vez solicitando un préstamo que esta hoy lo necesira para la reparacion de una motocicleta, que le permita desplazarse a su trabajo con mayor facilidad.
Este préstamo le ayudara para tener más accesibilidad al trabajo, ya que será una inversión que le ayudara para transporte. El objetivo de Manuel es poco a poco a través de préstamo ir mejorando su calidad de vida y en un futuro tener su propio hogar.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his wife, his parents, and his brother.  In his family everyone works.  He works at a bank from 8AM to 7PM and is requesting, for the second time, a loan that would be used to repair his motorcycle which allows him to get to work with ease.  
This loan would help him have better access to his employment since the investment would aide in his transportation.  Manuel's objective is to use loans little by little to steadily improve his quality of life and in the future have his own place.

loans.use: to repair a motorcycle for personal use.

loans.name: Mana

texts.fr:
Mana est une femme âgée de 35 ans. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant de 20 ans qui n’est pas scolarisé.  
Mana travaille comme revendeuse de cartes de rechange depuis l’an 2000. Elle sert tous les clients dans l’enceinte du Centre Médicaux Social d’Agoé. Elle achète les produits dans les agences de télécommunication du Togo. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence rude sur le marché. 
Mana a requis son cinquième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des cartes de recharge. Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Mana voudrait pérenniser son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit construire une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Mana is a 35-year-old woman. She is single with a 20-year-old child who has not had schooling.
Mana has been working as a retailer of phone recharge cards since 2000. She serves all her customers inside the Medical Social Center of Agoè. She gets her products from the telecommunication agencies of Togo. She works alone.

At this time her main problem is the tough competition in the marketplace. Mana has requested her fifth loan cycle from WAGES to purchase recharge cards. She wants to reinvest her profits into her business activity.
In coming years, Mana would like to carry on her business. She says that with the profits earned, she plans on establishing a happy family.

loans.use: buy phone recharge cards

loans.name: Kristelle Lira

texts.en:
Kristelle Lira is married with one child to care for. Kristelle Lira is 25-years-old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

To earn a living she sells personal products such as fashion jewelries, sun glasses, cellphone cases, and more. She loves fashion and new trends and that entices her to engage in such activity. She has been operating this site for two years and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to obtain more personal products to sell.

Kristelle Lira is a new member of the cooperative. In the future, Kristelle Lira hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to be able to widen the facility and product offerings to attract more customers. She plans to procure trendy items to meet the market's current demands.

loans.use: To obtain more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Jose Matias

texts.es:
