Her work schedule demands much effort, starting at 6pm and finishing around 1am. During this time, there is a great demand for prepared foods in this location. Rosa hopes to continue working and desires to get a stable job as a cook so that she can quit street vending and live a quiet life.

Rosa has worked with MFP on 30 previous loans. This has helped her develop her business and build a good support team with her fellow communal bank members with whom she is very accustomed to working. She will use her loan of 2000 soles to repair her mobile food cart so that she can work normally and continue selling her prepared dishes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her mobile food cart

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: mareme D. est parent beneficiaire de la zone de camberene depuis 2003.elle est surtout specialisee dans le commerce de tissus principalement ,de chaussures et d'autres produits divers.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour augmenter son fond afin de mieux diversifier les produits qu'elle commercialise.son objectif est de satisfaire sa clientele d'accroitre ses benefices et de mieux participer a soutenir son mari a l'entretien de la famille.
texts.en:
Mareme D. has been a parent beneficiary in the Camberene zone since 2003. She specializes mainly in the sale of cloth, shoes, and various other products. She is seeking a loan of 100,000 CFA to increase her funds in order to better diversify the products that she sells. Her goal is to satisfy her customers, increase her profits, and better participate in supporting her husband in providing for their family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell goods

loans.name: Hae Bofo Group

texts.en: Mary is 55, divorced and has three children. She works very hard to be able to provide for the family. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Oda in the Eastern region of Ghana. Mary is a trader and the leader of a trust bank group called “Hae Bofo”, which literally means creator of light. The members in this group are mainly engaged in trading activities. They normally sell in their community market and trek to sell in other communities as well. They procure their stocks from Accra and nearby towns. The experience these traders have amassed over the years has given them the urge to expand their business scope, hence the need for the loan to buy goods in bulk to realize this dream. The group leader, Mary, is on the left in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is fifty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Wiawso is a commercial and farming town. She is a trader. Elizabeth trades in utensils. She sells at the local market and hawks to sell in her community. She also treks to other towns to sell. Elizabeth buys her goods from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy all kinds of utensils in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.en:
Vitaliy is married with two adult children. He has a retail business selling vegetables and animal food. He has a large storage place next to his home and sells his products right outside his gates. Vitaliy has been in this business for ten years. He has a very good business location—by a busy road—and many repeat clients. Vitaliy uses his truck to buy and transport the produce.

Vitaliy is requesting a loan of 11,124 UAH to buy more produce for sale. It is the high season for sales now, and he wants to take advantage of it to increase his profits. His ultimate goal is to purchase a newer and bigger truck to help him further develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase more produce

loans.name: Shafiqullah

texts.en:
This is Shafiqullah, the 25-year-old son of M.. He lives in the 16th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. Despite the fact that he is so young, he has a great deal of responsibility to help care for his family members. He lives with his family, which consists of seven people, including his father and mother. He explains that he is the oldest son in his family.

Shafiqullah owns and operates a general store where he sells a variety of products. He is seeking a loan in the amount of 50,000 Afghani ($1,025) to purchase additional, high-quality materials for his shop. In fact, his ultimate goal as it pertains to this loan is to attract more clients and to be able to purchase products which are in high demand. In turn, he hopes to continue to make needed changes to his business. He is confident that he will repay this loan on time, and he expects to apply for a second loan soon after he fully repays this loan in the near future. He would like to extend his deep gratitude to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional, high-quality goods

loans.name: Joyce Angelina

texts.en: Joyce Angelina M. is married to a banker and has three children. She has been through commercial school. Since 1999 Joyce Angelina has been selling second-hand textiles, such as towels, bedspreads and curtains, at Elmina market. She uses her profits to support her husband in paying the utility bills and children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bails of second-hand textiles. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and reinvest into the business.

loans.use: To buy bails of second-hand textiles

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam, 39 years old, is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a commercial driver. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She sells groceries in her retail stall to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time and hopes to own a super market in the future.  Marian is requesting a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more groceries for sale. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for sale

loans.name: Thigingi

texts.en:
Thigingi is married with a six-month-old daughter. For the last five years, he has run a business selling Safaricom mobile phone airtime scratch cards wholesale. He also runs a food kiosk. Thigingi was previously employed as a sales representative for Safaricom. He describes himself as hardworking and industrious. Due to Faulu's training, Thigingi says he has become focused on business and started saving.
Thigingi has requested a loan for 20,000 KES from Kiva partner Faulu to purchase scratch cards in values higher than 250 KES each. In the future, he would like to be a registered reseller with Safaricom and expand to branches elsewhere in Nairobi.

loans.use: To buy mobile phone airtime scratch cards for resale

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len S., 47, is married and lives with her three children and husband (pictured) in Siem Reap Town, Cambodia. She is a housewife. Since 2001 her husband has operated his motorbike as a taxi, earning an income of 7 USD per day by providing his services at a local market in town.

Len is requesting a loan of 1000 USD, her second loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner. Because her husband’s old motorbike often breaks down and consumes a lot of gasoline, she would like to buy a new motorbike for her husband.

Len and her family members would like to improve their standard of living and generate more income. With a new motorbike, Len’s husband will be able to attract more customers and so make more money. In the future, Len hopes she will be able to send the children to a good school and become a motorbike dealer herself.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike.

loans.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina C. is from the village of Magsaysay Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Magdalina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Magdalina plants and harvests rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $157 a month from this activity.

In 2010, Magdalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Magdalina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her venture. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sharifkhudja

texts.en:
H. Sharifkhudja is 26 years old. He lives in Isfara town. Sharifkhudja processes and sells dried fruits in the local central market. He is experienced in the business of making dried fruit. He purchases fruit from local farmers at a wholesale price, and after processing sells it to his customers. 

Because Sharifkhudja buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Sharifkhudja to make his business quite successful and it brings in a stable income for his family. 

Currently, he needs a loan of $1200 to buy supplies so he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Sharifkhudja expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy supplies for his dried fruit business.

loans.name: Sherlyn Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Sherlyn y tiene este nombre porque la hija de la presidenta que tiene un mes de nacida se llama así.  Está ubicado en la comunidad de El Refugio en el estado de Hidalgo de México.  El grupo está conformado por  11 integrantes y es la 1ra vez que realiza un crédito con CrediComún. 

Mercedes M. A. es la presidenta del grupo. Tiene 25 años, estudió hasta el 6to año, es de clase media-baja y tiene en total 2 hijos (mujeres).  Ella se dedica a la venta de recaudería y abarrotes que inició hace 1 año. Se solicita el préstamo para invertir un poco más en abarrotes. Sus clientes piensan que vende la fruta y verdura más fresca de la localidad.  Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se siente con el gran compromiso para con la empresa de no fallar en sus pagos.   Quiere este crédito para acrecentar su negocio hasta convertirse en una tienda grande.
texts.en:
This group is called SHERLYN, and is named after the president's one-month-old daughter. The group is located in the community of El Refugio (The Refuge) in the state of Hidalgo, Mexico. It is composed of 11 members and this is the 1st time they have requested a loan through CrediComún. Mercedes Martínez A. is the group's president. She is 25 years old, attended school through the 6th grade, is from the lower middle class, and has 2 daughters. For the last year, her store has collected district taxes as well as selling groceries. She requests the loan to invest in some more groceries. Her customers think she sells the freshest fruit and vegetables in the locality. Upon requesting the loan she expressed an obligation to her business not to fail in her payments. She needs the loan to expand her business, which she hopes to make larger.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING FRUITS, VEGETABLES, AND GROCERIES TO SELL

loans.name: Agnes Habel

texts.en:
Agness is separated from her spouse and is the mothet of two children, Habel and Fumbi. She has been selling charcoal for two years now in Maweni-Malindi and earns a monthly profit of Kshs 16,000. She also supplies coconuts in Malindi town.

Agnes was introduced to Kadet by her sister and she joined. She has applied for a loan, which she will use to buy sacks of charcoal, purchase coconuts in bulk and set up a store. She hopes to start building on her newly-acquired plot with the extra income from this loan.  

Agness is a woman who describes herself as aggressive and determined to achieve her dreams of building a complete residential house on her new plot.

loans.use: To buy sacks of charcoal and coconuts in bulk, and to set up a store

loans.name: Jeremias Valentim

texts.pt:
Jeremias Valentim N. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província do mesmo, sul de Moçambique tem 35 anos de idade casado e pai de 3 filhos de 16, 14, 10 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 9ą classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca mudou de cidade, apenas saiu de um bairro para outro quando formou a sua família. Tem um negocio próprio há mais de 8 anos, conta com 2 empregados que lhe ajudam no seu negocio. Consegue um rendimento de rendimento de cerca de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Já teve empréstimo com o Banco Oportunidade e decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é seu 2º empréstimo no valor 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos e outros) para reforçar a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na obra de construção da sua residência e aplicar outros no seu negócio.
texts.en:
Jeremias Valentim N. was born in the city and province of Maputo, which is in the south of Mozambique. He is 35 years old, and is married with 3 children who are 16, 14, and 10 years old. All of his children attend school. He attended through 9th grade himself, but did not continue due to a lack of finances. He lives in his own home with his family and does not support anyone else. He never moved from the city, but he did move from one neighborhood to another when he started his family.

He has had his own business for more than 8 years and he has two employees who help him. He earns a monthly income of about 9,000MT which he uses to pay for his household expenses and saves some to his bank account. He had a previous loan with the Banco Oportunidade, but decided not to continue with them. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of the institution. This is his second loan, for 20,000MT, and he plans to use it to purchase products (beer, soft drinks, and others) to reinforce his merchandise. The previous loan was for 12,000MT and was used for the same purpose. He promises to make his repayments dutifully so that he may take out other loans. In the future he would like to use additional loans for construction in his home and for his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products like beer, soft drinks, and others

loans.name: Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Kosar is a 38-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in the small city of Raiwind in Pakistan. She has a two-roomed brick house where she has been living with her family for the past 15 years.
Kosar is a very enthusiastic lady. She operates a business embroidering dupattas (a garment worn with traditional dresses in Asian countries). She embroiders them and then sells them at the clothes markets. She does this work to support her husband, M. N. Khan, who works in a dairy business. He gets milk from his dairy cow and sells it to milk shops. He earns approximately 15,000 PKR per month. Kosar is applying for a loan to buy another dairy cow to expand her husband’s dairy business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Help Your Self Group

texts.en:
Oretha W., 45, is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Help Yourself. She did not have the opportunity to go to school due to poverty. She is involved with the sale of charcoal and has been doing this business for the last 21 years. Her business is located in Paynesville, on the outskirts of Monrovia. She started this business through the help of a family member. She is married with seven children whose ages range from 12-23 years old and are currently in school. She also helps to take care for two siblings.

The challenge she faces is that there are so many vendors selling charcoal in the market. Oretha plans to use her 5,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more charcoal to improve the business. Her goal is to improve her family's standard of living.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Oretha is holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

Join the Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal.

loans.name: Cristo Vive 1,2 Group

texts.en:

loans.use: to buy women's and men's shoes, skirts, pants and shirts to sell

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Juliette N. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de Vélingara dont elle fait partie des membre du comité de gestion depuis 6 ans et demi. Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes, de sucre cristallisé, de jus de fruits naturels et d'huile de palme. Son crédit lui permettra de mieux s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de se procurer plus de bénéfices afin de soutenir son mari dans les différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Juliette N. is a 46-year old woman who is married and mother to seven children who are in her care. She is a member of the Banc Villageois for Catholic women in Vélingara, and she has been a member of its management committee for six and a half years. She is developing a small business selling vegetables, crystallised sugar, natural fruit juices and palm oil. Her loan will allow her to get supplies more easily in order to procure a profit for herself and help her husband out with the different family expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her income-generating activities

loans.name: Luningning

texts.en:
Luningning T. is an optimistic businesswoman who knows that she will overcome all challenges and achieve her dreams. As a busy woman, Luningning is a determined entrepreneur.  With this loan, Luningning will purchase additional fish to sell and other raw materials of her fishing business.  

A model member of ASHI, Luningning has achieved strong performance with regular attendance at group meetings and timely loan repayments.  As a hard working businesswoman, she is thankful for the opportunity to earn income independently. Her long-term goals are to have a successful fish farm business, to fund the college education of her 5 children, and support her family economically.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial venture.

loans.use: Purchase of additional fish to sell
